value: Evergreen rounded shrub (1.5m x1.5m). Form of A. x grandiflora from China. Glossy dark green leaves with yellow variegation. Bell shaped white flowers tinged with pink followed by persistent coppery brown sepals. Prefers a sheltered sunny position. Useful as a screen; clipped hedge or contrast in shrubbery. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen rounded hybrid shrub with arching branches (2m x 2m) from two Chinese species. Glossy dark green leaves. Bell shaped white flowers tinged with pink followed by persistent coppery brown sepals. Useful as a screen; clipped hedge or contrast in shrubbery. Remove old woody stems. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen upright coniferous tree with a conical crown maturing to a dome shape (25m x 8m) from southern USA. Glaucous green narrow curved leaves bluish hue beneath; crowded on top of the twigs. Cylindrical purplish green cones ripening to brown. Useful specimen for large cool climate gardens. Prefers light loamy moist soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen slow growing grafted coniferous tree (5m x 2m) with corky bark from Arizona and New Mexico. Blue grey leaves. Cylindrical blue cones. Useful specimen for small gardens and courtyards or mixed with other conifers. Prefers a cool climate mountain climate. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen slow growing grafted coniferous tree (12m x 6m) with a conical habit becoming columnar with age from Spain and Morocco. Blue grey stiff needles arranged radially around the branchlets. Cones with a short pointed tip. Useful feature or focal point for its colour contrast and distinctive shape. Prefers full sun in a cool mountain climate. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen pendulous shrub (2m x 2m) from China. Lobed maple-like light green leaves often variegated with white and yellow. Lantern-like buds open to solitary pendulous bell shaped flowers in shades of red; pink; yellow; white and pastel tones. Useful specimen for a warm position protected from hot afternoon sun. Prefers consistently moist well drained soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen dense pendulous large shrub or small tree (6m x 3m) from Qld and NSW. Long narrow phyllodes. Sweetly scented yellow ball flowers in spring. Useful as a specimen or screen. Prefers well drained moist soil in full sun. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen fast growing small tree or shrub (8m x 5m) from New South Wales. Silver grey finely divided foliage. Pendulous sprays of yellow ball-shaped flowers in winter and spring. Useful for foliage contrast and as a screen. Purple foliage form available. Can be short-lived. Potential weed in Sydney bushland. Avoid use near bushland areas. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen small tree with deeply fissured dark grey bark (10m x 7m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone). Silver grey sickle shaped phyllodes with a furry texture. Cylindrical bright yellow flowers in spring. Useful as a screen; windbreak or specimen. Suitable for coastal locations. Toxic to livestock. Frost tolerance not tested. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen rounded shrub (2.5m x 3m) from NSW. Light green feathery bipinnate leaves. Bright yellow ball shaped flowers in spring. Useful for a feature; screen; for soil binding or revegetating degraded sites. Prostrate form available. Needs well drained soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen compact mound shaped low growing shrub with weeping foliage (0.8m x 1.2m). Dwarf form of A. cognata from NSW and Vic. Soft slender lime green leaves. Cream ball shaped flowers occasionally. Useful as a specimen for its handsome foliage. Needs good drainage. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen erect shrub with an arching habit (2.5m x 2m) from NSW and Qld. Grey triangular phyllode leaves. Golden yellow ball shaped flowers in spring. Useful screen or feature for its grey foliage. Needs well drained soil in full sun. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld & NSW (Sydney Wianamatta Shale & Cumberland Plain zones); Vic & SA)

Evergreen erect tree with a closed crown (10-15m x 5m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney Wianamatta Shale and Cumberland Plain regions); Vic; SA & Tas. Dark green compound fern-like leaves. Fragrant yellow ball shaped flowers. Useful as a fast growing screen; windbreak or feature tree. May be short-lived. Susceptible to borer attack. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (NSW (including rainforest pockets in Sydney) & naturalised in Qld & Vic.)

Evergreen straight tree (up to 20m) from NSW (including Sydney rainforest pockets) & naturalised in Qld & Vic. Large dark green bipinnate leaves. Cream ball shaped flowers in summer. Useful as a fast growing screen; windbreak; feature or shade tree. Suited to gully locations. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen tall open shrub with a slender trunk (4m x 2m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Blue-green falcate pyllodes. Cream ball flowers in winter. Useful as a screen; for soil binding or revegetating degraded sites. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (including Sydney Blue Mountains) & Vic)

Evergreen erect tall shrub or slender tree (8-10m x 3m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney Blue Mountains) and Vic. Curved blue green phyllode leaves. Cream ball shaped flowers in spring and early summer. Useful as a screen; small tree; for soil binding or revegetating degraded sites. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen small tree or rounded shrub (6m x 5m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney Cumberland Plain). Narrow lanceolate light green phyllode leaves. Globular lemon yellow perfumed flowers in late winter to spring. Useful as a dense screen. Tolerant of damp conditions. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen dense shrub (1.5m x 1.5m). Dwarf form of A. fimbriata from NSW (including Sydney Cumberland Plain). Thin phyllodes edged with a fringe of tiny hairs. Fragrant globular lemon yellow flowers in spring. Useful as a screen or informal hedge. Tolerates damp conditions. Prune to retain bushy form. Drought and frost tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney on sheltered slopes and gullies) & Vic.)

Evergreen tall bushy shrub or small tree with pendulous branches (4m x 2.5m) from Qld; NSW (Sydney on sheltered slopes and gullies) & Vic. Narrow-elliptical phyllodes. Loose pendulous spikes of pale yellow flowers in spring. Useful as a fast growing screen; windbreak; specimen & erosion control. Dwarf form available. Tolerates periodic water-logging. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen dense large shrub with weeping habit (6m x 5m) from Vic. Dark green slightly sticky phyllode leaves. Pale yellow perfumed flower balls in spring. Useful as a quick growing specimen; dense screen or hedgerow. Tolerates hard pruning and wide range of soils. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen slender small tree or shrub with a suckering habit (10m x 4m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney) and Vic. Sickle shaped phyllodes with parallel veins. Cream ball-shaped flowers in summer. Useful for a screen or soil binding on banks. Prone to leaf gall. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen large weeping shrub (4m x 2m) from South Australia. Long narrow grey-green leaves mauve tipped when young. Yellow perfumed flowers in winter. Useful for a hot dry position as informal hedge or feature plant. Prefers well drained soil. Tolerates light frosts and moderately salt tolerant. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen sparsely branched arching shrub (2m x 1.5m) from NSW (including Sydney). Soft small linear dark green pyllode leaves. Terminal heads of globular cream flowers in summer and autumn. Useful quick growing screen. Tolerates shade and wide range of soils. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen large erect shrub (4m x 2m) from NSW (including Sydney on sandstone soils) and Vic.. Light green stiff phyllodes. Golden yellow flower spikes in the leaf axils in spring. Useful for a fast growing screen and mass planted for soil stabilization. Susceptible to borer attack. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney in sandstone coastal gullies) & Vic)

Evergreen small to medium sized spreading tree (10m x 6m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney sandstone coastal gullies) and Vic. Drooping gently curved leaf phyllodes. Pale yellow rod-like flowers in summer. Useful screen or specimen for an informal setting. Frost tolerant.
Indigenous (NSW (Sydney Illawarra region); Vic; Tas & SA)

Evergreen quick growing tree (10m x 6m) from NSW (including Sydney Illawarra region); Vic; Tas & SA. Dark green bipinnate leaves and fine leaflets. Pale yellow ball shaped flowers in spring. Useful fast growing specimen or screen. Susceptible to borer attack and often short lived. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.
Indigenous (Gully and slope locations Qld; NSW (Sydney); vic; Tas & SA)

Evergreen variable tree (10-30m x 5-10m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney in sheltered forests); Vic; Tas & SA. Broad lanceolate phyllodes. Cream ball shaped flowers in spring. Useful as a feature or shade tree. Prefers moist composted soil in a gully or slope location. Best in high altitudes. Susceptable to borer attack in warm climates. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (including Sydney) Vic; SA; Tas & WA)

Evergreen compact shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic; SA; Tas and WA. Elliptical dark green phyllodes on reddish stems. Cream ball flowers in spring. Useful for a low screen or hedge or amongst other shrubs. Hardy. Tolerates poor soil. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen medium sized tree (10m x 6m) from NSW (including Sydney). Bipinnate dark green leaves with fine leaflets. Globular heads of pale yellow flowers in summer. Useful for a fast growing screen or background tree. Suitable for both sand and clay soils. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen tall shrub or small tree (6m x 5m) from Qld and NSW. Silvery grey oval phyllode leaves with a felt-like texture. Ball shaped clusters of yellow flowers in late winter and spring. Useful as a quick growing screen or specimen for its contrasting leaf colour. Needs well drained soil. Prefers dry climate. Sensitive to sooty mould in humidity. Invasive potential. Avoid use near bushland areas. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen tall slightly pendulous shrub or small tree (5m x 3m) from NSW; ACT and Vic. Triangular dull green phyllode leaves. Lightly perfumed yellow ball flowers in spring. Dwarf cultivar 'Little Nugget' (1m x 0.5m). Useful screen; low windbreak; background or tall understorey particularly in a bush garden. Needs well drained soil. Tolerant of poor soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergeen tall erect shrub or small tree (6-8m x 4-5m) from NSW (including Sydney). Slightly grey green lanceolate leaves. Yellow ball shaped flowers in spring. Useful fast growing screen. Prefers well drained soil in full sun with ample moisture. Tolerates partial shade. Frost tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney); Vic; Tas and SA)

Evergreen open erect shrub (3m x 2m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic; Tas and SA. Pale green thin textured leaf phyllodes. Bright yellow globular flowers in spring. Useful screen; specimen or grouped to cover low maintenance areas. Prefers full sun and well drained soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen slim graceful shrub with angular flattened branches (2m x 1m) from Qld; NSW; (Sydney on sandy soils). Bluish grey narrow phyllodes with pinkish new growth. Perfumed cream flower balls in autumn and winter. Useful shrub for its long flowering period and perfumed flowers. Salt spray tolerant. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen dense shrub (2.5m x 1.5m) from NSW (including Sydney); Vic & SA. Dark green pinnate leaves. Cream to deep yellow ball flowers in autumn and winter. Useful for a screen or amongst other shrubs. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen spreading shrub with weeping branches (3m x 3m) from NSW. Small hairy triangular blue-grey phyllode leaves. Bright yellow ball shaped flowers in spring. Useful feature; screen or informal hedge for its graceful form and foliage contrast. Tolerates heavy soils. Prune after flowering to maintain compact form. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen vigorous perennial groundcover (0.05 x 0.8) from New Zealand. Glaucous blue leaves divided into leaflets. Heads of small blue flowers with spiny brownish green bracts followed by brownish red burrs. Useful groundcover for the front of a border or rock or gravel garden. Needs well drained soil. Tolerates poor soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.
Indigenous (Qld; Vic; NSW (Sydney Cumberland Plain); Tas; SA & New Zealand)

Evergreen variable prostrate or mounded tufted groundcover (0.4m x 0.7m) from Qld; Vic; NSW (including Sydney Cumberland Plain); Tas; SA and New Zealand. Pinnate leaves with silky hairy toothed leaflets. Globular heads of green flowers with red prickles followed by reddish burrs. Useful groundcover for poorly drained areas. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen bushy shrub (2m x 2m) from Vanuatu. Large oval serrated leaves coloured coppery green with red splashes. Red flowers in terminal spikes. Useful for foliage contrast and as a background plant and suitable for tropical themed gardens. Prefers a warm sunny position. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen erect herbaceous perennial (1.2m x 1.2m) from the Mediterranean region. Giant deeply cut dark green glossy leaves. Tall spikes of funnel shaped mauve and white flowers in summer. Useful as a groundcover in shaded positions and in clumps for the dramatic effect of its foliage and flower spikes. Good for a neglected corner. Spreads rapidly. Attracts snails. Frost sensitive. Moderately drought tolerant but prefers ample water.

Deciduous fast growing spreading tree (15m x 8m) from North America. Bright green compound leaves with 3-5 oval leaflets. Inconspicuous greenish yellow flowers in late spring. Useful as a shade tree or windbreak. Tolerant of both dry and wet soils. Invasive potential. Avoid use near bushland areas. Invasive root system. Avoid planting close to structures. Frost and drought tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Deciduous small tree (6m x 3m) from China; Japan and Korea. Palmate deeply lobed light green leaves in spring deepening in summer and becoming orange; red or yellow in autumn. Useful as a shade or feature tree. Prefers well drained fertile acid soil. Avoid wind exposure. Minor invasive weed potential in Blue Mountains zone. Many variable forms available. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Deciduous upright tree with a rounded crown (20m x 10m) from North America. Palmately tri-lobed dark green leaves turning bright red in autumn. Tiny red flowers on bare branches in spring. Useful shade tree or specimen; for autumn colour in a large garden. Prefers moist acidic soil in full sun. Tolerant of periodic wet or dry soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Upright perennial (1m x 0.6m) from the Caucasus. Aromatic silvery green fern-like leaves. Large flat heads of long lasting bright yellow flowers in summer. Useful specimen or massed in the perennial garden. Cut back to basal leaves after flowering and before first frosts. Needs well drained soil. Tolerates poor soil. Avoid fertile moist soils. Protect from wind. Drought tolerant.

Upright perennial (0.8m x 0.8m) with running rhizomes from Europe. Toothed dark green glossy leaves. Large heads of small pompom-like flowers in summer. Useful for quick growing cover in a perennial garden. Cut back to basal leaves after flowering and before first frosts. Tolerates poor soil. Avoid fertile moist soils. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen dense tree (12m x 6m) from rainforests and gullies in Qld; NSW (including Sydney) and Vic. Thick; dark glossy green leaves with pink new growth. White fluffy flowers in summer followed by edible plump purple berries. Useful as large screen or shade tree. Tolerates shade and heavy soils. Prefers some protection from frost. Moderately drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen dense shrub (3m x 2m). Dwarf form of Acmena smithii from Qld; NSW and Vic. Small dark glossy green leaves with pink new growth. White fluffy flowers. Useful as a clipped or informal hedge; screen or specimen. Resistant to attack by Psyllid insect. Tolerates light frosts.

Semi-evergreen clump forming perennial grass (0.25m x 0.2m) from Europe; China and Japan. Narrow stiff dark green leaves with cream variegation. Inconspicuous flowers. Useful for its foliage as a groundcover in shaded gardens; bog gardens; at water's edge or in water gardens of up to 0.1m depth of water. Prefers consistent soil moisture. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen short lived shrubby perennial (0.5m x 0.4m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone). Soft silvery grey much divided leaves. White daisy-like flower heads with soft flannel-like bracts in spring and summer. Useful in pots or in garden areas with excellent drainage. Prefers sandy soil. Create raised beds in heavier soils. Avoid root disturbance. May self sow in favourable conditions. Drought and frost tolerant.
Indigenous (Widespread Australia (Sydney); Lord Howe Is; New Zealand & Africa)

Evergreen small tufted fern (0.5m x 0.4m) from Australia (including Sydney); Lord Howe Is; New Zealand and Africa. Lacy fronds on slender glossy black stems. Useful as a potted plant; near a water feature or as undershrub or groundcover in partial to full shade. Needs a moist position. Tolerates light frosts. Drought sensitive.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney rainforests & wet woodland); Vic & New Zealand)

Evergreen erect vigorous fern with long creeping underground rhizomes (1.2m x 2m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney rainforests and wet woodland); Vic and New Zealand. Erect dark green fronds on shiny black zigzag-like stalks. Useful specimen or grouped for a warm sheltered position or protected fernery. Suitable pot plant. Prefers composted well drained acid soil in dappled light. Frost tolerant. Drought tolerant in favourable growing conditions. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney); Vic; NT; New Zealand; Malaysia; India & Africa.)

Evergreen small upright tufted fern with very short rhizomes (0.4m x 0.3m) from Vic; NSW (Sydney); Qld; NT; New Zealand; Malaysia; India and Africa. Rough textured fan shaped palmate fronds with characteristic rough stripe. Pink young fronds mature to a bronze green colour. Useful for damp shaded positions; in association with a water feature or container plant. Prefers compost rich soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Erect branching succulent shrub (0.8m x 1m) from Morocco. Branched stems each crowned by a rosette of spoon shaped glossy dark purple leaves. Cones of small yellow star-shaped flowers on 2-3 year old stems which then die. Useful specimen or group planted for the rock or gravel garden; border or pot-plant. Require excellent drainage. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen short lived perennial (0.3m x 0.3m) from the Middle East. Narrow blue green leaves. Loose sprays of tiny pale to deep rose pink flowers in spring and summer. Useful for a raised bed or gravel garden. Needs well drained sandy soil in full sun. Sensitive to high humidity. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen clump forming perennial. (0.6m tall) from South Africa. Long strap shaped leaves. Flowers blue or white bell shaped held in a ball at end of erect 1m stem in summer. Useful for bank stabilisation; border edges and mass planting. Dwarf forms available. Minor invasive weed potential near bushland. Moderately salt tolerant. Drought tolerant and moderately frost tolerant.

Evergreen basal rosetted perennial succulent (1.5m x 1.5m) from Mexico. Soft green to grey green pointed leaves with felty texture on a short stout stem when young forming a leaning trunk with age. Yellowish flowers on arching stems may take more than 10 years to appear. Useful for foliage and form contrast and containers. Minor invasive weed potential near bushland areas. Very drought tolerant. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen succulent rosette forming perennial (0.4m x 0.3m) from Mexico. Thick grey green leaves edged in white with a spiky black point. Cream flowers rarely seen. Useful for a rock or gravel garden; pot plant or mixed with other succulents. Requires excellent drainage in full to partial sun. Container grown specimens prefer to be rootbound. Avoid watering during winter. Minor invasive potential. Monitor for weediness near bushland areas. Moderately frost tolerant. Drought tolerant.

Moderately fast-growing annual (0.3 m x 0.3 m) from Mexico. Oval green leaves with serrate margins. Terminal clusters of mauve; pink or white brush-like flower heads in summer. Useful for edging in flower beds where its short stature can be appreciated. Prefers full sun to light shade in a warm position. Tip prune and remove spent blooms to maintain bushy habit. Remove and discard plants in autumn. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen spreading tree with weeping habit (10m x 10m) from Western Australia. Aromatic linear and leathery leaves; bronze when young. Small white flowers along stems in spring and summer. Useful feature tree for coastal areas. Tolerates light frosts. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen dense shrub with upright habit becoming more pendulous with age (2m x 2m). Cultivar of A. flexuosa from WA. Linear lanceolate leaves with pinky red new growth. No flowers produced. Useful as a clipped or informal hedge or screen. Frost sensitive.

Cool season perennial turf grass spreading by stolons from Europe and Asia. Fine soft leaf blade with prominent veins on the upper surface on prostrate long slender stolons. Useful if requiring high quality turf with smooth surface and uniformity such as a putting green or tennis court. Requires high maintenance including regular irrigation; fertilizing; herbicide and pesticide application; de-thatching and top dressing. Prefers regular mowing with 15mm cutting height. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen mat-forming perennial groundcover (0.3 x 1m) with creeping stolons from the United Kingdom. Rounded spoon shaped green leaves with a purple underside. Erect short spikes of blue flowers in whorls in spring and summer. Useful as a groundcover or border in shady locations. Prefers a moist position in partial to full shade. Many cultivars available. Can be susceptible to fungal disease in high humidity. Divide every few years to reduce crowding and fungal occurrence. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen twining climber (3m) from china and Japan. Palmate leaves of five leaflets. Loose pendant sprays of fragrant mauve grey or purple flowers in spring. Useful for growing on a fence or pergola. Prefers full sun. Tolerant of poor soils. Frost and drought tolerant.

Deciduous spreading tree (8m x 5m) from Asia. Fine fern-like foliage divided into many leaflets. Clusters of puff-like pink flowers in summer. Useful as a quick growing shade tree. Drought and pollution tolerant. Moderately frost tolerant.
Non indigenous (Uncertain; probably Asia & Mediterranean region)

Evergreen, short-lived, tall, erect biennial (1.5 m x 0.6 m) from uncertain origin probably Asia and Mediterranean region. Large shallow-lobed, rough-textured and hairy leaves. Long flower spikes in shades of pink,red, yellow,purple and cream. Useful for a border background,against walls ascut flowers and to add height contrast and old world charm to cottage gardens. Prefers a sheltered full sun position. Foliage susceptible to rust and insect damage. Planting in background helps to hide foliage. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen low growing perennial (0.5m x 0.5m) from Europe and Asia Minor. Lobed fan shaped pale green leaves with crinkled wavy margins. Small sprays of tiny bright greenish yellow flowers with conspicuous outer calyces; in summer. Useful groundcover for a rock garden or front of a border. Prefers well drained soil in partial shade. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.
Indigenous (Qld and NSW (including Sydney Illawarra region))

Evergreen rounded shrub (3m x 2m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney Illawarra region). Leathery shiny prickly holly-like leaves with flushes of red new growth. Insignificant flowers followed by brown capsule fruit. Useful screen or understorey plant in rainforest plantings. Prefers a shady position in well composted soil. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant in favourable conditions. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Perennial clump forming herb (0.25m x 0.3m) from Europe and Asia. Long cylindrical leaves tapering to a point on slender hollow stems. White elongate bulbs. Mauve flower heads in summer. Useful in the vegetable or herb garden for its distinctive flavour. Prefers a full sun position. Prune plants hard regularly. Drought and frost tolerant.
Indigenous (Vic & NSW (Hawkesbury Sandstone & Blue Mountains regions))

Evergreen large shrub or small tree (4m x 2m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone and Blue Mountains regions) and Vic . Needle-like dark green leaves on slightly pendulous branchlets. Abundant male flower spikes giving the whole plant a bronze appearance in spring. Cylindrical cones with a pointed apex. Useful as a windbreak or ornamental. Bird attracting. Tolerates a front line coastal position. Very tolerant to salinity. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen erect rounded tree with deeply fissured bark (10m x 3m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic & Tas. Pendulous branches with leaves reduced to triangular scales around the stem. Cylindrical cones. Useful as a shade tree or windbreak particularly on infertile soils. Tolerates some salt spray. Frost tolerant. Drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld & NSW (Sydney Wianamatta Shale and Hawkesbury Sandstone regions))

Evergreen conical tree with deeply furrowed bark (15m x 5m) from Qld & NSW (including Wianamatta Shale and Hawkesbury Sandstone regions of Sydney). Pendulous branches with leaves reduced to triangular scales around the stem. Warty barrel shaped cones. Useful mass planted in groves; as a screen or windbreak or good feature tree. Bird attracting. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen conical tree with weeping habit (8m x 7m) from NSW; Vic; Tas & SA. Grey; needle-like foliage on pendulous branches. Inconspicuous flowers and oval woody cones. Furrowed bark as tree matures. Useful for coastal areas as windbreak or screen. Hardy and frost tolerant.

Evergreen tree spectacular in flower (10m x 6m) from Queensland. Glossy green adult leaves with lobed juvenile leaves. Clusters of bright red flowers towards the ends of branches in spring and summer. Useful as a feature or screen. Bird attracting. Slow to establish. Needs well composted soil and ample water. Frost sensitive but can tolerate light frosts. Drought sensitive.
Non indigenous (High altitude rainforests of Qld & NSW)

Evergreen tree (12m x 7m) from high altitude rainforests of Qld & NSW. Pinnate leaves. Loose terminal heads of pinkish red flowers in late spring. Useful as a feature. Bird attracting. Needs deep well composted soil protected from sun and wind. Slow to establish. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen spreading tree (10m x 6m) from Mexico. Shiny light green leaves with a serrated margin. Cream coloured separate male and female flowers on the same tree. Useful as a dense screen in a large garden. Prefers moist fertile soil. Potentially invasive root system. Avoid planting close to structures. Tolerates mild frosts only. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen lily-like perennial (1.5m x 0.8m) from rainforests of NSW and Qld. Very large spade shaped leaves on long fleshy petioles. Perfumed greenish cream flower in summer followed by red berries. Useful around water features. All plant parts are poisonous. Needs damp well composted soil in more than half shade. Frost and drought sensitive .

Evergreen spreading succulent shrub (2-3m x 2m) from South Africa. Stems each crowned by rosettes of bluish grey green leaves with toothed edges. Long stems of bright red to orange or yellow tubular to bell shaped flowers in winter. Useful accent for a rock or gravel garden; pot plant or mixed with other succulents. Suitable for coastal gardens. Tolerant of salt spray and high temperatures. Prefers well drained soil. Tolerates light frosts only. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen succulent shrub (3m x 1.5m) with leaves forming a large rosette from South Africa. Fleshy leaves with heavily spined margins. Erect spike of bell-shaped orange-scarlet flowers in spring. Useful for plant tubs; pebble or rock gardens and for contrast in foliage and form. Many hybrids available. Potental weed in bushland. Drought and frost tolerant.
Non indigenous (Endemic to the Maluti Mountains Lesetho Africa)

Evergreen stemless rosetted succulent perennial (0.6m x 0.6m). Endemic to the Maluti Mountains Lesetho Africa. Broad grey green leaves with dark sharp tips form a perfect spiral arrangement either clockwise or anticlockwise. Compact clusters of dull red to salmon-pink flowers in spring. Useful specimen for its curious formation or clumped with other succulents. Suitable for a pot plant. Sensitive to temperatures greater than 30 deg.C. Prefers a position with morning sun protected from the hottest afternoon sun. Needs perfect drainage. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen succulent clumping perennial (0.6m x 0.6m) from South Africa. Thick pale green leaves with white speckles and sharp toothed margins forming stemless rosettes. Purplish branched stalks of tubular orange; yellow or red flowers in summer. Useful specimen for a rock or gravel garden; pot plant or mixed with other succulents. Forms offsets freely. Divide crowded clumps periodically. Invasive weed potential. Avoid use near bushland areas. Suitable for coastal gardens. Tolerant of salt spray and high temperatures. Prefers well drained sandy soil. Tolerates light to medium frosts. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen, short-lived, bushy perennial often grown as an annual (0.6 m x 0.3 m) from Peru. Oval-toothed, deep-green leaves on slender-branching, red stems. Bright scarlet-red flowers in summer and autumn. Useful colour accent in groups for mixed borders or bedding areas. Prefers well drained soil in full, to partial, sun. Frost and drought sensitive.
Indigenous (In or near rainforests of NT; Qld; & NSW (Sydney))

Evergreen to semi-deciduous spreading tree with a grey trunk (12m x 8m) from in or near rainforests of NT; Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Narrow to elliptical leaves shiny green on top silvery grey and hairy below. Clusters of insignificant small cream flowers in autumn followed by globular black fruit. Useful as a well shaped shade tree. Prefers well drained soil. Frost tolerant. Drought tolerant in favourable conditions. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen clumping perennial with thick erect to arching stems from a creeping rhizome (1.5m x 1m) from NSW and Qld. Large green leaves with red underside. Terminal inflorescence of white flowers followed by edible blue globular fruit. Useful grouped as a foliage feature; in association with a water feature or tropical themed garden. Needs well composted soil in partial to heavy shade. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen upright clump forming perennial (3m x 1m) from India. Long leaves variegated with irregular stripes of green and yellow. Long pendant arches of white flowers pink tipped in summer. Useful grouped as a foliage feature especially in a tropical themed garden. Prefers fertile well drained soil in partial to heavy shade. Potential to invade bushland. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen rounded shrub with erect branches (2m x 1.5m) from SA and WA. Lobed leaves with coarse texture. Lilac Hibiscus-like flowers in summer. Useful for hot well-drained positions. Prune after flowering. Tolerates only light frosts. Drought tolerant.

Annual grown for its brilliantly coloured foliage (1 m x 0.4 m) from Tropical America. Green lower leaves. Upper leaves purple; red; yellow and green. Insignificant flowers. Useful for contrasting foliage colour as a feature or background. Edible leaves. Tolerates heat and poor soil. Sensitive to root rot if kept too moist. Frost sensitive.

Bulbous semi-erect perennial (0.7m x 0.5m) from South Africa. Fleshy strap-like basal leaves appear after flowering. Perfumed pink trumpet shaped flowers grouped on a leafless erect stem in autumn. Avoid root disturbance. Drought and frost tolerant

Evergreen clump forming perennial (0.3m x 0.3m) from NSW and Qld. Silver grey leaves. Papery white flowers with yellow centres on branched winged stems. Useful clumped for its floral display and cut for dried flowers. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Tolerant of poor soil. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen low growing perennial (0.4m x 0.2m) from the Mediterranean region. Narrow ovate leaves. Solitary deep blue flowers with reddish centres in summer. Many cultivars with variable colour available. Useful for a rock or gravel garden; edging or pot plant. Needs well drained soil in a sheltered full sun position. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen biennial often grown as an annual (0.2 m x 0.2 m) from South Africa. Long narrow leaves; rough and hairy when touched. Red buds opening to shallow bowl-shaped, sky blue flowers in early summer. Useful for a flower bed,border or pot plant. Prune back after first flower flush to encourage second flush. Tolerates poor soil. Needs well-drained, moist soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen trailing cushion forming perennial (0.15m x 0.2m) from the Himalayas. Woolly silver green leaves and trailing reddish shoots. Delicate pink or white flowers with red or yellow eyes. Useful for the rockery or perennial garden or to trail over low garden walls. Prefers a sunny position in moist well drained soil. Drought sensitive. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen vigorous branching perennial (1m x 0.6m) from Japan. Deeply divided dark green leaves. Long stems of shallow cup shaped white or shades of pink flowers in late summer to early autumn. Useful mass planted as a groundcover or border. Tolerates a damp situation. Prefers a semi shaded position. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Annual herb (1m x 0.5m) from Europe. Bluish green compound leaves on hollow finely grooved stems. Flat umbels of yellow flowers in summer. Useful in the herb or vegetable garden for the distinctive flavour of its leaves and seeds. Pick young leaves before flowering. Prefers moist fertile soil. Sow seed insitu in succession from spring through to midsummer. Self seeds in favourable conditions. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Semi-evergreen mound forming perennial (0.6m x 1m) from New Zealand. Overlapping arrangement of glossy almost succulent pinnate leaves. Flat headed clusters of greenish white flowers in summer followed by green seed heads. Useful for foliage texture in the perennial garden or border. Tolerates sun and shade. Prefers moist well drained fertile soil. Self sows in favourable conditions. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen compact tree with rough bark (10m x 5m) from NSW (including Sydney). Narrow lanceolate leaves. Profuse cream flowers in summer. Useful as a shade or feature tree. Prefers well-drained soil. Frost sensitive and moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen smooth barked tree with variable growth habit from pyramidal with a straight trunk to a branching habit with twisted limbs (12-25m tall) depending on its position from Qld and NSW (including Hawkesbury Sandstone regions of Sydney). Old bark sheds in spring with new bark pink turning grey before next shedding. Lanceolate leaves with red tipped new growth. White; showy eucalypt-type flowers in large bunches in early summer. Useful for coastal areas and as a shade or windbreak tree in very large gardens. Sensitive to poorly drained soils. Potential to drop limbs. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen medium spreading tree with fibrous bark and gnarled and twisted upper limbs (20m x 8m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney) & Vic. Narrow eucalypt-like leaves opposite on the stem. White flowers in spring. Useful for a shade or feature tree. Prefers a gully or slope location with deep moist well drained soil. Sensitive to wind. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen twisted shrub or small tree (2.5-5m x 3m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone region). Stem clasping rough and hairy broad light green leaves. Large sprays of white flowers in summer. Useful mass planted or as a feature for its form. Insect and bird attracting especially jewel beetles. Prefers sandy soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen branching and clump forming perennial (0.5m x 0.2m) from WA. Narrow upright sword-like leaves. Deep red tubular flowers resemble 'a paw' and are covered with dense hair. Useful for vertical accent in perennial gardens; borders; mass planting and cut flowers. Attracts spine-billed birds. Plant in raised beds or containers if drainage is poor. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen clump forming perennial with erect and branching stems (0.5m x 0.5m) from Europe. Grey green fern-like crinkled leaves. Yellow daisy-like flowers on terminal stems throughout summer. Lemon flowering form E.C. Buxton. Useful for coastal areas and perennial gardens. Avoid water logged soils. Prune after flowering. Frost and drought tolerant.

Deciduous tendril climber (3m) from Central America. Heart shaped crinkly leaves on slender stems. Dense sprays of rose pink flowers in summer. Useful for light cover over a fence; trellis or pergola. Prefers fertile well drained moist soil in a warm protected position. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen, erect annual or perennial (0.8 m x 0.5 m) from Europe. Soft, green, lanceolate leaves. Two-lipped, tubular flowers in broad colour palette of white, yellow, orange, pink, red, purple or bicolour in spring and summer. Useful for flowerbeds and cut flowers. Many cultivars available. Prefers fertile soil in a well-drained, sunny position. Protect from strong winds. Tip prune and remove spent flowers to encourage branching and extend blooming. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Biennial stem vegetable usually grown as an annual (0.4m x 0.3m) from Southern Europe. Fleshy branched stems becoming better branched; more tender and smaller towards the inner branches. Dark green glossy pinnate leaves with wedge shaped leaflets. Useful in the vegetable garden for its edible fleshy stems. Requires fertile well drained moisture retentive soil with high nitrogen levels. Suited to a cool climate with low humidity. Stems require light reducing blanching with paper collars to retain tenderness. Tolerates light frosts. Drought sensitive.

Fast growing succulent groundcover (0.05m x 1m) from South Africa. Oval glossy green leaves. Daisy-like bright pink flowers in summer and autumn. Useful as a groundcover in harsh conditions. Prefers an open sunny position. Avoid over-watering and fertilizing. Invasive potential. Avoid use near bushland areas.Tolerates poor soil. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Clump-forming, short-lived perennial often grown as an annual (0.6 m x 0.5 m) from Europe. Fernlike, grey-green leaves. Stems of numerous, bell-shaped, spurred flowers in shades of white, pink, red, mauve and variations of these colours in spring and summer. Useful for colour in the perennial garden, as a border or in clumps. Single and double forms available. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen upright conifer with pyramidal growth habit (more than 30m x 8m) from Norfolk Island. Needle-like incurved leaves spirally arranged on regularly spaced horizontal branches. Useful as a shade tree or landmark in very large coastal gardens. Very tolerant to salt spray. Drought and frost sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Single stemmed palm (13m x 4m) from Qld. Pinnately divided fronds with silvery grey underside. Fronds fall with age leaving a smooth clean trunk. Cream flowers and bright red fruits. Useful planted in clumps for a tropical effect. Prefers a protected partly shaded position and fertile soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Single stemmed palm (13m x 4m) from Qld and NSW. Pinnately divided fronds; fall with age leaving a smooth clean trunk. Lilac flowers and bright red fruits; often hidden in the foliage. Useful planted in clumps for a tropical effect. Prefers a protected partly shaded position and fertile soil. Moderately frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen, compact perennial or annual (0.2 m x 0.4 m) from South Africa. Silver green leaves. Daisy-like flowers in shades of pink, orange, yellow, white, cream, red and multi-coloured in summer. Useful for colour in beds, drifts or as a border. Needs good drainage. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen woody short lived bushy perennial (0.9m x 1.5m) from the Canary Islands. Deeply cut and lobed leaves. Many white; pink or yellow daisy-like flowers with yellow centres throughout summer. Useful for cut flowers; fast growing colour or a perennial border. Needs a sunny position. Tip prune frequently and replace plants every few years. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen fast growing woody stemmed twining climber (5m) from Brazil. Heart shaped leaves on long stalks. Twisted reddish purple flowers marked white and yellow and resembling a pipe. Useful for covering a fence or structure in warm coastal gardens. Prefers well drained moist soil. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen low growing tufted clump forming perennial (0.1m x 0.2m) from northern Europe and Greenland. Stiff grass-like leaves forming rosettes. Globular clusters of small white or mostly pink flowers in spring and summer. Many cultivars available. Useful for edging; at the front of a border; in the rock garden; in wall pockets or massed for groundcover. Prefers dry well drained soil in an open sunny position. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen erect perennial (0.3m x 0.6m) from Qld and NSW. Dark green narrow ovate leaves. Bright blue or violet tubular flowers in the upper leaf axils in summer and autumn. Useful as a rockery specimen or bedding plant. Prefers well drained soil in a sunny position. Tolerates shade. Tolerates light frosts only.

Evergreen spreading perennial (1.2m x 1.5m) from the Mediterranean region. Aromatic lacy silver grey leaves. Small insignificant yellow flowers in summer and autumn. Useful clipped hedge or accent plant in a mixed border or perennial garden. Tolerates salt spray and salty soil. Prefers well drained soil. Moderately frost tolerant.

Perennial herb (0.6m x 0.3m) from Europe. Strongly aromatic leaves with variable form on erect and branching stems. Terminal clusters of yellow or white flowers in spring. Useful in the herb or vegetable garden as a culinary herb. Prefers a sunny protected site with fertile well drained soil. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen bushy perennial (0.5m x 0.3m) from North America. Narrow pointed pale grey woolly leaves. Insignificant yellow flowers on 50cm tall stems in late summer. Useful for foliage texture in a perennial garden. Prefers a sunny well drained position. Prune after flowering. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen clump forming perennial (0.8m x 0.8m) from New Zealand. Broad strap-like leaves. Long stems of white star-like flowers with purple and yellow stamens in summer. Useful for borders or groundcover particularly in coastal gardens. Protect from the hottest sun. Attracts snails. Tolerates dry shade and drought. Frost sensitive.
Indigenous (NSW (Sydney Cumberland Plain); Vic; SA; Tas & Qld)

Evegreen tufted perennial (0.3m x 0.3m) from SA; NSW (including Sydney Cumberland Plain); Vic; Tas and Qld. Grass-like leaves. Small perfumed flowers with purple markings. Edible roots swollen at the tips. Useful for a rock or gravel garden or understorey particularly for a bush garden. Suitable for a clay soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen clumping perennial (0.7m x 0.5m) from China. Long dark green blade-like leaves on short petioles Useful for any position in shade including deeply shaded areas and as groundcover under trees and containers. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen rosette forming epiphytic fern (1m x 1m) found in trees along creeks and in rainforests from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic and Pacific Islands. Long light green fronds with black midrib and wavy margins radiating from central point. Useful as an understorey plant or in a tropical themed garden for its interesting form and texture. Good container plant. Prefers filtered not direct sunlight. Frost and drought sensitive. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney rainforests); Vic; Tas & New Zealand.)

Evergreen small trailing fern (0.3m x 0.4m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney rainforests); Vic; Tas and New Zealand. Slender light green thin textured fronds with small fan-shaped leaflets. New plantlets forming on the tips of prostrate fronds. Useful small groundcover for a fern garden or protected position in partial shade. Suitable pot plant. Prefers moist composted well drained soil in dappled light. Frost tolerant. Drought tolerant in favourable growing conditions. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen clump forming perennial (0.6m x 0.5m) from China; Korea and eastern Siberia. Compound basal leaves with toothed hairy dark green leaflets. Dense fluffy spikes of tiny star shaped white flowers flushed with pink; rising above the foliage on slender upright stems. Useful massed or grouped in shade gardens or shady areas of borders and edges. Needs fertile moist soil. Prefers a cool mountain climate or well protected from hot afternoon sun. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Neat compact shrub (0.8m x 0.8m) from NSW (including Sydney); Vic & Tas. Crowded needle-like leaves. Tubular flowers in spring; red or yellow at the base with a green tip followed by green edible berries. Useful as a small feature shrub; for a rockery or understorey. Not widely cultivated and can be short lived. Must have well drained sandy soil. Prefers partial shade. Frost tolerant and drought sensitive.

Evergreen short lived compact mat forming perennial (0.15m x 0.4m) from southeastern Europe and Turkey. Greenish grey leaves. Masses of star-like mauve pink flowers in spring. Many cultivars available. Useful for training over walls; at the front of a border or groundcover for a small area. May need replacing every few years. Prefers well drained fertile soil in a cool mountain climate. Sensitive to heavy soils. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen low spreading shrub (0.5m x 1.5m) from Qld and North Eastern NSW. Glossy dark green lanceolate leaves with coppery coloured new growth. Small white flowers in summer followed by edible white berries covered in small blue black spots. Useful as an understorey plant; for mass planting or low informal hedge. Prefers a semi-shaded position. Drought sensitive. Protect from severe frosts.

Low growing warm season turf grass forming dense sods and spreading by stolons (0.4m) from West Indies and Central America. Narrow soft smooth blunt leaves. Persistent filiform flower stalks often visible during growing season. Useful as low maintenance utility lawn and for erosion control. Easily established with minimum seed- bed preparation. Often seen as weed in fine turf lawns. Preferred cutting height 25-35mm Tolerates infrequent mowing. Fertilise once a year in summer. Avoid excessive fertilising. Frost sensitive. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen bushy shrub (2m x 2m) from the Indian mountains. Dark green oval leaves on woody and branching stems. Clustered funnel shaped single or double flowers in variable shades of white; pink and red. Useful for mass planting; as an understorey or feature plant. Prefers filtered sunlight and an acid soil. Mulch to protect surface roots. Very sensitive to salinity. Susceptible to lace-fly leaf damage and Petal Blight fungus. Drought sensitive. Tolerant of mild to moderate frosts.

Group of evergreen shrubs (0.3-1m x 0.3m-1m) from Japan. Short woody branching stems. Small narrow leaves. Profuse small funnel shaped flowers in shades of pink; red; mauve or purple in spring. Many varieties available. Useful specimen or understorey particularly for a cool mountain climate. Needs fertile well drained acid soil in a protected partial shade position. Sensitive to limey soils. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Group of deciduous Azalea shrubs (1.5m x 1.5m) from China. Lanceolate dark green leaves turning orange and red in autumn. Funnel shaped flowers in colours ranging from yellow; orange to red. Many varieties available. Useful specimen or understorey particularly for a cool mountain climate. Needs fertile well drained acid soil in a protected full sun position. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen compact tree (9m x 5m) from Queensland. Strongly lemon scented leathery; glossy lanceolate leaves. Umbel-like clusters of white flowers in summer. Useful as a feature or shade tree or screen as foliage is dense to near ground. Slightly frost sensitive and drought sensitive.

Evergreen spreading large shrub or small tree (6m x 5m) from rainforests in NSW and Qld. Dull dark green broad lanceolate leaves. White flowers in summer with persistent greenish sepals. Useful as a hardy background plant or host for epiphytic orchids. Prefers a sunny to dappled shade position in fertile soil. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen small erect shrub (0.6 x 0.5m) from swampy areas of NSW (including Sydney) and Qld. Small rounded leaves crowded and overlapping on the stem. Solitary and stalkless white flowers in the leaf axils. Useful for poorly drained locations. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydny; sheltered positions on Hawkesbury sandstone) & Vic)

Evergreen pendulous shrub (2m x 2m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney) and Vic. Narrow needle-like leaves with a pointed apex. Small white flowers in the leaf axils in summer. Useful as a feature or mass planted in wet locations and around water features. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.
Indigenous (NSW (Sydney - damp sheltered places on Hawkesbury Sandstone); NT; Vic and New Caledonia.)

Evergreen large bushy shrub (3m x 2.5m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone in damp sheltered places); NT; Vic and New Caledonia. Dark green narrow-oblong leaves. White tea-tree-like flowers in summer. Useful as a screen; specimen or background plant. Dwarf form B. virgata 'La Petite' available. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.
Indigenous (All states of Australia (including Sydney) except WA)

Evergreen creeping tussock forming perennial (1m x 0.5m) from all states of Australia except WA (including Sydney). Slender bright green divided branchlets lightly weeping. Rusty brown flowers produced on the tips in spring. Useful for bogs and ponds or anywhere where it may be periodically inundated. Prefers a shady moist position. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Semi deciduous vigorous upright clumping (non running) bamboo (10m x 1m)) from China. Striking yellow culms striped green. Useful as a specimen; privacy screen or pruned for a tall hedge. Sensitive to poor drainage and requires ample water. Remove 2 to 3 year old culms and trim to height as required. Potentially invasive root system. Avoid planting close to structures. Frost and drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen upright clumping non invasive bamboo (4m x 1.5m) from southern China and Japan. Small fern-like leaves on yellow striped green culms. Useful for a narrow screen; hedge; specimen or pot plant. Tolerates partial shade or full sun. Prefers moist well drained soil. Frost sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen upright dense clumping bamboo with nodding tips (6m x 1.5m) from southern China. Vertical culms with long internodes. No leaves or branches on the lower half followed by masses of large long green pointed leaves. Useful as a windbreak; tall screen and dust or audio barrier. Tolerates poorly drained soil. Roots moderately invasive. Avoid planting close to structures. Tolerates light frosts. Drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen dense bushy shrub (4m x 3m) from NSW (including Sydney). Bright green linear leaves crowded on the stem. Cylindrical bottlebrush-like orange flowers in autumn and winter. Useful screen or feature particularly for coastal gardens. Bird attracting. Very tolerant to salinity. Needs well drained soil but tolerates poor fertility. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen tree (15m x 4m) from Qld; Vic & NSW (including Sydney) coastal areas. Leathery wedge shaped to oblong leaves; dark green above; grey below. Erect cone-like spikes of lime green to yellow flowers. Useful as a screen or shade tree particularly in exposed coastal areas. Bird attracting. Very tolerant to salinity. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen variable shrub (4-6m x 3m) from NSW (including Sydney); ACT; Vic; Tas and SA. Narrow oblong leaves blunt at the tip with white velvety texture below. Yellow cylindrical flower spikes from summer to autumn. Useful as a screen or feature plant. Attracts honeyeater birds. Dwarf forms available. Prefers well-drained sandy soil. Frost & drought tolerant.

Evergreen open multi-stemmed shrub often forming a lignotuber (2m x 2m) from NSW (including Sydney) and Qld. Stiff leathery variably toothed leaves with new growth covered in thick rusty felt. Cylindrical flowers in shades of blue grey in bud opening to yellow in autumn and winter. Needs a sunny well drained position. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen upright shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Large leathery leaves with rusty felt-like under surface. Blue green buds opening to cylindrical yellow-green flower spikes in summer. Useful as an accent plant or mass planted in a wet sandy position. Bird attracting. Tolerates well drained clays. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen tree (6m x 4m) often with gnarled and twisted form and corrugated rough textured bark from Tas; Vic & NSW (including Sydney). Oblong leathery saw-toothed leaves. Cylindrical grey green flower spikes turning purplish brown then aging to grey brown with protruding woody seed capsules. Useful as a small shade tree and as a feature for its interesting form. Very tolerant to salinity. Prefers infertile sandy soils. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen rounded compact shrub (2m x 2m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney on sandy soils) & Vic. Linear to oblong variably toothed leaves with a notched apex. Orange yellow cylindrical spike flowers in autumn and winter. Useful for mass planting and as a feature shrub. Bird attracting. Tolerant of salt spray. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen small tree (8m x 4m) from Qld and northern NSW. Heart shaped shiny green leaves. Large dense sprays of orange yellow pea flowers in early summer. Useful as a specimen in warm coastal gardens. Requires well drained fertile soil. Frost and drought sensitive.
Indigenous (NSW (Sydney; moist sheltered places); Qld; Vic; Tas & Kangaroo Island)

Evergreen variable compact to straggly shrub (1.5m x 2m) from coastal Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic; Tas & Kangaroo Is. Bright green trifoliate leaves. Pink or white single rose-type flowers throughout the year with flushes in spring and autumn. Useful for mass planting as a taller groundcover; understorey or with other shrubs. Prefers moist well drained sandy soil but tolerates periodic water-logging. Prune back one third annually to maintain shape. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen erect compact shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) from Vic. Trifoliate leaves appearing as a whorl of six leaflets on the stem. Deep pink flowers in the leaf axils. Useful as an understorey; specimen or planted in groups. Prefers well drained soil and a semi shaded position. Sensitive to high humidity. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen semi-climber (3m) from China. Small green bilobed leaves on reddish hairy stems. Loose clusters of pink orchid-like flowers in spring and autumn. Useful for a trellis where its fine texture can be admired. Prefers a sunny protected position and well drained soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen sprawling shrub or semi-climber (2m x 2m) from South Africa. Leaves two lobed. Large loose sprays of fragrant bright brick red flowers in spring. Useful in larger gardens as a specimen shrub or for its clambering habit to cover pergolas or other structures. Prune to maintain as a shrub. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Deciduous tree (10m x 5m) from India; Burma and China. Leaves entire to midpoint then divided into 2 lobes. Terminal sprays of rose-purple flowers in winter. Useful as a shade tree in coastal areas. Prefers acid sandy soil. Drought and frost sensitive.
Indigenous (NSW (including Sydney) Qld; Vic; SA; WA; New Zealand & New Guinea)

Perennial sedge or wetland grass with rhizomes (1-2m height) from lagoons and swamps in NSW (including Sydney) Qld; Vic; SA; WA; New Zealand and New Guinea. Thick hollow chambered shiny mid green stems tapering to a tip. Leaves reduced to papery sheaths at the base of the stems. Large; dense; drooping inflorescences with reddish brown spikelets. Useful for bog areas or wetlands in water less than 1m deep. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.
Indigenous (NSW (Sydney); Qld; SA; WA; NT; NZ; New Caledonia & SE Asia)

Perennial rigidly upright sedge or wetland grass (1m height) with spreading rhizomes from NSW (including Sydney); Qld; SA; WA; NT NZ; New Caledonia & SE Asia. Compressed slightly twisted needle-like leaves. Clusters of spikelets arising from the stem bracts. Useful for damp areas; a bog garden or wetlands in water less than 0.5m deep. Tolerant of brackish water and shade. Good soaker of nutrients. Tolerates poor soil. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen slow growing shrub developing a bulbous shape at the base (1.5-3m x 1.5m) from Mexico. Slender green recurved leaves in rosettes at the end of bare branches. Small white insignificant flowers. Useful for its contrast of form and often grown in containers. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant

Evergreen, mounded, succulent perennial often grown as an annual (0.3 m x 0.3 m) from South America. Green, bronze or variegated leaves on soft, fleshy stems. Axillary clusters of pink, red or white flowers in summer and autumn. Useful for colour as a border. Can bemassed or planted in window boxes or containers. Prefers a partly shaded position protected from strong winds. Sensitive to high heat exposure. Frost and drought sensitive.

Low-growing, carpeting annual (0.15 m x 0.2 m) from Britain. Finely-hairy, oval, green leaves. Terminal and solitary white or pink daisy-like flowers in spring and early summer. Useful for a low border, bedding or rock garden. Prefers well-drained fertile soil. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen sprawling shrub (1m x 1m) from Mexico. Green lanceolate leaves. Salmon coloured bracts with tiny white flowers between. Useful in shrubbery for its unusual flower. Requires a warm position. Needs regular pruning to maintain shape. Frost sensitive.

Deciduous arching dense shrub with spines (2m x 2m) from Japan. Purple-red leaves turning bright red in autumn. Cup shaped red tinged pale yellow flowers in spring followed by black berries. Useful as a clipped hedge; barrier or amongst shrubs for the contrast of its foliage. Hardy. Prune annually to maintain shape. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen clump forming perennial with above ground rootstock (0.3m x 0.3m) from Asia. Large rounded heart shaped green leaves. Open cup shaped rose pink flowers in panicles well above the foliage in winter and spring. Useful as a groundcover. Prefers a shaded protected position. Can attract snails and slugs. Drought sensitive. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen succulent clump forming perennial (1m x 2m) from Mexico. Greyish green leaves forming a rosette. Spikes over 2m of tubular bright red flowers. Useful as accent for its contrasting form and colour. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Deciduous broadly columnar graceful tree with silver white bark (8-15m x 4- 6m) from Europe. Oval to heart shaped leaves turning yellow in autumn on slender drooping stems. Yellow green catkins in spring. Useful as a specimen or in groups. Many grafted forms available. Prefers deep well drained soil in a cool to temperate climate. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.
Indigenous (SA; Vic; ACT; NSW (Sydney Cumberland Plain & Hawkesbury Sandstone); Qld & Tas)

Evergreen sprawling climber or scrambler (3m) from SA; Vic; ACT; NSW (including Sydney Cumberland Plain and Hawkesbury Sandstone); Qld & Tas. Soft often furry pale green leaves. Pendulous cream tubular flowers most of the year followed by fleshy edible green fruit. Useful climber for a light support; understorey for eucalypts or effective groundcover in an open area. Bird attracting. Prefers well drained soil in full to partial sun. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen stemless clump forming perennial (0.2m x 0.3m) from South Africa. Olive green strap-shaped leaves arranged in a basal rosette. Small clusters of yellowish green flowers with blue edged petals emerging from pink bracts. Useful for a groundcover in a warm protected position. Prefers indirect sunlight and moist fertile soil. Tolerant of mild to medium frosts. Drought tolerant for short spells.

Evergreen clump forming stemless bromeliad perennial (0.5m x 0.5m) from South Africa. Green sheathing leaves arranged in vase shaped basal rosettes. Brilliant red flowers arranged in thistle-like inflorescences. Useful grouped as groundcover in a protected position in partial shade. Increases by off-sets produced after flowering. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen compact clumping perennial (0.5m x 0.5m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone). Slender grass-like leaves. Tubular orange-red flowers becoming yellow at the tips in summer. Useful clumped in small spaces where they can be left undisturbed. Avoid root disturbance. Needs deep sandy lime-free soil. Best at the bottom of a slope where there is natural water seepage. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen vigorous tree fern with a small stout trunk (1.5m x 1.2m) from Brazil. Fronds of many paired leathery crinkled leaflets bronze when young turning green. Useful for a bush-house or shady garden. Requires constant supply of moisture. Frost and drought sensitive.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney); Vic; Tas & S E Asia)

Evergreen tuft forming fern (1m x 1m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic; Tas & S E Asia. Leathery pinnate fronds rosy pink when young. Useful for shady areas as a border or under trees. Prefers moist soil. Protect from drying winds. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen upright fern developing a short black scaly trunk when mature (0.8m x 1.2m) from New Caledonia. Dark green glossy fronds arranged in a neat rosette. Useful for a warm shady garden. Needs moist fertile soil and high humidity. Frost and drought sensitive.
Indigenous (Along Creek banks in all states Australia (Sydney) except WA)

Evergreen tufted fern with erect fronds (0.7m x 0.5m) from all states of Australia except WA (including Sydney). Light green pinnate fronds. Older specimens develop a trunk. Useful as a groundcover or in association with a water feature. Needs a shaded position with moist well-composted soil. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney rainforests); Vic; Tas & Fiji)

Evergreen small tufted fern (0.3m x 0.3m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney rainforest pockets); Vic; Tas & Fiji. Dark green variable fronds may be entire; pinnate or lobed. Useful for wet shady positions. Frost sensitive. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence

Erect branching perennial spreading by creeping rhizomes (1.8m x 0.8m) from eastern USA. Linear lance shaped greyish green leaves. Loose panicles of tiny white; pale pink or mauve daisy-like flowers with yellow centres in summer. Profuse blooming. Numerous cultivars available. Useful background for borders or perennial garden. Self sows in favourable conditions. Tolerant of poor soils. Frost and drought tolerant.

Annual clumping herb with a straggling habit (0.7m x 0.4m) from northern Europe. Hair covered crinkled lance shaped basal leaves develop into leafy flowering stems. Clusters of semi pendulous star-like purple blue flowers in spring and summer. Useful addition to the herb or vegetable garden. Edible flowers and young leaves. Good companion plant for tomatoes; squash and strawberries. Prefers fertile well drained soil in full sun. Protect from wind. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen rounded shrub (1m x 0.6m) from WA. Light green narrow leaves with toothed margins. Pink star-like flowers in spring. Useful as a specimen; understorey or grouped for mass effect. Needs well drained sandy soil. Prefers a partial shade position and mulch cover to cool the root zone. Frost tolerant.
Indigenous (NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone & Blue Mtns))

Evergreen upright shrub (1m x 1m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone & Blue Mtns). Pinnate leaves with finely pointed leaflets. Fragrant pale pink or white star-like flowers in spring. Useful specimen for its fragrant flowers or grouped particularly in a bush garden. Prune to promote bushy growth. Needs moist well drained soil in dappled shade. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen compact rounded shrub (1m x 1m) from Vic and NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone). Aromatic simple; trifoliate or rarely pinnate dark green leaves with recurved margins. Stems covered in a rusty layer. Rose pink star-like flowers in late winter to spring. Useful specimen for its flowers or grouped particularly in a bush garden. Prune to promote bushy growth. Needs moist well drained soil in dappled shade. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen often short-lived compact small shrub (0.5m x 0.3m) from WA. Stalkless trifoliate leaves. Heavily perfumed cup-like red brick to dark brown flowers with yellow insides in spring. Useful specimen planted next to a path or window for its perfumed flowers. May need replacing every few years. Needs moist well drained mulched soil in dappled shade. Root zone must not dry out. Best in a cool mountain climate. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.
Indigenous (Selected cultivar from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone))

Evergreen compact rounded branched shrub (1.5m x 1.5m). Selected cultivar of B. mollis from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone). Soft hairy pinnate leaves. Pink star-like flowers in spring. Useful specimen for its flowers or grouped particularly in a bush garden. Needs moist well drained mulched soil. Tolerates both sun and shade. Root zone must not dry out. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen variable spreading shrub (1.2m x 0.8m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone). Aromatic waxy pinnate leaves. Clustered roundish buds opening to cup shaped then star-shaped pink flowers. Useful specimen for its flowers or grouped particularly in a bush garden. Multi-petalled and white forms available. Some forms salt spray tolerant. Prune to promote bushy growth. Needs moist well drained mulched soil in dappled shade. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen upright shrub (1m x 0.6m) from NSW (endemic to Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone). Crowded bright green rhomboid leaves. Strongly fragrant bright pink cup shaped flowers in terminal clusters in spring. Useful specimen planted next to a path or window for its perfumed flowers particularly for a bush garden. Needs perfect drainage and a cool root zone provided by sandstone slabs or thick mulch. Tolerates partial to full shade. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen vigorous vine (climbs 5m ) from Brazil. Bright green ovate leaves on woody stems with thorns. Bright floral display from colourful bracts. Many named colour varieties in white; yellow; red; scarlet; rose and purple. Useful for climbing over a trellis or wall. Requires securing to a strong support. Dwarf and shrub forms available. Prune to keep under control and avoid thorns. Needs a warm sunny position. Semi-drought tolerant. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen spreading shrub (1m x 1m) from Mexico. Small lance shaped leaves. Terminal clusters of fragrant four lobed white flowers from summer to early winter. Useful mixed with shrubs or perennials and next to paths or windows for its fragrance. Needs fertile well drained soil in a warm protected position. Prefers light shade. Frost and drought sensitive.

Deciduous tall tree (25m x 5m) from Qld and NSW coastal areas (including the Illawarra region of Sydney). Light green large variably lobed leaves; deciduous in spring. Waxy red bell-shaped flowers on waxy red branching stems in late spring; when leaves are absent . Useful for a feature tree in a large garden. Frost sensitive. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Deciduous spreading tree (20m x 12m) from Qld and NSW. Heart shaped to five lobed leaves silver on the underside. Pink flowers in summer when leaves are absent. Useful as a feature or shade tree in a large garden. Tolerates poor soil. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.
Indigenous (NSW (moist forests of Cumberland Plain and Wiannamatta Shale regions Sydney); Vic; Tas & SA.)

Evergreen small spreading mat forming perennial (0.25m x 0.4m) from NSW (including Cumberland Plain and Wiannamatta Shale regions Sydney); Vic; Tas and SA. Linear lanceolate leaves. Pink to mauve daisy-like flowers with yellow centres on leafless stalks. Useful for a border; perennial garden or groundcover and for colour display. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen compact perennial plant (0.15m x 0.4) from Qld; NSW and Vic. Soft finely divided dark green foliage. Lilac-blue or white daisy-like flowers in spring to summer. Useful for a border; perennial garden or groundcover and for colour display. Prefers a sunny well drained position. Frost tolerant.

Cool-season annual (0.3 m x 0.3 m) with a rounded form from Europe. Multicoloured, often-crinkled, edible leaves in combinations of red/green, white/pink and pink/green forming a textured rosette like a cabbage. Remove buds to restrict flowering. Useful for an interesting, textural, foliage effect as a border or to add colour to the vegetable garden. Susceptible to caterpillar attack. Tolerant of cold conditions. Sensitive to summer heat. Drought sensitive.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (including Illawarra; Cumberland Plains and Blue Mountains regions of Sydney) and NT)

Evergreen erect shrub (2.5m x 2m) from Qld; NSW (including Illawarra; Cumberland Plain and Blue Mountains regions of Sydney) and NT. Soft dull olive green leaves. Small green pendulous flowers followed by pink succulent fruit resembling tiny apples. Useful fill-in plant for a bush garden or understoey in a rainforest setting. Bird and native butterfly attracting. Prefers well composted soil. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant.
