value: Evergreen shrub with a tree-like form (4m x 4m) from South America and Mexico. Downy long light green leaves. Scented pendulous white tubular flowers in summer and autumn. Numerous cultivars available with variable flower colour. Useful for a feature; background or screen. All parts of the plant are poisonous. Prefers a sunny protected position. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen dense shrub (2m x 1.5m) from South America. Leathery green leaves. Tubular flowers open purple fading to mauve then white in summer. Useful for a north facing garden protected from the western sun. Prefers fertile soil with ample water in summer. Highly poisonous to dogs. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen large bushy shrub or small tree (7m x 3m) from Qld. Elliptical glossy green mature leaves with bronze coloured new growth often lobed. Pendulous spikes of cream flowers at the end of branches in summer. Useful as a specimen; small tree with lower branches removed or screen. Prefers well-drained moist soil. Frost sensitive while young. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen fast growing shrub with arching branches (3m x 2m) from China. Long pointed leaves white felted beneath. Spikes of fragrant lilac flowers with an orange mouth at the ends of branches. Useful for a screen or as background to lower growing shrubs. Attracts bees and butterflies. Sensitive to poorly drained soils. Prune to maintain shape. Many varieties available. Potential to invade bushland. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen shrub (2m x 2m) from South Africa. Glossy elliptical wavy edged leaves. Terminal clusters of deep scarlet swollen tubular flowers. Useful specimen for a protected position. Tolerates shade in warm areas. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen compact dense heavily branched shrub (1.5 x 1.5) from Japan. Oblong; glossy dark green leaves. Inconspicuous flowers. Useful as a screen; accent plant; formal or informal hedge and for topiary. Tolerates severe pruning. Frost tolerant. Moderately tolerant to salinity. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen tight dense small shrub (0.5m x 0.5m) from Europe and Asia. Dense mass of oval bright green leaves. Insignificant flowers. Useful for edging; close-clipped topiary and as a low hedge. May be trimmed to 0.15m. Very slow growing. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen clump forming perennial (0.6m x 0.5m) from South America. Dark and light green stemless leaves reddish purple below. Short spikes of white flowers intermittently. Useful for foliage display in a warm courtyard or balcony in filtered light. Suitable for indoors in cooler climates. Sensitive to direct sunlight. Prefers soil high in organic matter. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen clump forming perennial (0.9m x 0.8m) from Brazil. Large velvety deep green leaves marked by parallel stripes of yellowish green and undersides purplish red. Short dense spikes of white to dark purple flowers in spring. Leaves may turn yellowish in winter. Useful for its foliage colour and texture in a shaded courtyard or understorey in a protected position particularly for a tropical theme. Needs fertile moist well drained soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen, fast-growing, bushy, cool-season annual (0.5 m x 0.5 m) from the Mediterranean region. Lance-shaped, strongly-aromatic leaves. Daisy-like single or double flowers in shades of orange,yellow or cream in winter and spring. Useful for colour in borders,massed,between shrubs or in containers. Dwarf varieties available. Good companion plant for repelling insects. Prefers full sun in fertile soil. Tolerant of poor soil. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen shrub with a low horizontal habit (3m x 4m) from Bolivia. Dark green pinnate silky leaves with glossy copper coloured new growth. Powder-puff like flowers of dark crimson stamens. Useful specimen; hedge; pot plant; for an above ground planter or trained as a standard. Tip prune to encourage compact form and more flowers. Prefers full sun and sandy well drained soil. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen tall shrub or small tree (6m x 3m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Coarsely serrated shiny tough leaves with a whitish fine felt underside. Creamy yellow acacia-like ball shaped flowers in spring. Useful as a screen or feature in a shady position. Tolerates heavy shade. Frost sensitive when young. Prefers a well composted soil. Drought sensitive. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.
Non indigenous (Probably cultivar of C. viminalis selected in Qld)

Evergreen small spreading tree with pendulous habit (5m x 5m). Probably cultivar of C. viminalis selected in Qld. Narrow olive green leaves. Young leaves and stems covered with long silky hairs. Bright red to dark crimson brush-like flowers mostly in spring and autumn. Useful as a feature; small shade tree; tall hedge or windbreak. Bird and insect attracting. Tolerates periodic water-logging and salinity. Moderately drought tolerant. May defoliate in prolonged dry periods. Tolerates light to medium frosts. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen conical slow growing coniferous tree (18m x 2m) from the USA. Blue green leaves in dense vertical plumes turning purplish in winter. Useful specimen for cool climate gardens. Prefers deep moist fertile soil with good rainfall. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen spreading tree (10m x 6m) from South Africa. Oval greyish green leaves. Heavily laden terminal pink orchard-like flowers in summer. Useful as a shade or feature tree in large gardens. Grafted forms ensure flower. Should not be used with an understorey as it inhibits growth of other plants. Frost sensitive.
Indigenous (NSW (including Sydney Blue Mountains and coast) and Vic)

Evergreen biennial or perennial with erect slightly sticky stem (2m x 2m) from NSW (including Sydney Blue Mountains and coast) and Vic. Soft stem clasping spirally arranged leaves on white woolly stems. Large aromatic plume-like pink or bronze-red flower heads in spring. Useful background plant for its floral display; positioned so that lower foliage is hidden and flowers visible. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Widespread throughout Australia except NT (including Sydney))

Evergreen variable dwarf to tall shrub (from less than 1m to 2m x 1m). Widespread throughout Autralia except NT (including Sydney). Bright green tiny crowded leaves covered in short hairs. Terminal clusters of white to pink star-like flowers followed by reddish calyces with thread-like curling awns. Useful specimen or mass planted for the interest of its flowers particularly in a bush garden. Needs well drained sandy soil. Lightly prune regularly to avoid bare wood. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen slow growing shrub (3m x 3m; depending on variety) from Japan and China. Dark green toothed glossy leaves. Flowers variable -single; semi-double; anemone form; peony form; rose-form; formal double and irregular double - in shades of pink; red or white. Useful as a single feature or in groups; as a screen or hedge and suitable for containers. Prefers partial shade and a humus rich acid soil. Drought sensitive. Very sensitive to salinity. Mostly frost tolerant.

Evergreen shrub with open habit (5m x 3m) from China. Often grafted onto C. sasanqua rootstock. Dark green glossy leaves. Flowers largest of the Camellia family (18cm diameter) in shades of pink to red. Useful as a screen or as a feature for its floral display. Prefers partial shade and humus rich acid soil. Tolerates full sun. Drought sensitive. Very sensitive to salinity and sensitive to wind. Tolerates light to medium frosts.

Evergreen shrub (1.5-4m x 2m depending on cultivar) from China and Japan. Glossy dark green leaves; smaller than C. japonica. Flowers appear from autumn and are variable (single; semi-double and double petal arrangements) in shades of pink or white with centres filled with yellow tipped stamens. Useful for a screen; formal or informal hedge; containers or in mixed borders. Wind tolerant. Prefers fertile soil. Hardiest of the Camellia family. Moderately frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen low spreading shrub or groundcover (0.5m x 1m) from China and Japan. Glossy dark green leaves with bronze tinged new growth. Two tone pink flowers with a prominent yellow centre. Useful massed as groundcover or understorey; low hedge or pot plant. Prefers slightly acid fertile soil with good drainage in partial shade. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen clump forming perennial (0.15m x 0.3m) from the Baulkans and West Asia. Rounded bright green leaves. Cup shaped blue or white flowers on erect stems above the foliage. Useful for its colour in clumps; as a border or in a perennial garden. Needs mulch to keep the root zone cool. Prefers a partly shaded position. Remove spent flowers after flowering. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant.
Non indigenous (Southern & eastern Europe and temperate Asia)

Evergreen rosette forming perennial spreading by rhizomes (1m x 0.4m) from southern and eastern Europe and temperate Asia. Narrow lance shaped bright green basal leaves. Nodding bell shaped purplish blue or white papery flowers on erect vertical stems. Remove spent flowers to extend flowering period. Useful for a perennial border; cutting garden or naturalised in a semi-wild area. Prefers fertile moist well drained soil in partial shade. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous woody stemmed climber (8m) from China and Japan. Large compound fern-like leaves. Drooping clusters of trumpet shaped orange or red flowers in late summer and autumn. Useful for rapid cover over a fence or wall or for a pergola or large trellis. Requires support for climbing and annual pruning of heavy woody growth. Prefers a warm protected site and fertile moist soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Robust upright showy perennial with underground rhizome from which new plants arise (0.5-2m x 0.3m) from the Caribbean Islands. Large glossy stem clasping leaves. Terminal cluster of flowers in bright shades of red; yellow pink; white or variants of these colours. Useful for colour in mass display. Prefers fertile and moist well drained soil. Needs full sun to flower well. Protect from wind. Cut back spent flower stems to ground level. Susceptible to slug damage. Minor invasive weed potential in bushland areas. Frost and drought sensitive.
Non indigenous (Hybrid of South American parentage)

Robust upright perennial with underground rhizomes from which new plants arise (1.75m x 0.5m). Hybrid of South American parentage. Banana like leaves emerge purple becoming striped with green; yellow; pink and red. Terminal orange flower. Useful planted in clumps for a lush tropical theme. Prefers fertile and moist well drained soil. Needs full sun to flower well. Protect from wind. Tolerates light frosts only. In frost areas protect the roots with a thick mulch in winter or lift rhizomes in autumn. Drought sensitive.
Non indigenous (North America; Europe & northern Asia)

Evergreen neat clump forming perennial (0.5m x 0.3m) from North America; Europe and northern Asia. Rosette forming green basal leaves divided into serrate margined leaflets. Dense terminal clusters of lilac pink flowers in spring. Variable cultivars available. Useful for an informal border or semi-wild area. Prefers a damp semi-shaded position. Root zone must be kept moist. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen clump forming grass-like perennial (0.1 x 0.3) from New Zealand. Fine textured whitish leaves. Insignificant flowers. Useful as a contrast in the perennial garden or amongst other grasses. Siutable for a bog or water garden. Needs consistently moist soil. Potential weed in bushland. Frost tolerant.
Indigenous (Australia (Including Sydney); New Zealand; New Caledonia and Papua New Guinea.)

Evergreen tufted spreading perennial sedge (0.8m x 0.6m) from all states of Australia (Including Sydney); New Zealand; New Caledonia and Papua New Guinea. Narrow shiny and tough leaves finely raspy on the edges. Flowers spiralling on triangular-sectioned flower stem. Useful for poorly drained wet places and poolside. Tolerates roots submerged in water. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen clump-forming perennial sedge (0.6m x 0.2m) from New Zealand. Very narrow copper coloured leaves turning red towards the base. Vertical form when young aging to arching form with curled leaf tips. Inconspicuous flowers. Useful for accent or clumped in rock or gravel gardens; water gardens or pot plant. Prefers moist well drained soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen tufted perennial grass (0.8m x 0.6m) from Qld and NSW. Soft green shiny narrow leaves forming a fountain-like mound. Useful clumped for its texture or massed as understorey particularly in a bush garden. Prefers dappled shade and moist well drained soil. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.
Indigenous (Coastal dunes of Qld; NSW (Sydney) & Vic)

Evergreen creeping prostrate groundcover (0.1m x 1m) from coastal dunes of Qld; NSW (including Sydney) & Vic. Succulent three angled leaves. Solitary and terminal bright pink flowers with pale yellow stamens. Useful for stabilising sandy dry banks and low maintenance areas especially in coastal locations. Hardy. Frost sensitive. Salt spray and drought tolerant.

Deciduous rounded tree with an open textured crown (12m x 6m) from the USA. Bright green compound leaves. Insignificant flowers followed by edible nuts. Useful as a shade tree; windbreak and for its nuts. Many named varieties available. Needs deep well drained soil and hot conditions during the growing season. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant once established.

Evergreen large shrub or small tree (5m x 3m) from India. Pinnate leaves. Racemes of small fragrant cup shaped bright yellow flowers in spring followed by cylindrical dark pods. Useful against a north facing wall or fence. Butterfly attracting. Requires a warm protected position. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen large tree (20m x 8m) with a dense rounded canopy from Qld; NSW and New Caledonia. Glossy dark green pinnate leaves and low spreading branches. Sprays of red and yellow pea-shaped flowers in spring followed by large cylindrical pods. Useful specimen or shade tree for large gardens. Potentially invasive root system. Avoid planting close to structures. Young plants make good pot plants. Prefers moist fertile well drained soil. Frost tolerant.
Indigenous (Estuarine locations in Qld and NSW (Sydney).)

Evergreen pyramidal tree when young becoming rounded and contorted with age (18m x 6m) from estuarine locations in Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Slightly pendulous branches with leaves reduced to triangular scales around the stem. Globular to cylindrical cones. Useful mass planted for a screen; windbreak or erosion control or as a specimen and shade tree. Adaptable to all soils. Very tolerant to salinity. Frost and drought tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Deciduous tree with a spreading crown (15m x 8m) from the USA. Large ovate to cordate leaves with an unpleasant odour when crushed. Erect terminal panicles of whitish pink frilly bell flowers with purple and yellow markings followed by cylindrical pendant pods. Useful as a shade or feature tree. Hardy. Grafted dwarf form 'Nana' available for formal topiary. Can be prone to branch fall from brittle branches. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen large round shrub (2m x 2.5m) from North America. Lance shaped glossy dark green leaves. Dense clusters of small lightly scented blue flowers at the tips of new growth in spring to summer. Useful as a specimen or in groups for its colourful flower display. Salt spray tolerant. Needs full sun and free draining soil. Best near a north facing wall. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen pyramidal shaped coniferous tree becoming flat topped with age (20m x 10m) from Algeria and Morocco. Silvery blue thick narrow needle-like leaves in spirals. Erect cylindrical cone fruit in autumn. Useful as a large specimen tree. Tolerates wide range of soil types. Sensitive to poor drainage. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen pyrimidal shaped conifer with slightly pendulous branches (18m x 8m) from the Himalayas. Pale green to grey green needle-like leaves. Barrel shaped glaucous cones ripening to brown. Useful as a shade tree in large gardens or background to shrubbery. Sensitive to salinity. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen spreading coniferous tree with tiered arching branches (25m x 15m) from Lebanon and Syria. Spirally arranged glossy grey green needle-like leaves. Greyish pink cones. Useful specimen for large cool climate gardens. Very long lived. Prefers fertile and moist well drained soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen, erect perennial grown as an annual (0.6 m x 0.3 m) from Asia. Bright green, lanceolate leaves tinged with red. Tightly packed velvety ruffled flowers in shades of red, pink or gold throughout summer. Useful for colour in mass display and cut flower. Dwarf varieties available. Needs full sun and well drained soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Deciduous spreading tree (15m x 5m) from the Mediterranean region. Rough textured dark green lanceolate leaves with serrate margins. Insignificant flowers followed by small; hard purple black fruit. Useful as a shade tree in poor soil. Invasive root potential. Avoid planting close to structures. Potential for becoming weedy near bushland areas. Prefers well drained soil. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen, upright-branching, cool-season annual (0.4 m x 0.3 m) from the Mediterranean region. Grey-green leaves; lower pinnately lobed; upper lance shaped. Daisy-like flowers in shades of blue, pink or white. Useful for colour and as a cut flower planted in drifts or clumps. Prefers a sunny position in fertile soil. Sow seed in autumn or late winter in cold climates. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen vigorous; low mat forming perennial (0.1m x 0.5m) from Europe. Light grey linear leaves covered with fine hairs on creeping stems. White flowers from spring to summer. Useful as a groundcover; particularly on dry difficult sites; for colour contrast in a perennial garden and for spilling over walls. Hardy. Prune annually to maintain compact form. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen erect rounded shrub or small tree (6m x 1.5m) from NSW (including Sydney). Light green tripinnate leaves. White star-like flowers with pinkish bracts in late spring followed by swollen red calyces in summer. Useful as a screen or a small feature tree. Best planted in groups. Prefers a protected position with fertile well-drained soil and mulch. Prune after flowering. Select from clones for best colour. Stressed plants are susceptible to borer. Tolerates light to medium frosts. Moderately drought tolerant.

Semi-evergreen bushy perennial with crowded erect stems (0.5m x 0.3m) from western China. Oval mid green leaves turning orange and red in autumn. Small terminal clusters of brilliant blue flowers on reddish branched stems in late summer and autumn. Useful for a perennial border; edging or groundcover. Prefers moist well drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen small open mounded shrub (0.3m x 0.3m) from China. Small green leaves turning red in autumn. Clusters of small bright blue flowers in summer to autumn. Useful as a border or in a perennial garden for its colour display. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. May prune close to the ground in winter particularly in frost areas. Moderately drought tolerant.

Deciduous small spreading tree with blackish stems (8m x 5m) from southern Europe & Western Asia. Heart shaped dark green leaves; turning yellow in autumn. Flowers pink-red pea shaped before foliage in spring and reddish brown pods in summer. Useful as a shade tree. Prefers alkaline soil and subject to root rot if drainage is poor. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen fast growing upright shrub (2.5 m x 2m) from Mexico. Broad leaves. Nodding loose clusters of deep red tubular flowers at the end of stems for almost all the year. Useful as background to lower shrubs or to screen a fence quickly. Prefers a warm position. Prune back one third after main flowering period to maintain shape. Frost and drought sensitive.

Deciduous broad spreading shrub with spiny interlacing branches (2m x 1.5m) from China and Japan. Dark green lanceolate leaves. Fragrant saucer shaped blossom flowers in winter on bare branches in shades of red; orange; white; apricot or pink depending on the variety. Useful for a clipped hedge; barrier or screen bringing colour and light into the garden in winter. Tolerant of salt spray and wind. Tolerates periodic water logging. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen columnar shaped coniferous small tree (5m x 1.5m) from the USA. Blue grey leaves in erect book-leaf sprays. Useful specimen or screen for a cool climate garden. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Tolerant of poor soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen conical slow growing small coniferous tree (4m x 2m) from the USA. Blue green leaves in dense vertical plumes turning purplish in winter. Useful specimen for cool climate gardens. Prefers deep moist fertile soil with good rainfall. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen upright slender cone shaped coniferous small tree (6m x 2m) from the USA. Densely flattened drooping sprays of rich yellow leaves. Useful specimen for its form and foliage colour in a cool climate garden. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen conical coniferous tree (7m x 2.5m) from the USA. Slightly drooping flattened sprays of yellow scale-like leaves turning pale green later in the season. Useful specimen or screen for a cool climate garden. Needs well drained moist soil in full sun. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen conical coniferous tree (5m x 2.5m) from Japan. Flattened sprays of aromatic bright golden green leaves. Round cones. Useful lawn specimen; screen or component of shrubbery. Needs full sun position and moist loam soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen loose broadly conical coniferous small tree (4m x 3m) from Japan. Dark green scale-like adult leaves on long pendulous thread-like small stems. Leaves turning yellowish green in winter. Brown rounded cones. Useful specimen for a large open area in a cool climate garden. Prefers moist well drained soil in full to partial sun. Sensitive to alkaline soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen mat forming to low growing perennial (0.1-0.3m x 0.5m) from the UK. Finely divided leaves arranged alternately on the stem. Aromatic when crushed. Daisy-like silvery white flower with a yellow central disk in spring and summer. Useful in the herb garden; groundcover between stepping-stones or lawn substitute. Tolerates mowing. Prefers well drained soil. Tolerant of poor soil. Invasive weed potential. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen spreading open shrub (3m x 3m) from WA. Fine soft needle-like leaves. Long stemmed trusses of waxy pink; rose or white flowers from late winter to spring. Useful as a specimen or grouped for its floral display particularly in a bush garden. Excellent cut flower. Needs perfect drainage and sensitive to over watering. Prefers sandy alkaline soil. Avoid root disturbance to increase lifespan. Moderately frost tolerant. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen, branching perennial grown as a cool-season annual (0.6 m x 0.3 m) from the Mediterranean region. Dull-green, oblong leaves. Heads of fragrant flowers in many colours including red, yellow, white, orange and brown in spring. Useful as a border, background, for colour in the perennial garden and cut flowers. Needs a sunny position and well-drained, light-textured soil. Remove spent flowers to prevent seeding and prolong flowering. Tolerates light to medium frosts only. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen tufted perennial forming a rosette (0.3m x 0.3m) from Africa. Long strap-like leaves striped yellow and green. Tiny star shaped white flowers carried on thin stems. Small rosettes of leaves may appear on flower stems forming plantlets. Useful for a hanging basket; border or edging. Prefers a semi shaded position in well drained moist soil. Invasive weed potential. Avoid use near bushland areas. Tolerates short drought periods and poor soil. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen rounded dense shrub (1.25m x 1m) from Mexico. Leaves bright green glossy in 3 leaflets. Fragrant white flowers late spring. Useful for low hedge or feature shrub. Prefers fertile well drained soil. Avoid root disturbance. Mostly frost tolerant. Remove leaves if frost damaged and plant recovers well.

Evergreen erect to scrambling soft wooded shrub (0.8m x 0.6m) from WA. Stiff oblong to ovate leaves. Terminal sprays of bright orange-red pea flowers in spring. Useful as a specimen or grouped for its colour display particularly in a bush garden. Needs sandy well drained soil in light shade. Mulch to protect surface roots. Moderately frost tolerant.

Evergreen palm on numerous slender and clustered stems (6m x 4m) from Madagascar and Mauritius. Green arching fronds with yellow mid-rib and leaflet mid-veins. Yellow flowers followed by black fruit. Useful as a container plant or for a tropical effect in a sheltered position. Prefers fertile soil in partial shade. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen prostrate suckering groundcover (0.15m x 0.7m) from all states of Australia (including Sydney). Silver-grey hairy leaves. Clusters of heads of bright yellow flowers in spring and summer. Useful in a rock or perennial garden or for mass planting on banks. Can be susceptible to damping off fungal disease in high humidity. Beneficial to mulch with pebbles to increase life span. Some forms are frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen clump forming perennial with hairy stems (0.3m x 0.5m) from SA; Vic; Tas & NSW. Linear glossy dark green leaves. Papery white flowers with yellow centres in spring and summer. Useful for flower beds or for a rock; pebble or bush garden. Needs well drained soil. Prune back after flowering. May need to replace plants every few years. Beneficial to mulch with pebbles to increase lifespan. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen vigorous tendril climber (5m) from rainforests of Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Glossy deep green heart shaped leaves rusty felty below. Small green hairy flowers intermittently followed by glossy black berries. Useful to cover a fence or pergola. Popular as an indoor plant. Requires well composted soil with ample moisture. Prefers a shady position. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen woody tendril climber (4m) from South America and West Indies . Glossy green leaves divided into 3 coarsely toothed leaflets. Insignificant flowers. Useful to cover a pergola or structure in a shady protected position. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen bushy rounded shrub (1m x 1m) from Europe. Narrow grey-green leaves; slightly sticky to the touch. Flowers dark pink with a maroon blotch and prominent yellow stamens throughout summer. Useful for coastal areas and as a quick growing filler. Prefers a well drained sunny position. Prune after flowering. Good drought tolerance.

Evergreen dense tree (10m x 4m) from the West Indies. Lanceolate leaves turning bronze in autumn. White sweetly perfumed flowers in autumn. Useful for a shade tree or screen. Prefers fertile soil. Moderately frost tolerant.

Evergreen small symmetrical tree with a shallow root system (4m x 3m) from Asia. Smooth glossy green leaves and mostly stiff sharp thorns. Fragrant white flowers followed by green to pale lemon highly acid fruit produced over an extended period. Fruit tends to drop when ripe. Useful for its fruit and as an ornamental. Varieties include 'Tahitian' and 'West Indian'. Prefers light well drained soil. Mulch under the canopy. Apply high nitrogen fertiliser in early summer. Susceptible to Melanose fungus. Most frost sensitive of all Citrus species. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen vigorous tree with an open habit (3m x 3m) from China. Green elliptical leaves on thornless branches. Perfumed white flowers followed by lemon fruit with mildly rough often ribbed skin. Mostly summer fruiting. Useful primarily to provide fruit and as an ornamental. Needs well drained open textured soil. Regular fertilising is beneficial. Avoid over fertilising. Frost tolerant and drought sensitive.

Evergreen rounded tree with spreading branches (6m x 4m). Thought to be a hybrid between the pummelo and the orange. Dark green ovate leaves with small rounded teeth. Clusters of white flowers in the leaf axils followed by thick pale lemon fruit sometimes blushed with pink. Useful for its fruit and as an ornamental. Varieties include 'Marsh'; 'Ruby' and 'Thompson'. Prefers light well drained soil. Mulch under the canopy. Apply high nitrogen fertiliser in early summer. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen rounded tree with an open crown (5m x 4m) from Asia. Lance shaped shiny green leaves on winged petioles. Fragrant white flowers followed by loose skinned orange-like fruit from autumn depending on the variety. Useful for its fruit and as an ornamental. Prefers light well drained soil. Mulch under the canopy. Apply high nitrogen fertiliser in early summer. Varieties include 'Ellendale'; 'Imperial' and 'Emperor'. Harvest early mandarins as they ripen. May require pruning to remove dead and crowded wood. Thin fruit to avoid alternate year bearing. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen compact tree (7m x 5m) from China. Dark green shiny and leathery leaves. Fragrant white flowers arranged in clusters followed by orange fruit in autumn and winter. Useful for its fruit and as an ornamental. Varieties include 'Valencia' and 'Washington Naval'. Allow fruit to ripen on the tree. Prefers light well drained soil. Mulch under the canopy. Apply high nitrogen fertiliser in early summer. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (including Sydney) ACT; Vic & Tas)

Evergreen vigorous twining climber (8m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); ACT; Vic & Tas. Leaves variable once or twice divided into three trifoliate segments. Purple juvenile foliage with silver markings. Short branches of creamy white star-shaped flowers in spring followed by feathery fruit. Useful to cover a fence; trellis or pergola or may be used as a groundcover in the absence of vertical elements. Prefers some overhead shade. Mulch to keep the root zone cool. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen small perennial (0.5m x 0.5m) producing tufts from a short rhizome from Tasmania. Thick green lanceolate leaves sometimes trailing. White star-like flowers on erect branches. Useful for a rock or gravel garden or pot plant. Prefers a protected position with filtered sunlight. Needs well drained soil. Tolerant of poor soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous climber with tendrils (6m) from the Himalayas. Green leaves in leaflets of 3 with purple tingeed new growth. Perfumed single pink to mauve flowers in spring. Useful trained on a wall or trellis or grown with other climbers. Flower stems produced direct from previous season's ripened stems. Prune after flowering to allow new growth for next season. Prefers a cool mountain climate. Upper growth needs full sun. Keep root zone cool with mulch and shade particularly in a warmer climate. Drought sensitive. Frost tolerant.

Fast-growing, bushy annual (1 m x 0.5 m) from South America. Divided, palmate leaves on hairy stems. Heads of claw-like, narrow-petalled flowers with protruding stamens in shades of pink, mauve, purple or white. Useful for tall, background colour and texture. Long-lasting cut flowers. Prefers full sun. Tolerant of hot, dry conditions once established.
Non indigenous (Rainforests of Qld; NT & SE Asia)

Evergreen rounded shrub (3m x 2m) from rainforests of Qld; NT and SE Asia. Dark green heavily veined broadly ovate leaves. Large terminal heads of white flowers followed by black fruit with prominent red calyces. Useful feature for for warm coastal gardens. Prefers a protected position with some shade. Prune to maintain shape. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen clump-forming perennial (0.4m x 0.5m) from South Africa. Dark green strap-shaped basal leaves. Stems produce umbels of 12-20 funnel-shaped orange flowers in spring. Useful as groundcover under trees; for a border or between shrubs. Prefers a partly shaded to deeply shaded position. Sensitive to salinity. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen fast growing tendril climber (5m) from Argentina and Brazil. Leaves with two oval glossy leaflets and a tendril. Small nodding clusters of purple veined lavender flowers in spring and summer. Useful for a fence or pergola with plenty of space for its vigorous growth. Tolerates light to moderate frost. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen fast growing tendril climber (4m) from Mexico. Compound leaves with leaflets terminating in branched tendrils. Pendant bell shaped yellow green flowers aging to purple in spring and summer. Useful to cover a trellis or wall. Prefers well drained soil in a warm protected position. Drought and frost sensitive. May be grown as an annual in frost areas.

Evergreen spreading to dome-shaped shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) from South Africa. Tiny soft needle-like aromatic leaves and star-shaped pink flowers from late winter to spring. Useful for mass planting; border or low hedge. Prune to maintain compact form. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen, fast-growing, bushy perennial grown as an annual (0.4 m x 0.3 m) from Asia. Pointed, oval leaves in bright mixture of coloured patterns including pink, red, yellow, cream or green. Insignificant flowers. Useful in sheltered positions for colourful foliage display, as a border, background or to fill dark corners. Prefers a lightly shaded position in fertile soil. Remove flowers for improved foliage display. Susceptible to snail and slug damage. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen compact bushy shrub (0.6m.x 0.7m) from Southern Europe. Silky silver green leaves. Pink buds open to white funnel shaped flowers in spring to summer. Useful for groundcover in very hot dry positions. Avoid damp positions. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen trailing groundcover perennial with slender stems (0.1m x 0.9m) from North Africa; Spain & Italy. Small oval leaves on lax stems. Open trumpet-shaped vibrant blue-purple flowers in summer. Useful as a groundcover or to cascade over a wall or out of a container. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen compact shrub (0.5m x 1m) from New Zealand. Round shiny leaves in tones of green through bronze and red to almost black. Colour tones more intense in winter. Useful for its colourful foliage as a low hedge; border; in pots or massed. Prefers well drained soil in sun or dappled shade. Salt spray and wind tolerant. Tolerates light frosts only. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen narrow upright shrub (1m x 1m) from New Zealand. Obovate shiny green leaves with irregular yellow spots turning orange red in spring and autumn. Inconspicuous flowers. Useful for hedging; border or mixed with other shrubbery for its colourful foliage. Prefers well drained soil in full to partial sun particularly in a coastal location. Tolerates poor soil and salt spray. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen dense groundcover (0.3m x 1.5m). Natural hybrid from New Zealand. Lance-shaped leathery glossy olive green leaves. Insignificant flowers. Useful for banks; spilling over walls and mass planting large areas. Hardy. Tolerant of salt spray and poor soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen slow growing sparsely branched palm-like tree with fleshy rhizome (8-12m x 5m) from New Zealand. Rosettes of long strap-shaped leaves at the end of each stem. Large open panicles of small fragrant white flowers in autumn. Useful as a feature for its unusual form particularly in coastal areas. Variable coloured leaf forms available. Frost and salt spray tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen slender upright palm-like shrub with many stems (3m x 2m) from rainforests or sandstone gullies of NSW and Qld. Upper stems carry rosettes of strap-like (0.5m) dark green leaves. Long semi-pendulous branching stems of tiny violet flowers mid to late summer. Useful as a feature for the accent value of its foliage and between other plants where its bare base is hidden. Suitable indoor or patio plant. Very adaptable; prefers ample water but tolerates dry periods. Tolerates both sun and heavy shade. Frost sensitive.

Fast-growing, bushy, erect annual (0.6 m x 0.2 m) from the USA. Light-green, fine leaves. Daisy-like, bright-yellow flower heads with red centres on thin strong stems in summer and autumn. Useful for colour in a bedding or perennial garden. Hardy. Self seeding with invasive potential. Avoid use near bushland areas. Plant after frosts. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen compact mound forming perennial (0.6m x 0.6m) from eastern USA. Finely divided dark green leaves. Pale lemon daisy-like flowers in summer. Useful for a border; edging or mixed with other perennials. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Tolerates poor dry soil. Tolerant of heat and humidity. Frost and drought tolerant.

Annual herb (0.6m x 0.5m) from Europe. Pinnate leaves on an erect stem. Lower leaves lobed. Upper leaves finely dissected. Flat compound umbels of small white flowers. Useful for the herb or vegetable garden for its leaves and seeds. Prefers well drained soil in partial to full sun. Plants grown for seed require full sun. May develop early flowering in hot weather. Cut back hard for leaf regrowth. Sow in succession from early spring to late summer in situ and thin to 15cm apart. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous small tree or shrub (4m x 3m) from the USA. Oval pointed dark green leaves turning red in autumn. Showy white or pinkish white bracts around tiny insignificant flowers in spring. Useful as a small specimen tree or in groups for its floral display. Prefers well drained fertile soil. Best in cool climate high altitude gardens. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.
Non indigenous (Hybrid between C. alba from east coast of Australia & C. 'Marion's Marvel')

Evergreen erect spreading small shrub (1m x 2m). Thought to be a hybrid between C. 'Marion's Marvel' and C. alba. Cordate to elliptical leaves on finely tomentose branches. Tubular shaped cylindrical pale cream flowers with a pink blush shading to green at the tips in winter. Useful specimen or grouped as understorey. Bird attracting. Prefers dappled light and well drained soil. Resistant to pests and diseases. Drought and frost tolerant.
Non indigenous (Hybrid between C. reflexa from throughout Australia & C. pulchella from SA)

Evergreen compact dense shrub (0.6m x 2m). Thought to be a hybrid between C. reflexa and C. pulchella. Dull green oval to elliptical leaves. Solitary and axillary pink tubular flowers from autumn to spring. Useful specimen or grouped as understorey particularly in a bush garden. Bird attracting. Prefers partial shade and well drained soil. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen dense low branching shrub (1.5m x 1m) from Coastal Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic & Tas. Almost round glaucous leaves on stems covered with grey down. White short bell shaped flowers opening to star-like petals. Flowers throughout the year. Useful as a hedge; mass planting or groundcover particularly in exposed coastal areas. Bird attracting. Prefers sandy soil and requires good drainage. Frost and drought tolerant. Very tolerant to salt spray.

Evergreen rounded shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) from damp gullies in southern NSW. Glossy dark green lanceolate leaves. Green bell shaped flowers on an expanded base resembling a chef's hat in winter. Useful specimen and understorey for its unusual flower. Bird attracting. Prefers some shade and moist well drained soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen small shrub (0.5m x 0.7m) from SA. Variable usually lanceolate leaves. Orange to pink bell shaped flowers in spring. Useful specimen; grouped or fill-in shrub particularly in a bush garden. Suitable for coastal gardens with some protection. Bird attracting. Needs well drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen small variable shrub (0.8m x 0.6m) from Qld; NSW (Sydney); Vic; Tas & SA. Dark green rough textured stem-clasping leaves. Tubular to bell shaped red flowers with yellow tips in winter. Useful as a fill-in shrub or mass planted especially in a bush garden. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen tall straight tree (30m x 10m) with an open textured crown and smooth white bark from Qld. Narrow lanceolate leaves strongly lemon scented when crushed. White flowers in spring. Useful as a feature or for dappled shade in the largest gardens. Mature trees can be susceptible to sudden limb drop. Potentially invasive root system. Avoid planting close to structures. Minor invasive weed potential in bushland areas. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen spreading stocky tree (16m x 10m) from Qld & NSW (including Sydney). Coarse drooping grey green leaves. Large clusters of cream flowers in spring. Useful for shade or as a feature for informal gardens. Prefers sandy soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen variable open crowned tree with tessellated rough bark (15-30m x 8-12m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney) and Victoria. Glossy dark green leaves. Large clusters of white flowers in summer. Useful as a shade; windbreak or feature tree especially in an informal garden. Tolerates infertile sandy soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen large tall tree (30m x 8m) with slender crown and smooth straight dappled trunk from Qld; NSW (including Sydney) and Vic. Glossy; curved-lanceolate leaves. White flowers from winter. Useful for a windbreak or tall tree in large gardens. Attractive trunk. Suitable for coastal areas and tolerates a wide range of soil types. Frost tolerant after two years; requires protection when young. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen arching shrub (2.5m x 2.5m) from China. Pointed round to oval grey green leaves. Small pink tinged white flowers in summer followed by oval bright orange-red berries. Useful as a screen; clipped hedge; espalier or component of shrubbery. Wind and salt spray tolerant. Prefers well drained soil. Invasive weed potential. Avoid use near bushland. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen to semi deciduous low spreading shrub or groundcover (0.4m x 1m) from China. Glossy small dark green leaves turning reddish in autumn. Tiny white flowers in spring followed by red berries. Useful as a groundcover to cover a slope or low espalier against a wall. Prefers well drained soil with full sun. Tolerates poor soil. Invasive weed potential. Avoid use near bushland areas. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen arching shrub (2m x 2m) from China. Large glossy oval round-ended leaves. Clusters of white flowers flowed by large bunches of red berries. Useful as a dense hedge or screen. Wind tolerant. Prefers well drained soil. Invasive weed potential. Avoid use near bushland. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen variable succulent forming a low shrub or groundcover (0.5m x 0.5m) from South Africa. Oval to almost round grey green leaves densely frosted with a white bloom and finely edged with red. Branched spikes of pendant bell-shaped flowers in orange; pink or red in late summer. Useful planted in a group; border; rock garden or pot plant. Needs excellent drainage in full sun to partial shade. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen succulent shrub (2m x 1m) from South Africa. Glossy dark green leaves sometimes red edged. Clusters of white tinged pink star-like flowers on older plants only. Useful in a succulent garden or in a container for the patio. Sensitive to over watering. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen erect succulent perennial (0.4m x 0.3m) from South Africa. Flat oval fleshy leaves arranged to overlap each other along the stems. Dense flat top heads of tubular bright red flowers in summer or autumn. Useful in a rock; gravel or courtyard garden or in a border mixed with other succulents. Suitable for a pot plant. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.
Non indigenous (Europe; North Africa & W Asia)

Deciduous thorny slow growing shrub or tree (6m x 3m) from Europe; North Africa and West Asia. Glossy 3 lobed leaves. Erect terminal clusters of fragrant white flowers followed by round bright red berries. Useful as a small feature tree; screen; clipped hedge or mixed with other shrubbery. Prefers limed loamy sand and cold winters. Weed potential. Avoid use near bushland areas. Wind and frost tolerant.

Evergreen flowering bulb (0.8m x 0.8m) from South Africa. Semi-erect strap shaped grey green basal leaves. Terminal clusters of long tubed funnel shaped pink flowers on leafless stems in summer. Useful clumped under trees or in the perennial garden. Needs partial shade and fertile moist soil. Susceptible to caterpillar attack. Drought and frost sensitive.
Indigenous (Swampy areas of Qld; NSW (Sydney); NT & Lord Howe Is)

Evergreen large bulbous perennial (1.5m x 1.5m) from swampy areas of Qld; NSW (Sydney); NT & Lord Howe Island. Thick fleshy strap-like leaves with blunt points. Clusters of perfumed open white flowers on thick stems in summer. Useful as a feature and in groups and in association with water features. Tolerant of poor drainage. Susceptible to caterpillar and snail attack. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.
Non indigenous (Hybrid of C. exalata from NSW & Vic & C. saligna from NSW)

Evergreen compact rounded shrub (1m x 1m). Hybrid between C. exalata from NSW and Vic and C. saligna from NSW. Light green oblanceolate leaves on angular slightly winged branches. Pale pink star-like flowers in early summer to autumn. Useful as a specimen; understorey or in groups particularly in a bush garden. Needs well drained soil in partial shade. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen small rounded shrub (0.7m x 1m) from NSW; ACT and Vic. Linear leaves. White to deep pink star-like flowers in summer and autumn. Useful as a specimen; low understorey or in groups especially in a bush garden. Prefers a cool moist position with mulched well drained soil. Sensitive to root disturbance. Prune to maintain bushy growth. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen small rounded shrub with angular branches (0.8m x 0.8m) from NSW (including Sydney). Bright green narrow elliptical leaves. Deep pink star-shaped flowers in mid-summer to late autumn. Useful as a feature or for group planting. Sensitive to over fertilising. Prefers sandy soil. Avoid root disturbance. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen upright symmetrical coniferous tree (8m x 2.5m) from Japan. Soft dense juvenile green leaves turning bronze to coppery red in autumn and winter. Foliage carried to ground level. Useful specimen for its foliage texture and colour. Prefers a cool mountain climate. Tolerates warm conditions if watering is adequate. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen dense broad bun shaped coniferous shrub (2m x 3m) from Japan. Dark green adult scale-like leaves in billowing masses. Useful specimen or background to bedding plants. Prefers well drained moist acidic soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.
Non indigenous (WA; NT; NSW (coastal Sydney) WA & Qld)

Evergreen spreading tree (7m x 5m) from NT; WA; Qld & NSW (including coastal areas of Sydney). Pinnate shiny leaves. Insignificant flowers followed by orange fruit. Useful as a shade or feature tree in coastal areas. Frost sensitive. Tolerant of salt spray. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen sparsely branched large shrub or small tree (6m x 3m) from Qld and NSW. Large pinnate toothed leaves with deep red young growth. Long sprays of pink flowers followed by pink fruit. Useful as a feature for its foliage. Suitable for a confined space. Prefers well composted soil. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen low spreading bushy shrub (0.6m x 1m) from Mexico. Bright green leaves. Tubular dark orange red flowers each with a dark band and white ring at the mouth. Flowers most of the year. Useful as a fill in shrub or grouped as a groundcover. Self seeds freely. Invasive potential. Frost sensitive but recovers from frost damage.

Evergreen pyramid shaped conical tree (10m x 2.5m) from Arizona USA. Tightly packed silvery blue scales flattened to form branchlets. Globular cones. Useful as an accent for its vertical form and colour or clipped as a tall hedge. Wind tolerant. Prefers hot dry conditions. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen upright conical shaped coniferous tree (10m x 4m) from the USA. Bright gold feathery leaves on thin pendant branches. Useful as an accent for its form and colour; quick growing screen; clipped hedge and topiary. Good conifer for coastal gardens. Can be susceptible to borer attack. Wind and salt spray tolerant. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen slender columnar coniferous tree (5m x 0.8m) from the USA. Aromatic tiny scale-like leaves arranged in flattened sprays. Useful specimen; pot plant or for framing a driveway or path. Prefers moist well drained soil in full sun. Tolerates light frosts.

Evergreen narrow upright coniferous tree (10m x 2.5m) from the Mediterranean region. Aromatic grey green leaves. Oval cones. Useful for formal effect and vertical accent; as a clipped hedge or screen for narrow spaces. Needs a sunny open position. Can be susceptible to borer attack. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen fast growing broadly conical coniferous tree (12m x 3m) from the Himalayas and western China. Soft bright green scale-like leaves pressed closely to the stem. Globular cones. Useful accent for its form; windbreak; or clipped hedge. Prefers fertile well drained soil. Can be susceptible to borer attack. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant in favourable conditions.

Evergreen tree-fern with tall trunk (10m x 3m) from deep gullies and rainforests in eastern Australia (including Sydney). Fronds 3m long radiating from the apex. Retains old leaf bases. Useful as a feature for sheltered and shaded positions. Frost and drought sensitive. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen fast growing robust tree fern with a slender trunk (10m x 6m) from Norfolk Island. Closely related to C. cooperi but larger. Bright green lacy divided leaf fronds to 5m. Useful as a feature in a shaded and protected position. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen upright tree fern with slender trunk (6m x 5m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Bright green lacy divided leaf fronds to 3m. Useful as a feature plant in a shaded and protected position. Frost and drought sensitive. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen slow growing palm-like perennial (3m x 2m) from Japan. May produce several trunks. Pinnate dark green foliage radiates from the trunk or forms a rosette at ground level in younger plants. Male and female plants. Tight clusters of reddish cones in autumn. Useful as an accent or to mix with a tropical themed garden. Prefers a protected position and good drainage. Plant slightly above the soil ground line. Frost tolerant and semi drought tolerant.

Evergreen clump forming perennial grass (1.5m x 1m) with an upright arching habit from India. Strongly lemon-scented long narrow light green leaves. Useful for its tender stems as an ingredient in Asian cooking and for its oil used in perfumery. Prefers well drained sandy soil in full sun. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen perennial vegetable with erect stems (2m x 1m) from the Mediterranean region and Canary Islands. Silvery green thistle-like leaves with a woolly undersurface. Blue thistle-like flower (edible when immature) in a terminal globular head from spring to summer. Useful for the vegetable or perennial garden for its interesting texture. Needs moist well prepared fertile soil. Protect from wind and hot sun. Drought sensitive.

Warm season sod-forming perennial turf grass spreading by stolons and rhizomes (0.3m) from East Africa to East Indies. Fine pointed grey green leaves loosing green colour in cool weather turning brown after frosts. Erect digitate flower spikes. Useful for a fine lawn in a warm sunny garden. Will not tolerate shade. High wear resistance. Preferred cutting height 15mm. Prone to thatch build up. Invasive weed potential. Keep contained near bushland areas. Cultivars include Greenlees park and Winter Green. Drought tolerant in humid regions. Requires irrigation in dry regions to maintain turf in green condition. Frost sensitive.

Warm season semi-dwarf turf grass spreading by stolons and rhizomes (0.3m). Cultivar of common couch from East Africa and East Indies. Fine pointed dark green leaves retaining reasonable colour in winter turning brown after frosts. Erect digitate flower spikes. Useful for a fine lawn in a warm sunny garden. Tolerates light shade. High wear resistance. Preferred cutting height 15mm. Prone to thatch build up. Requires irrigation in dry regions to maintain turf in green condition. Frost sensitive.

Warm season dense mat forming turf grass spreading by stolons and rhizomes . Cultivar of common couch from East Africa and East Indies. Dark green leaves retaining colour well into winter turning brown after frosts. Finest leaf of all couch varieties. Erect digitate flower spikes. Useful for a fine lawn in a warm sunny garden. Tolerates partial shade. High wear resistance. Preferred cutting height 15mm. Prone to thatch build up. Drought tolerant in humid regions. Requires irrigation in dry regions to maintain turf in green condition. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen tuft forming perennial sedge with slender stems (1m x 1m) from swamps of Madagascar. Leaf-like bracts forming a whorl. Clusters of brownish flowers produced in centre of leaves. Useful for a damp position and in association with a water feature. Prefers wet conditions and can grow in shallow water. Tolerant of drier conditions. Invasive potential. Avoid use near natural waterways. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen vase shaped fern (0.5m x 0.4m) from Japan; India; Africa and Hawaii. Glossy dark green holly-like serrated fronds. Useful filler or grouped in shady garden beds; understorey or veranda pot plant. Prefers fertile soil with good drainage. Avoid watering in winter. Moderately frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen erect conical coniferous tree (12m x 7m) developing an irregular crown of weeping branchlets in maturity; from New Zealand. Densely arranged linear juvenile leaves becoming bronze green in autumn. Angular scale-like adult leaves. Useful specimen or background tree for a cool climate garden. Prefers deep moist soil in higher rainfall areas. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Warm season turf grass with upright stems and spreading by stolons from South Africa. Coarse leaf blades covered with sparse hairs. Digitate flower spikes. Useful as lawn in warm temperate coastal areas particularly under trees. Prefers partial to full shade and friable sandy loam. Sensitive to low cutting; 50-75mm cutting height preferred. Frost sensitive. Requires irrigation in dry regions to maintain turf in green condition.

Bushy tuberous perennial (1-2m x 0.5m). Hybrids originating from Mexico. Grown from swollen tubers planted out in October and November. Leaves variable often divided into leaflets. Brilliantly coloured flowers in a wide range of colours and styles in summer and autumn. Useful massed for its colour display; as part of a border of perennial plants or for cut flowers. Protect from strong winds. Avoid competition from tree and shrub roots. Prefers well drained fertile soil in a warm position. May require staking to prevent stem breakage. Tubers are often lifted after flowering and stored over winter but need not be lifted annually. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen spreading suckering prostrate groundcover (0.05m x 0.6m) from WA. Variable linear leaves often bunched. Dark blue flowers throughout spring and summer. Useful as a groundcover; in a pebble or rock garden and particularly in association with a bush garden. Needs well drained sandy soil and adequate summer moisture. Frost tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone) & Vic)

Evergreen vigorous suckering shrub with erect sparsely branched stems (1m x 1m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone) and Vic. Thick grey green oval to elliptical leaves. Clusters of purple flowers with yellow centres near the ends of branches. Useful specimen or grouped for the top of a bank or rockery. Needs well drained soil in partial sun. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen shrub with woody and branching stems (1m x 1m) from China and Japan. Oblong glossy dark green leaves. Rose pink buds open to pink tinged; white sweetly fragrant flowers in clusters during spring. Useful planted close to a path or window for its perfume. Prefers a semi-shaded position with humus enriched acid soil. Susceptible to root rot disease and can be short-lived. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen medium to tall tree (15m x 6m) from rainforests of Qld. Bright green shiny variously lobed leaves. Long spikes of fragrant creamy white flowers in spring. Useful as a feature or shade tree. Bird attracting. Needs fertile well composted soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen low spreading shrub (0.6m x 1m) from WA. Lemon scented narrow grey-green leaves with bronze red tints in autumn and winter. Terminal heads of red and yellow flowers with protruding styles in spring. Useful as a specimen or for group planting. Needs well drained soil. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen small compact shrub (1m x 1m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone regions). Light green needle-like leaves crowded at the end of branches. Clusters of white flowers aging to red in spring and summer. Useful as a feature or mass planted especially in a bush garden. Bird attracting. Sensitive to poor drainage. Mulch well in exposed sites. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Annual root vegetable (0.4m x 0.4m) from Europe and Asia. Feathery pinnate leaves. Densely clustered white flowers in summer and autumn. Useful in the vegetable garden for its edible root. Prefers sandy soil and relatively dry site as over watering encourages excessive leaf growth. Prepare soil to a fine tilth. Sow seed in situ. Ensure soil moisture is maintained for good germination. Cultivars are defined by root shape; maturity and size. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen fern with a long creeping hairy rhizome (0.8m x 0.6m) from NSW (including Sydney); Qld; Vic & Tas. Deeply lobed leathery glossy dark green fronds. Useful for a shaded protected garden or understorey. Prefers well drained moist soil in partial to full shade. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen tall shrub with long slender pendulous branches and corky bark (5m x 3m) from Qld and NSW. Narrow lanceolate leaves. Axillary sprays of perfumed yellow pea flowers in spring. Useful as a feature for its graceful habit and showy flowers especially in a bush garden. Needs good drainage. Frost sensitive.
Non indigenous (Qld; NSW & Papua New Guinea)

Evergreen tall shrub or small tree (8m x 3m) from rainforests in Qld; NSW and Papua New Guinea. Shiny broad lanceolate leaves. Small white flowers in summer and autumn followed by small black fruit. Prefers well composted soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Flowering annual or perennial (1-2 m x 0.5 m) from Europe. Deeply, palmately, divided leaves. Spikes of irregularly cup shaped flowers in shades of blue, pink, red, pink yellow or white. Useful for cut flowers and as background plants in mixed borders where height is needed. Plant out in winter in frost-free zones and spring elsewhere. Provide shelter from wind. May require staking. Prefers a cool climate. Frost and drought sensitive.

Mat-forming epiphytic rock orchid (0.4m x 0.8m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone) and Qld. Stiff flattened leaves often deeply furrowed. Long feather-like racemes of fragrant white flowers in spring. Useful specimen for spilling over a rock face. Fasten or use small stones to press plant in contact with weathered rock or on wood or treefern fibre. Prefers dappled sunlight. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.
Indigenous (Eastern coast of Australia (Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone & Illawarra zones))

Clumping epiphytic orchid with stout swollen pseudo-bulbs terminating in stiff elliptical leaves (0.5m x 1m) from coastal eastern Australia (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone and Illawarra zones). Terminal spikes from leaf axils of fragrant cream aging to yellow waxy flowers. Useful clumped as a feature on rocks; stones; logs or in baskets. Avoid covering roots with soil. Fertilise after flowering. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen epiphytic orchid spreading by creeping rhizomes (1.5m x 0.75m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone and rainforests). Smooth long cylindrical pendulous leaves. Thread-like branches with clusters of fragrant white flowers with short red or purple stripes near the base in late winter. Useful fixed to a Casuarina or Melaleuca limb or spilling over a rockface. Needs a humid damp lightly shaded position. Benefits from occasional fine water spray in spring and summer. Tolerates light frosts. Drought tolerant in favourable growing conditions. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Deciduous upright or spreading shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) from Japan. Narrow leaves. Upright clusters of double white flowers along arching branches in spring. Useful mixed with shrubs for its graceful habit and floral display. Cut out unproductive wood in winter. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen spreading perennial with leaves borne on elongated aerial stems lined with brown bracts (0.6m x 0.6m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney) & Vic. Flat grass-like leaves with rough sand papery edges. Blue flowers with yellow anthers on spreading branched flower stems. Purple berry fruit. Useful for mass planting; as a border; grassy understorey or in association with a water feature. Variegated form available. Hardy. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney); Vic; Tas; SA & WA)

Evergreen spreading tufted perennial (0.8m x 0.8m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic; Tas; SA & WA. Tapering strap-like leaves with in-rolled margins. Dark blue flowers with yellow-brown or black anthers in summer. Useful for mass planting; border; understorey or in association with a water feature. Hardy. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen tufted perennial (0.45m x 0.5m) from NSW; Vic and Tas. Strap-like leaves; broadest of all Dianella species. Selected cultivar 'Emerald Arch' has broader arching leaves. Blue flowers with yellow anthers on branched stems in mid spring. Useful group planted as a border; understorey or for a tropical themed garden. Tolerates full sun to heavy shade. Frost and drought tolerant.

Erect annual or biennial (0.7 m x 0.3 m) from Europe. Deep-green, linear leaves. Terminal clusters of pink, red, purple or bicolour flowers in summer. Useful in flowerbeds or perennial gardens for floral display. Prefers an alkaline soil. Must have good drainage. May require staking support. Drought sensitive.

Flowering annual or perennial (0.3m x 0.5m) from South Africa. Variable leaves. Vertical spikes of tiny tubular flowers in shades of mauve; pink and orange during summer. Useful for colour in the front of a mixed border where it can fill spaces or planted densely for a ground cover. Needs full sun in free draining soil. Frost sensitive.
Indigenous (NSW (Sydney Cumberland Plain); Vic; SA & WA)

Semi-evergreen tuberous tufted perennial (0.5m x 0.4m) from NSW (including Sydney Cumberland Plain); Vic; SA and WA. Grass-like leaves surrounded with a tuft of dense fibres at the base. Fragrant delicate mauve flowers with dark anthers on slender stems in spring. Two to six flowers on each stem node. Dies back in winter. Useful clumped in a rock or gravel garden or massed as understorey particularly in a bush garden or woodland setting. Tolerates poor soils. Drought and frost tolerant.
Indigenous (Gullies & rainforests NSW (including Illawarra & Blue Mountains region of Sydney); Qld; ACT; Vic & Tas)

Evergreen tree-like ferns with stout trunks covered by brown fibres (6m x 3m) from mountain gullies and rainforests in Qld; NSW; ACT; Vic and Tas (including Illawarra and Blue Mountains areas of Sydney). Arching glossy green much divided palm-like fronds radiating from the apex. Useful as a feature or grouped especially in a shaded and protected position. Prefers a moist position sheltered from wind. Sensitive to extreme frosts. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen soft-wooded sprawling perennial (0.7m x 1.5m) from Uruguay. Grey felt-like leaves and stems. Terminal clusters of tubular orange-red flowers throughout late summer and autumn. Useful for a border or perennial garden particularly for a hot dry position. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Tolerates partial shade. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen tufted perennial (1.4m x 0.3m) from South Africa. Long narrow grass-like linear leaves. Funnel shaped deep pink flowers on arching wiry stems. Useful for a perennial garden or in association with a pond or water feature. Prefers moist fertile well drained soil. Sensitive to root disturbance. Tolerates light frosts only. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen fast growing tuft forming perennial with rhizomes (1m x 1m) from South Africa. Erect long narrow basal leaves. Branching stems with a succession of iris-like pale yellow flowers with a brown patch on each petal. Useful as groundcover; for borders or accent near entrances or ponds especially on poor soils. Hardy. Moderate invasive potential. Avoid use near bushland areas. Tolerates poorly drained soils. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen grass-like perennial on creeping rhizomes (1m tall) from South Africa. Erect sword shaped leaves. White flowers with yellow and orange brown markings. Useful as an accent for its distinctive clump shape; as a border or groundcover for a difficult site. Prefers well drained soil. Avoid pruning flower stems as they carry next year's flowers. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen vigorous clump-forming perennial (1m x 1m) from Lord Howe Island. Sword shaped grey green leaves to 1.5m. White iris like flowers with yellow centres in spring. Useful as a specimen or accent with perennials or amongst shrubbery. Prefers well drained moist soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Warm season sod forming perennial turf grass with slender stolons and few rhizomes from East Africa and Madagascar. Blue green soft leaf blades with sparse hairs. Erect digitate flower spikes. Useful lawn for warm coastal gardens. Poor shade tolerance. Good wear tolerance. Preferred cutting height 10-25mm. Invasive weed potential. Keep contained near bushland areas. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen palm-like perennial (2m x 2m) from Mexico. Shiny stiff pinnate leaves radiate from the trunk. Each leaflet with marginal thorns and tapering to a sharp point. Useful accent as a specimen or paired to flank entrances or driveways. Prefers well drained soil with regular water and partial shade. Tolerant of poor soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous globe shaped tree (9m x 4m) from Japan and mainland Asia. Glossy dark green oval leaves turning orange and red in autumn. Inconspicuous white flowers followed by edible orange red fruit in winter. Useful for its fruit; as a shade tree and for autumn colour. Suitable for espalier. Requires well drained soil in full sun. Prune to develop good framework when young. Many named varieties available. Tree tolerates drought but fruit drop occurs. Frost tolerant.

species: Dipladenia Red Riding Hood syn. Mandevilla sanderii Red Riding Hood
