Grevillea obtusifolia syn. Grevillea thelemanniana ssp. obtusifolia
value: Evergreen prostrate groundcover (0.3m x 1.5m) from WA. Linear to oblong leaves. Terminal clusters of red flowers in late winter and spring. Useful for mass planting over banks or mixed with other shrubs and groundcovers. Needs a sunny well drained position. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen small open shrub (0.7m x 0.8m) from Gosford NSW. Dark green narrow oval leaves. Pendulous clusters of dark red flowers on long stalks in the leaf axils. Useful small shrub for a rockery or understorey for a bush garden. Requires good drainage and full to partial sun. Frost and drought tolerant.
Non indigenous (Coastal Qld and Nth NSW)

Evergreen tall pyramidal shaped tree (25m x 10m) from coastal Qld and northern NSW. Light green pinnate leaves with lobed segments. Golden orange toothbrush-like flowers in early summer. Useful as a specimen or shade tree in large gardens. Bird attracting. Drops large seed pods and tendency to drop limbs. Minor invasive weed potential in bushland areas. Tolerates light frosts.

Evergreen rounded shrub (0.5-2m x 0.5-2m) with many variable forms from NSW . Narrow linear leaves. Clusters of red; red and cream; pink and cream; yellow or pale green flowers (depending on form) from winter to spring. Forms include 'Limelight'; 'Nana'; 'Lara Dwarf' and 'Desert Flame'. Useful mass planted or amongst other shrubs particularly in a bush garden or pruned for a hedge. Bird attracting. Prefers well drained soil in full to partial sun. Prune regularly to maintain compact form and avoid tendency to woodiness. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (NSW (Endemic to Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone Regions})

Evergreen erect shrub (1.5m x 1m) from NSW (endemic to Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone). Elliptical to linear stiff leaves with silky hairy young branches. Pink spider-like flowers in spring. Useful for a bush garden; mass planted or amongst other shrubs. Prefers sandy soil. Prune to maintain shape. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (NSW (near creeks in gullies Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone zone).)

Evergreen tall graceful shrub (3m x 2m) from NSW (including Sydney; gullies near creeks on Hawkesbury Sandstone). Strongly veined lanceolate leaves. Clusters of delicate translucent pale purple to greenish flowers often low on the bush in spring. Useful fast growing screen or background plant. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen rounded vigorous shrub (3-4m x 3m) from Qld. Variable lobed or entire dull green leaves; paler below. Terminal clusters of yellow and green flowers with prominent navy blue styles. Flowers throughout most of the year. Useful feature or screen for its unusual flower colour and extended flowering period. Bird attracting. fast growing in full sun. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen prostrate groundcover (0.2m x 3m) from Blue Mountains NSW. Natural hybrid between G. acanthifolia and G. laurifolia. Deeply divided oak-like leaves with red new growth in winter. Dark red toothbrush-like flowers in winter and spring. Useful as a groundcover and for spilling over embankment walls. Prefers a cool temperate climate. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen upright shrub (3m x 2m) from New Zealand; Chile and Brazil. Leathery deep green to yellowish green leaves irregularly marked with creamy white. Useful as a screen; windbreak or clipped hedge particularly for exposed coastal locations. Prefers well drained soil. Frost tolerant.

Perennial bulb (0.3m x 0.3m) from South America. Semi-erect glossy green strap shaped basal leaves. Funnel shaped pink flowers on leafless flower stems in early autumn. Useful for seasonal colour in a perennial garden. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen rounded compact shrub (2m x 2m) from NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone). Light green needle-like leaves less prickly than most Hakeas. Loose large clusters of pink and cream flowers on old wood in winter and spring followed by large woody seed pods. Useful for a screen or background. Bird attracting. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen upright rounded shrub (4m x 3m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney) and Vic. Stiff tough heavily veined leaves. Globular clusters of creamy white flowers in the leaf axils in spring followed by woody seed pods. Pink flowering form available. Useful for a quick growing screen. Bird attracting. Tolerant of poor soils. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (NSW (Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone & Blue Mountains region.))

Evergreen variable medium to large shrub with two distinct forms from Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone and Blue Mountains region. Erect stiff Blue Mountains form (1.5m x 1.5m) and open coastal form (4m x 3m). Thickened prickly needle-like leaves. White to creamy yellow flowers in axils of the upper leaves in winter to spring followed by prominent woody fruit. Useful background screen. Bird attracting. Prefers well drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld & NSW (Sydney sheltered gullies on sandstone soils))

Evergreen fast growing tall bushy shrub or small tree (5m x 3m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Long elliptic dark green leaves with pink-red new growth. Clusters of cream flowers in spring followed by woody fruit. Useful for a screen or background plant. Hardy. Can be short lived. Suitable for coastal gardens. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen bushy shrub (3m x 3m) from NSW (including Sydney); Vic and Tas. Prickly needle-like leaves with sharp points. Clusters of pink or cream flowers at the leaf joints in spring followed by large prominent woody fruit. Useful as a screen or component of a bush garden. Unless required for a barrier; plant where it cannot be brushed against. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen stiff erect shrub ( 2m x 2m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic and Tas). Prickly leaves with sharp needle-like points. Small white flowers in summer followed by dagger shaped woody fruit. Useful for forming an impenetrable barrier or screen. Plant where prickles will not be a problem. Tolerant of wide range of conditions. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen twining climber (3m) from WA. Compound leaves with three long narrow leaflets. Sprays of purple pea flowers in spring. Useful for growing on a trellis or smaller pergola. Suitable for coastal gardens. Prefers well drained soil in partial shade. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen vigorous twining climber (3m x 3m depending on support) from eastern Australia (including Sydney). Stiff dark green oblong to cordate leaves. Violet blue pea shaped flowers in late winter to spring. Useful as groundcover or fence cover. Can be short lived. Provide support if required and prune to keep within bounds. Prefers a well drained position. Some forms frost tolerant. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen semi-weeping and spreading small to medium tree (8-12m x 5m) from rainforests of Qld and NSW. Glossy blunt ended pinnate leaves. Long sprays of yellow flowers followed by decorative two lobed orange berries with stand out shiny black seeds in winter. Useful as a feature or shade tree. Tolerant of poor growing conditions. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen small compact shrub (0.3m x 0.3m). Hybrid from New Zealand. Minute crowded green leaves. Insignificant flowers. Useful low border or massed in a rock garden. Prefers a sunny site with well drained soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen small wide spreading shrub (0.7m x 1m) from New Zealand. Shiny dark green leaves; spear-shaped with a blunt tip. Dense spikes of purple flowers in summer. Useful for a low hedge; mass planting or as a border in perennial gardens. Suitable for coastal gardens. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen upright branched open shrub (1.2m x 1.2m). Probably hydrid of H. divaricata or H. rigidula from New Zealand. Narrow spear-shaped green leaves. Lavender flowers fading to white in summer and autumn. Useful for a feature; low hedge; mass planted or as border in perennial gardens. Suitable for coastal areas. Prune after flowering to maintain compact form. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen upright shrub (1.2m x 1.2m) from New Zealand. Long narrow leaves. Cascades of long white flowers in summer. Grows in most situations. Frost tolerant. Useful feature; low hedge; mass planted or as a border in perennial gardens. Suitable for coastal areas. Prune after flowering to maintain compact form. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen small compacted rounded shrub (0.4m x 0.4m) from New Zealand. Mid green leaves. Pink flowers fading to pale pink in early summer. Useful for a feature; mass planting or as a border in perennial gardens. Suitable for coastal areas. Prune after flowering to maintain compact form. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen compact rounded shrub (1m x 1m) from New Zealand. Mid-green glossy upright leaves. Lilac-violet flowers in early summer with periodic bursts of flower all year. Useful for a feature; low hedge; mass planted or as border in perennial gardens. Suitable for coastal areas. Prune after flowering to maintain compact form. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen small compact mounded shrub (0.5m x 0.5m) from New Zealand. Blue grey tightly bunched leaves. Short white flower spikes in summer. Useful for a small border or specimen. Suitable for coastal gardens. Prefers full sun. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen rounded shrub (1.5m x 1.5m). Hybrid from New Zealand. Dark glossy green oval leaves. Violet blue flowers in summer and autumn. Useful for a low hedge; mass planting or as a border in perennial gardens. Suitable for coastal gardens. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen vigorous self-clinging climber with adventitious rootlets and woody stems (to 15m depending on support) from Europe. Glossy dark green variably lobed leaves. Useful for covering south facing walls and fences or as groundcover. Inconspicuous flowers appear above foliage usually when it outgrows its structure. Invasive potential as seeds carried by birds. Drought tolerant in a shady location. Frost tolerant.

Upright perennial with fleshy rhizomes (1.8m x 1.2m) from India. Green leaves with deep maroon undersides on reddish basal stems. Butterfly-like orange-red flowers. Plantlets produced on old flower inflorescences. Useful feature in clumps or understorey particularly for textural or tropical effect. Needs a warm protected partial shade position. Prefers moist fertile soil. Tolerates light frosts. Cut back before winter and mulch in frost areas. Drought sensitive.

Fast-growing, tall erect, warm-season annual (0.5-1.5 m x 0.3 m) from North America.Large oval, serrated, green leaves. Large daisy-like brown or purple centred yellow flower heads in summer. Useful in clumps or as a background. Tall,intermediate and dwarf cultivars available.Prefers an open sunny well-drained position. Protect from strong winds.Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen dense mound forming shrub (0.6m x 1.5m) from South Africa. Grey heart shaped leaves covered with silver grey hairs. Small creamy white flowers produced occasionally. Useful for foliage contrast mixed with other shrubs and perennials. Prune to maintain compact form. Needs well drained soil in full sun. Tolerates light frosts. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen mounded bushy shrub (0.45m x 1m) from Peru. Semi-glossy finely wrinkled dark green leaves. Dense flat clusters of fragrant purple to lavender flowers in summer and autumn. Useful as groundcover; for a border or to trail over walls. Protect from the hottest afternoon sun. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen clump forming perennial (0.6m x 0.5m) from western Europe. Dark green divided palmate leaves. Clusters of nodding bell-shaped pale green flowers in late winter and spring. Useful in clumps as a groundcover or understorey. Needs a shady position with a moist well drained soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen clump forming perennial (0.4m x 0.5m) from Asia. Palmately divided leaves on erect and branching stems. Cup-shaped often pink or rose tinged pale green flowers in winter and early spring. Useful as a groundcover in shaded areas; understorey or in clumps for its flowers. Prefers a shady position with a moist well drained alkaline soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen clumping perennial (1.5m x 1.5m) from rainforests of Qld and NSW. Sword shaped leaves. Plume-like clusters of waxy pale pink flowers on erect stems in summer. Useful for a low light moist position particularly in association with a water feature; ferns or tropical foliage. Can grow in water. Prefers a shady damp position with well composted soil. Tolerates light to medium frosts. Drought sensitive.

Semi-deciduous and evergreen clump forming perennial (0.7m x 0.5m) from Asia. Long linear leaves. Stems of trumpet shaped flowers opening in succession and lasting one day. Large range of cultivars producing a wide range of colours including orange; red and yellow. Useful in a perennial border and for colour amongst shrubbery. Good soil binder. Best in full sun. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen mat forming perennial groundcover (0.03m x 0.5m) from Mexico and Guatemala. Bright green dense creeping leaves. Massed bright cerise pink flowers in summer. Useful as a carpet groundcover; between stepping-stones or to trail over walls and rocks. Prefers a slightly shaded position protected from the late afternoon sun. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen clump forming perennial (0.45m x 0.45m) from North America and Mexico. Purple palmate leaves. Short upright stems of small creamy white bell flowers in summer. Useful for edging; groundcover or in a rock or gravel garden. Divide clumps every few years. Prefers partial shade in well drained moist soil. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen clump forming perennial (0.45m x 0.45m) from North America and Mexico. Toothed deeply lobed leaves. Sprays of scarlet or coral red bell shaped flowers. Useful for edging; groundcover or for a rock or gravel garden. Divide clumps every few years. Prefers partial shade in well drained moist soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen sprawling groundcover with multiple trailing stems (0.3-0.6m x 1-1.5m) from SA; Vic; NSW (including Sydney) and Tas. Dark green stiff oblong leaves with a short point. Bright yellow flowers in spring. Useful groundcover; for height variation in a shrub bed; cascading over a low wall or hanging basket. Prefers well drained soil in full to partial sun. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone))

Evergreen small variable shrub (0.5m x 1m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone) and Vic. Grey-green fleshy linear to obovate leaves. Yellow flowers in spring and summer. Useful for rockeries; mixed with shrubs; or pot plant. Insect attracting. Prostrate form available. Requires well drained soil. Regenerates from suckers and seed. Prune tips regularly to maintain bushiness. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen dense semi-prostrate small shrub or groundcover spreading by layering (0.2m x 0.6m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney) and Vic. Shiny dark green leaves.Yellow flowers on long peduncles in spring. Some flowers present all year. Useful rockery plant or groundcover for suppressing weed growth. Tolerates all but very wet conditions. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen vigorous twining climber or groundcover (2m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Thick textured ovate to lance shaped bright green leaves. Yellow saucer-shaped flowers late spring and summer followed by red seeds. Useful for group planting as a groundcover or to cover a fence or structure depending on support. Tip prune to increase density. Tolerates light frost. Very tolerant to salinity. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen small rounded shrub (0.5m x 0.5m) from Qld; NSW; Vic; and SA. Narrow oblong hairy leaves. Yellow flowers throughout most of the year. Useful feature or massed rockery plant. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen variable tall open shrub (3-6m x 3m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Linear to oval leaves sometimes tri-lobed. Fragrant white; pale pink or yellow flowers with deep red centres in summer followed by hairy capsules. Useful feature or screen for a warm protected sunny position. Bird attracting. Prune back one third after flowering to maintain bushy form. Tolerates light frost. Provide protection in frost zones.

Evergreen dense variable shrubs (1.5-4m x 2-3m depending on variety) from China and hybridised in Hawaii and Fiji. Glossy green leaves deeply cut. Single or double open funnel shaped flowers in shades of red; pink; yellow and mauve in summer to autumn. Useful as a screen; accent; background plant or hedge. Island hybrids less hardy; requiring a more fertile soil. Prefers fertile well drained soil and a warm northerly position. Protect from strong wind. Tolerant to salinity. Frost sensitive.
Non indigenous (Qld; NSW; NT & South East Asia)

Evergreen dense rounded tree (7m x 5m) from Qld; NSW; NT and South East Asia. Light green round or heart shaped leaves. Yellow flowers with a dark velvety bronze red centre in spring. Useful as a small shade or feature tree particularly in a coastal location. Prefers sandy soil in full sun. Tolerant of salt spray. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen open shrub (1m x 1m) from NSW. Small grey green leaves. Cream to yellow fringed flowers aging to red in pairs on pendulous stems. Useful mixed with other shrubs particularly in a bush garden. Prefers well drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Responds well to pruning. Tolerates light to moderate frosts. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen low growing flat topped spreading shrub with horizontal branches (0.5m x 1m) from northern NSW. Grey-green crowded laterally flattened leaves. Some forms have reddish tinge. Small creamy yellow and dull red flowers in spring and summer. Useful specimen or grouped for its foliage colour and symmetrical form. Well suited for bonsai. Bird attracting. Prefers a shady protected position. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous arching clump-forming perennial (0.45m x 0.75m) from Japan. Glossy deeply veined lance shaped soft textured leaves forming almost a rosette. Stems 1m above the foliage carry pale lilac funnel shaped flowers in summer. Useful near ponds or bog gardens and suitable for containers. Prefers a moist semi shaded position. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen slow growing upright palm on a slender stem (10m x 3m) from Lord Howe Island. Pinnate broad and leathery leaves. Useful as a single specimen or in groups for a tropical effect. Prefers a semi-shaded position. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen woody stemmed twining and rooting climber (2m) from Southern China. Thick succulent leaves. Umbels of fragrant waxy star shaped white flowers with pink centres. Useful on a light trellis or vertical support in a protected position. Suitable for a container. Keep slightly underpotted. Prefers a warm position facing north to north east in well drained reasonably fertile soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Semi-deciduous bushy shrub (2m x 2m) from China. Oval glossy leaves with serrate margins. Large domed heads of pink; white or blue flowers in summer. Useful for mass planting and summer colour in a shady location. Prefers fertile soil in light to full shade. Prune back flower heads to just above last season's growth. Sensitive to salinity. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous mound forming shrub (1.5m x 2m) from the USA. Deeply lobed dark green leaves wrinkled downy beneath turning red and purple in autumn. Pyramidal white flower heads turning purplish with age. Useful specimen; massed or mixed with other shrubs. Needs well drained soil in partial shade. Prefers dry warm summers and cool winters. Drought sensitive. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen lily-like perennial (0.75m x 0.5m) from South America. Glossy green strap-shaped leaves. White flowers with elongated tips in summer. Useful for a perennial border or massed as a groundcover. Adaptable but prefers fertile soil. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen narrow slender tree with layered pagoda style branches (10m x 4m) from rainforests of Qld and NSW. Shiny oblanceolate leaves. Terminal clusters of fragrant creamy white flowers aging to mustard yellow in spring. Useful as a specimen or in groups in a protected position. Prefers some wind protection and well composted soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen vigorous creeping groundcover (0.3m x 1.5m) from Europe and Western Asia. Oval light green leaves. Yellowish orange flowers in summer. Useful to cover a sloping bank or massed under trees. Invasive potential. Plant only where it can be contained. Avoid use near bushland areas. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen soft loosely rounded shrub (1m x 1m) from WA. Fine linear leaves on greyish papery stems. White or pink flowers in whorls close to the stem in spring. Useful feature for a protected position. Needs excellent drainage to survive in Sydney. Sensitive to high summer heat and humidity. Prune after flowering to maintain bushy form. Frost tolerant.
Non indigenous (Southern Europe; northern Africa & western Asia)

Erect, bushy annual (0.3 m x 0.15 m) from southern Europe, northern Africa and western Asia. Lance-shaped, slightly-hairy, mid-green leaves. Erect racemes of fragrant, white flowers in spring and summer. Useful for a border, edging, bedding annual or cut flower. Variable cultivars available. Prefers well-drained, fertile soil in full sun. Tolerant of light shade. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen low spreading perennial (0.3m x 0.6m) from the Mediterranean region. Narrow oblong dark green leaves. Dense rounded heads of white flowers in spring and early summer. Useful for a border; edging or groundcover. Prune after flowering. Prefers well drained sandy soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen succulent branching annual or perennial with brittle stems (0.5m x 0.6m) from Asia. Oval to lance shaped leaves. Expanding tubular flowers in summer in variable shades and combinations of rose; scarlet and white. Useful in clumps for bedding; as a border or groundcover. Prefers a moist sunny to semi-shaded position. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen erect clump-forming perennial grass (0.4m x 0.4m) from SE Asia. Long thin leaf blades green at the base. Upper half of each blade turning blood red in summer then burgundy in autumn. Rarely flowers. Useful for borders; edging accent; massed as a groundcover and pot plant. Cut to ground in early spring. Requires full sun for strong leaf colour. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen open spreading or erect plant (2m x 2m) from all states of Australia (including Sydney). Pinnate blue green leaves open spaced on the stem. Sprays of purple pea flowers in summer. Useful as a hardy shrub in low maintenance areas or massed to cascade over a slope. Prune regularly for a more compact form. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen twining climber (3m) from the West Indies. Leaves with five to seven wavy edged radiating leaflets. Clusters of long stalked deep rose trumpet flowers in summer. Useful for its showy flowers and to cover a trellis or wall. Prefers well drained soil in a warm protected position. Drought and frost sensitive.

Robust perennial bearded iris with underground rhizomes (1m x 0.8m) from Europe. Broad ridged greyish green leaves. Large yellow flowers with patterns of delicate light brownish to purple veins. Useful for bog areas and erosion control. Grows in water to 0.2m depth. May outcompete other plants. Invasive potential. Avoid planting near waterways. Drought tolerant.

Bulbous iris (0.5m x 0.2m) from Europe. Slender grey green leaves appearing in winter. Orchid like flowers in shades of blue; purple; yellow; brown and white on long stems in spring. Useful planted in clumps for colour; in the perennial garden or mixed with annuals. Plant out bulbs in autumn; mulch with organic matter and fertilise fortnightly. Lift when foliage has died down naturally. Clean and store until following autumn. May leave in ground for 3-5 years until thinning required. Prefers well drained fertile acid soil. Protect from wind. Drought sensitive.
Indigenous (Australia (including Sydney); New Zealand; South America & South Africa)

Evergreen tufted perennial sedge (1m x 0.5m) from Australia (including Sydney); New Zealand; South America & South Africa. Leaves reduced to sheaths at the base of the stems. Globular reddish brown flower heads just below the stem apex in summer. Useful planted in groups as a feature for its vertical form and texture particularly in association with water. Ideal for binding sandy soils near the coast; on salt marshes and bogs. Hardy. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen usually upright sometimes prostrate shrub (2m x 1.5m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone). Stiff divided flattened leaves tinged purple in autumn to spring. Prominent terminal heads of yellow flowers in spring followed by globular cones. Useful as a feature for its interesting foliage and flower or mass planted as a tall groundcover. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Tolerates poor soils. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen erect spreading shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone regions). Leaves divided into narrow needle-like segments. Reddish stems and young growth. Prominent terminal heads of yellow flowers in spring followed by globular cones. Useful as a feature for its interesting foliage and flower or mass planted as tall groundcover. Hardy. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen erect shrub (3m x 2m) from NSW. Deep green leaves mostly divided into narrow oblanceolate segments. Large heads of creamy white flowers at the branch ends in winter and spring. Useful feature for its interesting foliage and flower; screen or background particularly in a bush garden. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Tolerates poor soils. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen small shrub (1m x 1.5m) from China. Elliptic to oblong bright green leaves. Terminal clusters of orange and scarlet flowers in late summer. Useful for its bright colour display in a tropical garden setting. Prefers fertile well drained soil in partial shade. Frost and drought sensitive.

Deciduous rounded tree with often naturally leaning trunk (10m x 6m) from Brazil. Bright green fern-like leaves of many tiny leaflets. Terminal clusters of lavender purple bell-shaped flowers in early summer. Useful as a feature tree to cast light shade. Moderately invasive root system. Minor invasive weed potential in bushland areas. Frost sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.
Indigenous (Qld & NSW (Sydney Cumberland Plain & occasionally on sandstone))

Evergreen tall shrub or small tree often with a weeping habit (4m x 2m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney Cumberland Plain and occasionally on sandstone). Grey green leafless branches often pendulous. Profuse yellow and red pea flowers in spring. Useful feature as a tree; light screen or background shrub. Prefers well drained soil in full sun or partial shade. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen woody stemmed scrambling climber (3m) from China. Glossy dark green lance-shaped leaves. Fragrant tubular pink to velvety red flowers in early summer followed by shiny black berries. Useful for screening a fence; wall or training over a frame. Suitable for a pot plant. Prefers well drained soil in a protected sunny position. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen woody stemmed semi-climber (2m) from the Himalayas. Leaves of five rounded leaflets. Clusters of very fragrant white flowers in summer and autumn. Useful maintained as a shrub; clipped as a hedge or allowed to climb over a fence near a walkway or window. Prefers full sun to partial shade. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen fast growing shrub or scrambling climber with long arching branches (3m) from China. Leaves of three narrow leaflets. Semi-double bright lemon yellow flowers during winter and spring. Useful erosion control to spill over banks and slopes; massed for its fountain-like habit or allowed to trail over fences or walls. Prefers well drained sandy soil. Prune after flowering. Tolerates light frosts. Recovers from moderate frosts. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen vigorous woody stemmed twining climber (3m) from China. Fern-like leaves with 5-7 leaflets. Large clusters of pink buds open to highly perfumed expanding tubular pinkish white flowers in spring. Useful for a trellis; fence or support on which it can climb. Suckers readily. Requires annual pruning to keep under control. Use where it can be contained and avoid use near bushland areas. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen twining climber or scrambling shrub (2m) from India. Broad wavy edged shiny leaves. Fragrant waxy white flowers in clusters in summer. Useful sprawling over a wall; massed over a bank or pruned to a compact shrub. Needs well drained soil in full sun. Frost and drought sensitive.
Indigenous (Widespread throughout Australia (including Sydney); NZ and New Caledonia)

Perennial rush or wetland grass forming loose clumps with rhizomes (1m height) widespread throughout Australia (including Sydney); NZ and New Caledonia. Leaves reduced to sheaths at the base of the stems. Pale flowers mostly evenly spaced along the branches. Useful in damp areas; a bog garden or sporadically flooded areas of a wetland. Provides food and cover for wildlife. Shade tolerant. Frost tolerant. Keep moist while establishing. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen slow growing coniferous conifer with an irregularly erect form (4m x 2m). Cultivar from Japan. Bright green scale-like leaves on widely angled often crooked branches. Useful specimen for its unusual form. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen fast growing densely branched columnar tree (4m x 1.5m) from China. Rich dark green scale-like leaves. Useful conifer for a screen; windbreak or feature including sheared topiary columns. Prefers fertile well drained soil. Susceptible to red spider mite and fungal disease. Frost and drought tolerant.
Non indigenous (North America; northern Europe & western Asia)

Evergreen slow growing compact spire-like dwarf conifer (0.8m x 0.45m) from North America; northern Europe and western Asia. Crowded grey green leaves on slender erect branches set closely together. Useful as a specimen for its small vertical accent; mixed with other conifers; for a courtyard; pot plant or miniature garden. Tolerates a wide range of soil types. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.
Non indigenous (North America; northern Europe & western Asia)

Evergreen compact coniferous tree forming a column of slender erect branches (3m x 0.9) from North America; northern Europe and western Asia. Dense blue grey leaves. Useful specimen for its vertical accent or screen. Prefers full sun. Tolerates a wide range of soil types. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.
Non indigenous (North America; northern Europe & western Asia)

Evergreen low growing mounded coniferous shrub or groundcover (0.5m x 2m) from North America; northern Europe and western Asia. Dark green densely packed leaves turning bronze green in autumn. Useful groundcover for mass planting or spilling over rocks. Tolerates a wide range of soil types. Sensitive to salt spray. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen dense branching groundcover (0.3m x 2.5m) from Japan. Green needle-like 'conifer' leaves with a bluish tinge. Small berry like cones. Useful in groups for covering a slope or bank. Wind and salt spray tolerant. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen prostrate coniferous groundcover (0.3m x 3m) from Japan. Tightly packed blue green needle-like leaves. Brown or black small berry-like fruit. Useful mass planted for a slope or embankment to prevent soil erosion. Suitable for coastal gardens. Tolerates any well drained soil in full sun. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen low spreading coniferous shrub (2m x 4m) from Europe and Western Asia. Deep green scale-like leaves on slender arching branches. Waxy blue-black berry-like fruit. Useful rock garden specimen; barrier plant or massed as tall groundcover. Prefers well drained soil in an open sunny position. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen narrow upright pole shaped coniferous tree (4m x 0.8m) from the USA. Scale-like aromatic blue grey leaves. Useful for an accent; narrow spaces or conifer garden. Needs a full sun position. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen mounded coniferous shrub (0.5m x 1m) from the Himalayas and western China. Silvery blue needle like leaves. Useful specimen or mass planted as groundcover. Needs well drained soil in full sun. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen upright spreading vase shaped coniferous shrub maturing to an irregular broad form (2m x 3m) from China. Prickly steely blue long pointed leaves with a silver sheen and pendulous outer tips. Useful specimen or background screen. Prune in winter to contain growth and encourage development of young leafy shoots. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen erect conical coniferous tree (7m x 3.5m) from the USA. Blue grey leaves with both scale-like adult and prickly needle-like juvenile leaf types present. Foliage colour turning purplish grey in autumn and winter. Small waxy purplish brown berries. Useful specimen or screen. Tolerant of most well drained soil except acidic soils. Frost tolerant.
Non indigenous (Hybrid between J. virginiana 'Glauca' & J. x media 'Pfitzeriana'.)

Evergreen spreading coniferous shrub (2-3m x 4m). Considered to be a hybrid between J. virginiana 'Glauca' and J. x media 'Pfitzeriana'. Scale-like silvery blue leaves on horizontal main branches and slender pendulous thread-like outer branchlets. Useful informal specimen where space permits unrestricted growth. Tolerates a wide range of soils and conditions. Frost tolerant.
Non indigenous (Hybrid between J. chinensis & J. sabina)

Evergreen vigorous vase-like coniferous shrub with tiered branches (2-3m x 3-4m). Cultivar of hybrid between J. chinensis and J. Sabina. Bluish green leaves with both adult and juvenile leaf types present. Prickly awl-shaped juvenile type and scale-like adult type. Useful specimen or in groups for large scale groundcover. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Tolerates shade. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen slender shrub (2m x 2m) from Brazil. Velvety hairy leaves. Long spikes of pink to rose flowers in summer. Useful for colour accent; as a fence cover or background where tops can be seen and untidy base is hidden. Prefers a semi-shaded warm position. After flowering prune back to 10 cm below the flower heads. Frost sensitive but often recovers. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen succulent perennial (1.5m x 3m) from Madagascar. Olive green triangular to lance shaped toothed leaves covered with fine brown hairs. Bell shaped yellow flowers only on mature plants. Useful in a gravel or rock garden and mixed with other succulents. Needs full sun and well drained soil. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen vigorous climber (6m) from WA. Dark green trifoliate leaves. Black and yellow pea flowers. Useful for quick cover of a fence; bank or unsightly scar. Needs room to move. Suitable for coastal gardens. Bird attracting. Moderately frost tolerant . Drought tolerant.

Evergreen vigorous climber (to 3m) with twining stems from Qld; NSW (including Sydney) & Vic. Dark green variable trifoliate leaves. Dull red pea flowers with a prominent keel in spring. Useful for screening fences and other structures; mass planting as a groundcover and stabilising embankments. Hardy. Tolerant of salt spray. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen clump forming perennial (1m x 0.7m) from South Africa. Strap shaped floppy dark green leaves. Tubular flowers in dense racemes rising from foliage clumps on 1m long spikes in summer. Colours usually red or yellow or variants of those colours. Useful as groundcover; border or in clumps for striking colour display. Remove old leaves. Lift in late winter to separate. Requires a sunny position. Wind and salt tolerant. Frost sensitive.

Deciduous tree with broad crown (12m x 7m) from China. Pinnate leaves turning yellow in autumn. Long terminal sprays of yellow flowers in summer. Useful as a shade or feature tree. Potential bushland invader. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen spreading and variable shrub (2.5m x 2.5m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone & Wianamatta Shale regions); Vic; & Tas. Narrow olive green heath-like leaves. Clusters of fluffy white flowers in spring. Pink form available. Useful as a fast growing screen or mass planted over a bank. Hardy. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen slender erect shrub (1.25m x 0.5m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Tiny crowded obovate leaves on short lateral branches. Hairy when young. Mauve pink flowers crowded in a head at the tip of each branch. Useful specimen or mass planted for the interest of its flowers particularly in a bush garden. Prefers sandy soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen trailing or prostrate groundcover (0.3m x 3m) from Cooma NSW. Small obovate dull green leaves. White fluffy flowers in summer. Useful groundcover for slopes or any large open area. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Tolerates heavier clay soils. Frost and drought tolerant.

Deciduous spreading small tree (6m x 5m) from Europe. Glossy trifoliate leaves. Pendant chains of large yellow flowers in spring. Useful as a small shade or feature tree or may be trained over a trellis. Flowers and seeds are toxic. Pick spent flowers to prevent seed setting. Shelter from severe winds. Frost tolerant.

Deciduous to semi-deciduous small tree (6m x 3m) from China with attractive smooth and gnarled trunk in mottled colours. Elliptical shaped leaves. Flowers pink; red or white on terminal panicles during summer. Useful as a small shade tree; flowering feature tree or for group plantings. Suitable for coastal areas. Susceptible to powdery mildew - Indian Summer forms resistant. Dwarf forms available as shrubs. Drought tolerant after establishment. Semi frost sensitive but recovers well. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.
Non indigenous (Qld; Norfolk Is & Lord Howe Is.)

Evergreen pyramidal tree (10m x 5m) from Qld; Lord Howe Is and Norfolk Is. Elliptical grey-green leaves. Soft pink waxy hibiscus-like flowers in spring followed by hairy seed pods. Useful as a shade tree; windbreak or screen particularly in coastal locations. Needs well drained soil. Hairs on seed pods can be a skin irritant to some. Tolerant of salt spray and frost.

Evergreen erect prickly bushy shrub (2m x 1.5m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone regions). Stiff olive green leaves with a sharp point. Erect clusters of red flowers enclosed in red bracts followed by woody fruit. Useful for a screen or feature. Bird attracting. Tolerant of salt spray. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen mat forming perennial (0.15 x 1m) from Europe. Heart shaped mauve tinged often pink flushed leaves with a central silvery stripe. Cluster of hooded mauve-pink flowers in whorls around the stem. Useful as a groundcover. Needs a sunny moist position. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen prostrate succulent perennial (0.4m x 0.7m) from South Africa. Short cylindrical tapering grey green leaves. Daisy-like bright orange flowers open in the summer sun. Useful as a groundcover; for edging or trailing over rocks and walls. Suitable for containers and windowsill troughs. Needs good drainage in full sun. Sensitive to over watering. Drought tolerant. Frost sensitive.

Deciduous erect conical coniferous tree with a broadening form in maturity (20m x 10m) from Europe and Asia. Pale green leaves with both scale-like adult and slightly flattened soft needle-like juvenile types present; maturing to mid green turning to yellow in autumn. Widely spaced horizontal branches drooping at the ends. Useful specimen for large cool climate gardens. Prefers fertile moist well drained soil. Sensitive to drying winds. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous tall broadly conical coniferous tree with an erect trunk and horizontal to ascending main branches (25m x 15m) from Japan. Greyish green needle-like leaves turning yellowish orange in autumn. Purplish red outer branchlets and new shoots. Small cones. Useful specimen for large cool climate gardens. Prefers fertile moist well drained soil. Sensitive to drying winds. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen, tendril-climbing annual (3 m) from Sicily. Dwarf, non-climbing varieties are bush-like. Oval, green leaves with tendrils. Floppy scrambling stems need support. Mostly scented flowers in shades of pink, blue, purple or white. Useful for scented cut flowers orto cover a fence or structure. Bush varieties can be used asa border or massed for colour display. Prefers full sun in fertile soil. Require regular watering in summer. Mulch to keep root zone cool. Avoid over fertilising. Cut off flowers before seed set. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen small broadly conical tree (6m x 4m) from Greece. Aromatic leathery oval pointed leaves. Small yellow flowers in spring followed by green turning black fruit. Useful for clipped specimens; as a screen; in the herb garden or as a tub plant. Protect from wind. Frost tolerant.

Semi-evergreen upright bushy shrub with square upright stems (1.5m x 1m) from the Mediterranean region. Aromatic silver grey linear leaves. Fragrant purple flowers on erect terminal whorled spikes. Useful for a low hedge; edging and borders; cut flowers; mass planting and contrast amongst mixed shrubbery. Prefers a sunny and well-drained position. Sensitive to high humidity and over watering. Prune back one third after flowering. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen bushy shrub with woody stems (1.5m x 1m) from the Mediterranean region. Tiny grey green aromatic toothed leaves. Fragrant lavender blue flowers on short stems. Useful for a low hedge; cut flowers or pot-pourri and contrast amongst shrubbery. Prune to maintain shape. Prefers a sunny and well drained position. Sensitive to high humidity and over watering. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen small spreading shrub (0.5m x 0.75) from WA. Bluish green soft crowded leaves on slender arching branches. Variable coloured flowers mostly in blue to deep blue in spring and summer. White flowering cultivar available. Useful for rock gardens and for colour splashes particularly in a bush garden. Needs sandy soil with perfect drainage. May be short lived and require replacing every few years. Suckering forms have improved life span. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen rounded shrub (2m x 2m) from NSW. Small round dark green leaves. White flowers in early summer. Useful feature or background shrub and suitable for coastal gardens. Tolerant of salt spray. Prefers well drained soil. Shade tolerant. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen variable upright or spreading shrub (1.5-3m x 1-2m) from NSW (including Sydney). Small crowded prickly leaves forming soft dense thickets. White flowers in early spring and summer. Useful for a screen or informal hedge. Tolerates poorly drained soil. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Coastal dunes NSW (Sydney); Vic. Tas & SA)

Evergreen tall dense shrub with flaky bark (6m x 4m) from NSW (including Sydney); Vic; Tas & SA coastal dunes. Grey-green obovate leaves with a blunt tip. White flowers in spring followed by domed woody fruit. Useful as a windbreak or screen for coastal gardens. Hardy. Very tolerant of salt spray. Frost and drought tolerant.
