Leptospermum macrocarpum Syn L lanigerum var macrocarpum
value: Evergreen scrambling shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) from Sydney Blue Mountains NSW. Oval to oblong leaves. Large white; red or pink flowers with prominent green centres in summer and autumn followed by large woody fruits. Useful feature; screen; between shrubs or as background. Prefers full sun or partial shade. Tolerates severe pruning if necessary. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen shrub or small tree with slender branches and lightly textured crown (4m x 3m) from Qld and NSW. Glossy green narrow elliptical strongly lemon scented leaves; bronze coloured when young. Profuse small white flowers along the outer branches in spring and summer. Useful as a light screen; background shrub or feature plant. Hardy. Slightly frost sensitive.

Evergreen rounded shrub with pendulous branches (1.5m x 2m). Cultivar of L. polygalifolium from Qld and NSW. Light green oblong leaves. Profuse white flowers in late spring and summer. Useful as a feature; massed as a groundcover where height is required; low screen or mixed with shrubbery. Resistant to salt spray. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant
Indigenous (NSW; south from Sydney (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone))

Evergreen spreading shrub with many variable forms. (2m x 3m) from NSW south from Sydney (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone). Shiny round crowded leaves. White to purplish pink flowers in spring and early summer. Useful fast growing screen; hedge or feature. Select form for large flowers; deep colour and profusion of flower. Prostrate form 'Julie Ann' available. Tolerant of salt spray. Frost tolerant.
Indigenous (Colo River area; Blue Mountains NSW.)

Evergreen erect shrub (2-3m x 2m). Endemic to the Colo River area; Blue Mountains; NSW. Neat narrow elliptical leaves. Red flowers in spring and summer. Useful feature or screen for its neat foliage and showy flowers. Needs well drained soil and a sunny position. Prune after flowering to maintain vigour and form. Frost tolerant.
Indigenous (NSW (Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone; Cumberland Plain & Blue Mtns) and Vic)

Evergreen shrub with an open habit and flaky papery bark (4m x 3m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone; Cumberland Plain and Blue Mtns) and Vic. Light green flat oblong leaves. White flowers throughout the year; mostly in spring. Useful for a screen; hedge or specimen for its attractive bark. Bird attracting. Tolerant of a wide range of soils. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen symmetrical small tree (5m x 3m) from South Africa. Silky and clustered silvery lanceolate leaves. Small waratah-like flowers with male and female flowers on separate trees. Useful as an accent for its foliage contrast. Needs sandy soil with perfect drainage. Protect from wind. Avoid root disturbance. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen dense rounded shrub (1m x 1m) from Vic; SA and WA. Silvery grey scale-like leaves. Insignificant greenish yellow globular flower heads in summer. Useful foliage contrast plant for coastal and hot dry gardens. Highly tolerant of salt spray. Needs well drained soil in full sun with good air movement. Sensitive to high humidity. May be short-lived and need replacing every few years. Prune regularly to keep compact. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen arching shrub (2m x 3m) from the SE North America. Leathery glossy dark green leaves with long points and sharp teeth turning bronze purple in autumn. Pendulous sprays of small urn-shaped flowers in spring. Useful companion shrub of rhododendron; camellia and azalea sharing similar growing conditions. Prefers a semi-shaded position with moist acid fertile soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen clump forming perennial (0.6m x 0.3m) from North America. Basal tufts of grass-like green leaves. Spikes of crowded fluffy rose-purple flower heads opening from the top downwards in late summer. Useful for its colour and vertical accent in a border; perennial garden; pot plant or cut flower. Needs well drained soil in full sun. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld; Vic & NSW (including Sydney rainforest understorey in the Illawarra zone))

Evergreen tufted grass-like perennial (0.5 x 0.4) from Vic; NSW (including Sydney Illawarra zone rainforest understorey) & Qld. Grass-like leaves. Spreading panicles of white flowers. Useful as a massed groundcover; for borders and edges. Prefers a shady position with ample moisture. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Flowering bulb with stem roots producing one unbranched leafy stem (0.6-1.5 x 0.4m) from Japan. Long scattered lance-shaped leaves. Several to 10 per stem of fragrant white widely bowl-shaped flowers. Each petal with a central red or yellow band and often red or yellow spots. Useful for colour in the perennial garden; in mass plantings and for cut flowers. Suitable for containers. Prefers a filtered shade position with perfect drainage. Requires ample water in summer. Susceptible to fungal disease. Avoid overhead watering to reduce fungal occurrence. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen perennial (0.7m x 0.5m) from Africa. Grey green oval to diamond shaped leaves forming rosettes. Large dense clusters of small deep blue papery flowers on stiff stems. Useful in massed beds or borders. Suitable for coastal gardens. Prefers full sun. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen annual (0.4 m x 0.3 m) from the Mediterranean region. Olive-green leaves with sinuate margins. Blue, pink, yellow and white flower bracts. Useful for flower beds, mixed borders and cut or dried flowers. Salt-spray tolerant. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen slow growing slender single-stemmed palm (4m x 1.5m) from rainforests in NSW and Qld. Pinnate fronds to 1.2m. Pendulous flower spikes followed by strings of bright red fruit in autumn. Useful pot plant or small palm for a shady garden. Prefers moist well composted soil in a protected position. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen vigorous upright perennial with slender stems (0.3m x 0.15m) from Europe; North America and Asia. Grass-like leaves. Clusters of open funnel shaped light blue flowers in succession throughout summer. Useful for a border; perennial or rock garden or massed for informal naturalised areas. Prefers well drained fertile soil in full sun. Frost and drought tolerant.

Deciduous large conical tree (18m x 8m) from America. Glossy dark green star shaped leaves palmately lobed turning yellow to bright red in autumn. Corky bark develops on trunk and branches. Useful as a shade or feature tree for large gardens. Tolerates wind exposure and periodic waterlogging. Invasive root system. Avoid planting close to structures. Spiny woody capsule fruit can be a nuisance in traffic areas. Drought and frost tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Deciduous vigorous large spreading tree (15-20m x 10m) from North America. Lobed deep green leaves with a notched tip turning yellow in autumn. Variegated leaf form available. Solitary large fragrant greenish white tulip-shaped flowers in spring. May take 5 years or more to flower. Useful as a shade or specimen tree in a large garden. Prefers moist well drained acid soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen clumping grass-like perennial (0.6m x 0.5m) from Japan; China & Vietnam. Linear glossy dark green leaves. Useful as a border; accent or mass planted as groundcover under tall trees. Spikes of violet bell shaped flowers in summer. Prefers a partly shaded position with well drained soil. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen tall mop-headed palm with a slender stem (25m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney) and Vic. Bright green palmately divided fronds to 4m long. Small yellow flowers on branched hanging panicles followed by hard black globular fruit. Useful as a specimen or in groups for a tropical theme and contrast of its form. Frost tolerant. Wind and salt tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen, low and semi-trailing annual (0.15 m x 0.25 m) from South Africa. Densely-packed, purplish-green, lance-shaped leaves. Small two-lipped flowers in many variable shades of blue and white continuously produced throughout summer and autumn. Useful as an edging or bedding annual,for trailing over rocks orin hanging baskets or containers. Tolerates shade but produces less flowers. Peridic pruning produces more flowers. Requires moist soil. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen, fast-growing, spreading annual (0.15 m x 0.3 m) from Europe. Greyish-green, tiny leaves. Rounded heads of tiny, scented, white or shades of lilac flowers throughout summer and autumn. Useful as a border edge, in containers as a groundcover, for spilling over edges and window boxes and between rocks or stepping stones. Tolerates poor soil. Prefers a sunny position. Self seeds freely. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant.

Cool season short lived tufted perennial turf grass with no stolons or rhizomes from North Africa and Asia. Bright glossy green leaf blades ridged on the upper surface with a coarse and tufted appearance. Useful as a temporary turf and often used as part of lawn grass seed mixtures and to oversow other turf species in autumn and spring. Requires oversowing annually to maintain a dense sward. Preferred cutting height of 38mm. Tough leaf fibres do not cut cleanly often resulting in leaf tip discolouring. Sensitive to high temperatures. Drought sensitive. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen small rounded ball shaped grass-like perennial (0.3m x 0.3m) from NSW (including Sydney); Qld and Vic. Crowded bright green linear leaves. Small spikes of cream flowers mostly hidden within the foliage in spring. Useful as a formal border; for mass plantings or as understorey in a bush garden. Prefers full sun to partial shade. Tolerates poor soil. Rejuvenates well from pruning in spring or autumn. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen tussock forming perennial grass (0.7m x 1m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic; SA & Tas. Narrow strap-like leaves arch over with age. Perfumed buff yellow flower spikes on flattened stems with prickly spines. Useful as a groundcover; border or mass planted particularly on a difficult site. Dwarf form 'Tanika' available. Drought and frost tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld & NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone))

Evergreen erect shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) from Qld & NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone). Stiff much divided leaves. Long sprays of cream flowers on erect stems above the foliage in summer followed by woody fruit. Useful for its unusual foliage particularly in a bush garden. Tolerates shade. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen erect vigorous shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) from China. Small glossy green oval leaves. Fragrant small cream flowers in spring followed by purple fruit. Useful as a fast growing hedge or low screen. Prefers well drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen tall round headed tree (35m x 20m) from Qld & NSW. Lance shaped shiny leathery leaves in whorls. White feathery flowers in spring followed by woody capsules. Useful for a shade; specimen or windbreak tree in a large garden. Tolerant of a wide range of conditions. Performs best in fertile moist well drained soil. Moderately frost tolerant. Drought tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.
Non indigenous (Japanese selected cultivar from L. chinense from China)

Evergreen vigorous rounded shrub (2m x 2m). Selected cultivar of L. chinense from China. New leaves red-purple turning reddish-purple to dark olive-green on older leaves. Reddish-purple spidery flowers. Useful accent or mixed with shrubbery for its contrasting foliage colour. Prefers well drained moist loam in partial shade. Tolerant of light frosts. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen rounded well branched shrub (2m x 2m) from China. Dull green oval leaves on rusty hairy stems. Creamy yellow spidery flowers with thin petals in winter. Useful as a feature or mixed with shrubbery. Many cultivars available. Prefers well drained moist loam in partial shade. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen erect and branching shrub (3m x 2m) from the Himalayas. Bronze green soft oval leaves with reddish veins. Large terminal clusters of fragrant pink flowers in winter. Useful for its fragrant winter flowers in a protected position. Requires perfect drainage. Protect from hot winds. Prune after flowering. Can be susceptible to root rot disease. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen upright shrub (3-4m x 3m) from South America. Aromatic dark green leaves. Cup shaped white flowers in summer. Useful as a hedge or screen or for bonsai culture. Tolerates hard clipping. Requires full sun and well drained soil. Tolerant of mild coastal conditions. Protect from strong winds. Frost and drought sensitive.

Annual short-lived fruiting vegetable (1.5m x 0.5m) from South America. Variable habit between bush and vine depending on variety. Pinnate leaves on slightly succulent stems. Yellow flowers in racemes. Juicy edible yellow to red fruit. Useful for its edible fruit in the vegetable garden. Needs fertile well drained soil. Can require staking for support. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen erect and branching tree (10m x 4m) from Qld and NSW. Dark green oblong leaves toothed and in whorls. Creamy white flowers in narrow heads from the leaf axils in spring. Edible nut matures in autumn. Useful as a shade or shelter tree and for its nut production. Prefers moist deep and fertile soil. Drought and frost tender.

Evergreen spreading shrub (2m x 2m) from South Africa. Oval pointed deep green leaves. Spikes of tubular dark veined lavender flowers in summer. Useful for its colour as a specimen; screen or mixed with shrubbery. Prefers a semi-shaded position. Tip prune when young to develop a bushy habit. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen clumping perennial (0.5m x 0.5m) from WA. Grey green strap-like leaves. Branched flower spike to 0.8m with green tubular flowers covered with dense jet black hairs. Useful for a feature or grouped in a raised bed or pot plant. Needs excellent drainage and sandy soil. May be short lived. Susceptible to fungal disease in humid conditions. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen palm-like cycad (1m x 1.5m) from NSW (including Sydney). Tough pinnate dark green leaves radiating out from the crown. Male and female cones on different plants with female cone resembling a pineapple. Useful specimen or understorey for eucalypts. Prefers filtered light and well drained sandy soil. Susceptible to scale attack. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen pyramidal shaped tree broadening with age (12m x 8m) from Southern USA. Glossy dark green leathery leaves densely arranged on the branches. Large lemon scented creamy white flowers at the branch tips in summer. Useful feature or shade tree for a large garden. Cultivar 'Exmouth' flowers at yonger age than M. grandiflora. Prefers full sun with moist acid well drained soil. Mulch to protect root zone. Moderately frost tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen columnar tree with compact growth habit (5m x 3m) from USA. Dwarf form of Magnolia grandiflora. Glossy green leaves with velvet bronze underside. Large fragrant creamy white flowers in spring and summer. Useful for a feature; screen and courtyard tree. Prefers fertile moist acid soil. Sensitive to salinity. Mostly frost tolerant but needs protection when young. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous shrub or small tree erect and branching from the base with a rounded crown (5m x 3m) from China and Japan. Oblong to ovate leaves. Flowers tulip-like rose pink to purple on the outside and white inside before the leaves in late winter. Useful as a feature plant. Protect from wind. Prefers fertile moist soil. Many forms available. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen upright open shrub (2m x 1.5m) from North America. Glossy dark green pinnate leaves sometimes turning red in winter. Terminal spikes of small yellow flowers in spring followed by black berries. Useful grouped as tall understorey or mixed with other shrubs particularly on a difficult site. Tolerates heavy shade. Frost and drought tolerant.

Deciduous small pyramidal tree maturing to a round-headed form with spiny young branches (4m x 3m) from North America. Dark lustrous green coarsely serrated leaves turning yellow gold in autumn. Pendant clusters of fragrant soft pink flowers in late spring. Useful as a lawn or garden bed specimen or for a raised planter box. Needs good drainage. Prefers a cool high altitude climate. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen woody stemmed twining climber (4m) from Argentina. Deep green heart shaped leaves. Sprays of pure white fragrant trumpet-shaped flowers in summer followed by bean-like fruit in autumn. Useful to cover a wire mesh or lattice vertical surface. Needs a warm sheltered position. Prefers moist fertile well drained soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen spreading tree with a dense crown (12m x 8m) from Indonesia. Dark green lanceolate shiny prominently veined leaves. Perfumed yellow or red fruit followed by mango fruit in summer. Useful as a fruit or shade tree for a warm protected position. Requires fertile soil regularly replenished with organic matter or fertiliser in the growing season. Protect from wind. Fruit is susceptible to fruit fly attack and black spot fungus. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen, upright-branching, cool-season biennial or annual (0.6 m x 0.4m) from Europe and Asia. Lance-shaped, soft, greyish-green leaves. Terminal spikes of fragrant, clustered, single or double flowers in shades of pink, purple, red and cream in late winter and spring. Useful for colour display and flower perfume and as a cut flower. Requires well-drained, loam soil enriched with organic matter and lime. Avoid replanting in same soil in successive years. Drought sensitive.
Non indigenous (SA; Vic; NSW; Tas; Qld and New Zealand)

Evergreen dense mat forming groundcover with an underground rhizome (0.15m x 0.5m) from SA; Vic; NSW; Qld; Tas and New Zealand. Obovate leaves forming rosettes. Tubular lilac; purple or white flowers held on slender stems above the foliage in spring. Useful for a groundcover or lawn substitute in moist shaded areas. Tolerates poorly drained areas and foot traffic. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen large bushy shrub or small tree (5m x 7m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney) and Vic. Soft fine dark green leaves. White bottlebrush like flowers in spring and summer. Useful as a screen; windbreak and bird attracting. Very tolerant to salinity. Prune back heavily at planting to encourage self bracing. Susceptible to sawfly larvae. Drought tolerant and semi frost tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.
Non indigenous (Cultivar of M. bracteata from Australia)

Evergreen compact dwarf form shrub with a semi-weeping habit (2m x 2m). Cultivar of M. bracteata from Australia. Narrow yellow-green leaves becoming more golden at the leaf tips. Useful specimen or massed for its colour contrast. Suitable pot plant. Toleratant of poor drainage. Frost and drought tolerant *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.
Non indigenous (Qld; NT; SA and NSW)

Evergreen small bushy tree (6m x 4m) from Qld; NT; SA and NSW. Fine dark green leaves. Cylindrical spikes of cream flowers in summer. Useful as a shade tree; screen or windbreak. Bird attracting. Hardy. Prefers good drainage but tolerates a heavy soil. Frost and drought tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.
Indigenous (Qld & NSW (Sydney; marshy ground on Cumberland Plain & Illawarra zones))

Evergreen large shrub or small tree (6-10m x 3m) with papery bark from Qld & NSW (including Sydney Cumberland Plain and Illawarra zones). Flat linear leaves. Sweetly scented creamy white flowers in loose spikes profuse at the ends of branches in summer. Useful as a screen or feature. Insect and bird attracting. Tolerant of poor drainage. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen dense rounded shrub (2m x 2m) from SA and Vic. Grey green linear leaves on slightly pendulous branches. Small pink to mauve fading to white bottlebrush like flowers in summer. Useful for a hedge; screen or background. Hardy. Tolerates poorly drained soil. Frost and drought tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.
Indigenous (NSW (sunny seepages on Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone regions))

Evergreen large rounded shrub with arching stems (3m x 2m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone regions). Slightly aromatic elliptical leaves in opposite arrangement. Red bottlebrush-like flower spikes in summer. Useful as a screen or informal hedge especially for coastal locations. Bird attracting. Salt spray tolerant. Prefers a sandy moist position. Opportunistic plant which can seed freely. Protect from frost when young. Drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen pendulous shrub with compact soft growth (2.5m x 2m) from WA. Hairy grey leaves on thin branches. Soft creamy yellow brush-like flowers in late spring and summer. Useful specimen; screen; hedge or mass planted for its graceful habit and foliage contrast. Protect from strong wind. May be susceptable to scale insect attack. Responds well to pruning. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen erect shrub (1.5m x 1m) from WA. Light green linear leaves tapering to a point. Orange-red bottlebrush -like flowers usually on older wood in spring and summer. Useful feature or amongst shrubbery for its showy flowers. Bird attracting. Needs moist well drained soil in full sun. Tip prune regularly to maintain compact form. Frost tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney in marshy swamps on Cumberland Plain & Hawkesbury sandstone))

Evergreen small bushy tree with corky whitish bark (10m x 5m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Bright green linear leaves. Dense terminal spikes of creamy white feather-like flowers in late spring. Useful as a screen; shade tree or to soak up water in a wet position. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen fast growing tall bushy shrub (4m x 3m) from WA. Oval grey green leaves. Terminal heads of deep mauve flowers in late spring and summer. Useful as a screen or feature plant. Prefers sandy well drained soil. Moderately frost tolerant.

Evergreen rounded tall shrub (4m x 2.5m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney) & SA. Linear leaves with pointed ends. Globular heads of creamy yellow flowers in spring and summer followed by knobbly clusters of capsules. Useful as a screen or feature. Tolerant of salt spray and poor drainage. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney); New Guinea & New Caledonia)

Evergreen tree with densely textured crown and papery bark (15m x 7m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); New Guinea and New Caledonia. Hard lanceolate leaves. Cream flower brushes in autumn and winter. Useful as a shade tree or background screen in large gardens. Bird attracting. Tolerant to wind and salinity. Invasive root system. Drought and pollution tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.
Indigenous (NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone); Vic; SA & Tas)

Evergreen erect shrub (2m x 1.5m) from NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone); Vic; SA and Tas. Crowded stiff pointed leaves. Terminal heads of mauve sometimes cream flowers at the tips of branches in spring. Useful screen or background plant particularly for a damp position. Tolerates poorly drained soil. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld & NSW (Sydney in swampy places on sandstone & shale))

Evergreen small tree with papery bark (6-10m x 3m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Cylindrical spikes of creamy white flowers. Useful as a feature or screen. Bird attracting. Prefers moist well drained loam. Tolerates a poorly drained position. Moderately frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen small shrub with slender wiry reddish stems (0.8m x 1.5m) from Qld & NSW (including Sydney). Small crowded leaves. Irregular clusters of mauve sometimes white 'claw' type flowers on older wood. Useful as a specimen; in group plantings or mass planted for extensive groundcover. Bird attracting. Tolerates poorly drained soils. Cultivars include 'White Lace'; 'Pink Lace' & 'Little Beauty'. Frost and drought tolerant.

Deciduous spreading tree (15m x 6m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Large compound leaves. Sprays of lilac flowers in late spring followed by orange coloured fruit (poisonous). Useful as a shade tree. Fruit is bird attracting. Drought and frost tolerant.
Indigenous (Rainforests & gullies in Qld & NSW (Sydney Illawarra).)

Evergreen spreading tree (10m x 7m) from rainforests and gullies in Qld and NSW (including Sydney Illawarra). Trifoliate leaves. Dense clusters of white flowers in summer followed by glossy black fruit. Useful specimen or component of a rainforest themed garden. Bird and butterfly attracting. Prefers well drained soil. Tolerates light frosts. Drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Large genus of creeping perennial herbs (0.4m x 0.6m) from the Mediterranean region. Variable paired leaves strongly aromatic. Whorled spikes of mauve flowers. Useful in the vegetable or herb garden for its culinary flavour in food and drink. Suitable for containers. Commonly grown mints include spearmint (M. spicata); peppermint (M.x piperita) and common mint (M. cordifolia). Prefers moist fertle soil. Protect from hot afternoon sun. Mild invasive potential controlled by regular pruning. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous tall conical coniferous tree with a broadening crown in maturity (22m x 12m) from China. Soft linear blue-green leaves turning yellow; pink and red in autumn. Globose shaped cones. Useful specimen. Suitable only for the largest cool season gardens. Prefers deep moist sandy soils. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.
Non indigenous (Cultivar probably from the Pacific Islands)
Fiji Fire New Zealand Christmas Bush

Evergreen bushy shrub (2m x 1.5m). Cultivar from unknown parentage. Brilliant red new growth throughout the year. Sparse tufts of orange stamen flowers in summer. Useful as a feature for its showy foliage display; screen or hedge particularly in a coastal area. Mulch to maintain moisture in dry periods. Tolerant of salt spray and wind. Frost sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen spreading large shrub or small tree often with gnarled form (8m x 6m) from New Zealand. Grey-green elliptic leaves with felted light grey underneath. Crimson red brush flowers in early summer. Useful as a hedge; screen or small feature tree particularly in coastal locations. Many smaller shrub forms available. Tolerant to salinity and pollution. Frost tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen bushy shrub (2.5m x 1.5m) from Asia. Dark green large glossy leaves. Fragrant brownish pink open cup-shaped flowers. Useful as a specimen; hedge or container plant. Prefers fertile well drained acid soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen rounded tree (6-10m x 8m) from China. Large glossy green leaves. Fragrant white to pale yellow flowers in spring. Useful feature for its scented flowers and shade tree. Prefers fertile acid soil. Sensitive to wind. Variable forms available. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen dense shrub (3m x 3m) from China. Glossy green leaves. Perfumed yellow flowers edged with purple; almost hidden by foliage. Useful as a screen; hedge or specimen near paths for its perfume. Prefers moist well drained soil. Can be prone to scale attack. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen fern (0.8m x 0.6m) with an arching habit and creeping rootstock from India and Asia. Pale green deeply cut and divided fronds. Useful pot plant on a shaded balcony or as understorey or groundcover in a protected garden bed. Needs a shady position and moist soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen shrub or groundcover with a variable upright to prostrate form (0.2-0.8m x 1.5m) from SA; Vic; ACT and NSW. Small conifer-like dark green leaves. Minute white cup-shaped flowers aging to red in spring to summer. Useful for a specimen or massed as groundcover particularly for a bush or gravel garden. Select prostrate form for groundcover. Needs a well drained sunny position. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen perennial with edible tuberous roots (0.3m x 0.4m) from most states of Australia. Many variable forms. Tufted rosette of lobed or toothed linear leaves. Pendulous drooping buds opening to dandelion-like bright yellow flowers in spring and summer followed by a cluster of fluffy white seeds. Useful for a rock or gravel garden or clumped in a perennial border. Important food source for Aborigines. Prefers well drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen vigorous climber (8m) from Qld and NSW. Glossy pinnate leaves. Terminal sprays of large white to purple pea-shaped flowers in spring followed by velvety pods. Useful as an alternative climber to exotic wisteria particularly in a rainforest or bush themed garden. Requires strong support for climbing and room to grow. Prefers fertile well drained soil in full to partial sun. Tolerates light frosts. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous upright mound to arching clump-forming perennial grass (1m x 1m) from Asia. Narrow pale green leaves with creamy white stripes. Coppery tan flower plumes above the foliage in autumn. Useful for a screen; hedging; accent near pools or massed in borders. Cut leaves to ground level prior to new spring growth. Prefers well drained soil in partial shade. Moderately drought tolerant.

Deciduous clumping perennial grass with short rhizomes (1.2m x 0.5m) from China and Japan. Erect linear leaves transversely banded with yellowish white variegation across the blade. Foliage turns orange brown during autumn. May carry hairy white spikelets in fan shaped arrangement in autumn. Useful for screen hedging; accent near pools or borders. Requires full sun. Cut leaves to ground level prior to new spring growth. Prefers fertile loam but adaptable to a wide range of soils. Tolerant of wet; heavy and dry stoney soils. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen woody stemmed vine (5m) from Mexico and Guatemala. Clings by thick aerial roots. Huge glossy lobed holed leaves. Cream boat shaped spathe drops as edible fruit ripens. Olive green cylindrical fruit 10cm long turning yellow green. Useful for a tropical themed garden in a shaded location. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen or semi-deciduous bushy climber (1.5m) from New Zealand. Small round tough leaves on wiry black closely twining stems. (Leaves smaller than M. axillaris). Fragrant tiny greenish flowers. Useful for training on a wire fence as a dense screen or shaped over a frame for topiary. Prefers well drained soil in a sunny position. Prune to maintain shape and keep within bounds. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen fine textured compact shrub (3m x 2m) from Malaysia. Glossy rich green compound leaves. Fragrant star-shaped white flowers in summer. Useful as a formal clipped hedge and informal screen. Prefers fertile soil. Semi frost tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen palm-like suckering tree (8 x 4) from Asia. Large long oblong leaves with sheathing bases. Flowers one year after planting; producing a floral bract at the base of which fruit develops; 15-25 kg per stem. Useful for fruit and a tropical effect. Invasive potential and difficult to remove. Drought and frost sensitive.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic; Tas; WA and SA.)

Evergreen tall shrub or small tree (5m x 3m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic; Tas; WA and SA. Slightly toothed lanceolate leaves. White flowers spotted with purple. Useful screen plant by the coast. Tolerant of salt spray and frost. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen spreading groundcover with stem suckering at the nodes (0.2m x 1.5m) from NSW; Vic; SA and Tas. Narrow slightly warty thick and sessile leaves. White star-like flowers in spring. Useful as groundcover over banks and to spill over walls. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen, short-lived, clump-forming perennial or annual (0.15 m x 0.2 m) from alpine areas of Europe. Elliptical, soft, green hairy leaves. Dense clusters of tiny bright blue, pink or white flowers with cream coloured centres. Useful for self-seeding in a perennial or semi-wild garden. Prefers a lightly shaded position in moist soil. Seeds freely in favourable conditions. Drought sensitive. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen bushy shrub (2m x 2m) from the Mediterranean region. Small ovate glossy dark green leaves. Fragrant white cup-shaped flowers with prominent stamens. Flowers in spring. Useful as a hedge or screen. Very wind tolerant. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen upright shrub (2m x 1.5m) with bamboo-like stems from China and Japan. Divided glossy leaves turning purple and red in winter. Small white flowers in spring followed by red berries. Useful for a screen; hedge or mass planted for foliage effect. Variable forms available. Sensitive to salinity. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen compact rounded bun shaped shrub (0.6m x 0.8m) from East Asia. Graceful bamboo-like light green leaves turning bright red in autumn. Flowers are not produced. Useful for a low hedge; mass planting; autumn and winter foliage colour and as an understorey plant. Requires minimal maintenance. Drought and frost tolerant.

Flowering perennial bulb (0.5m x 0.4m) from Europe. Linear leaves. Terminal solitary or clustered mostly fragrant trumpet shaped flowers and perianth in shades of yellow; orange; cream or white in spring. Useful for colour display; planted in groups; drifts or containers. Prefers a sunny position with good drainage. Most cultivars increase naturally by offsets. Dense clumps should be divided no sooner than 6 weeks after flowering every 3-5 years. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Fast-growing, cool-season annual (0.3 m x 0.15 m) from South Africa. Lance-shaped, serrated, pale-green leaves. Trumpet-shaped yellow, white, blue or purple flowers in winter to early spring. Useful for mid-ground, colour display in the garden. Requires full sun and fertile, neutral-to-acid soil. Pinch prune to encourage branching. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen spreading basal rosetted epiphytic perennial (0.3m x 0.7m) from Brazil. Stiff broadly strap shaped to oval glossy leaves with short black spines. Pale green leaf colour often flecked with purple and striped silver grey beneath. Centre of rosette turns purple prior to flowering. Cluster of pale blue flowers in the centre of each rosette in summer. Useful specimen; edging or mass planted in a courtyard or sheltered position particularly for a tropical themed garden. Suitable pot plant. Need moist well drained composted soil. Best in dappled shade with warmth and humidity but good air movement. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen upright perennial herb (0.8m x 0.8m) from Europe and Asia. Aromatic downy green leaves. Whorls of white flowers from late spring to autumn. Useful addition to the herb garden or mixed with other perennials. Prune after flowering to improve form. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen bushy clump-foming perennial (0.6m x 0.6m) from Kashmir India. Long narrow deeply veined pointed leaves. Dense spikes of small purple blue flowers from mid summer. Useful in a mixed border or perennial garden; for edging or groundcover. Prefers well drained soil. Cut back after flowers fade. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen clump-forming perennial (0.45m x 0.45m) from eastern Mediterranean region. Aromatic grey green leaves. Numerous flower stems carry hundreds of small violet blue flowers throughout summer. Useful for contrast with shrubs and perennials; mixed with herbs; in gravel gardens or between paving. Needs good drainage. Prune to maintain compact form. Frost tolerant.
Non indigenous (NT; Qld; NSW; New Zealand & SE Asia)

Evergreen tufted fern with creeping rhizomes (0.7m x 0.7m) from NT; Qld; NSW; New Zealand and South-east Asia. Narrow erect fronds spreading over large areas. Useful to cover a difficult corner. Tolerates sun or shade. Invasive potential. Keep contained and avoid use near bushland areas. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen upright bushy shrub (3-4m x 3m) from the Mediterranean region. Deep green leathery leaves. Poisonous if eaten. Clusters of star-like white; pink; red; apricot or yellow flowers from late spring to autumn. Useful as a screen; hedge; mass planted or part of shrubbery. Dwarf forms available. Hardy. Drought and wind tolerant. Tolerant to salinity Frost sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Deciduous broadly conical tree (12m x 6m) from North America. Oval glossy dark to mid green leaves turning yellow; orange and red in autumn. Greenish white insignificant flowers. Useful as a feature for its autumn colour; shade tree or to soak up a wet area. Wind tolerant. Enjoys periodic water logging. Avoid root disturbance. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Annual herb with a bushy habit (0.3m x 0.3m) from Europe and Asia. Oval strongly aromatic bright green leaves. Whorls of white two lipped flowers in summer and autumn. Useful in the herb or perennial garden for its culinary flavour. Suitable for containers. Prefers a sheltered warm position in full sun. Pinch out growing tips continually to maintain a bushy habit. Wide range of leaf forms; colours and aromas available. Drought anf frost sensitive.

Evergreen long-lived spreading tree (6m x 4m) from Asia Minor and Arabia. Grey-green narrow oblong leaves silvery beneath. Small creamy white flowers in late summer followed by edible oval green fruit turning purple. Useful as a small shade tree; feature; windbreak or for its fruit. Must have well drained soil. Tolerant to salinity and drought. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen tall shrub or small tree (3-9m x 1-3m) from NSW; ACT; Vic & Tas. Large elliptical leaves with a silver underside. Large terminal clusters of creamy white daisy-like flowers in spring and early summer. Useful for a shady protected position. Prefers moist well composted soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen rounded or open shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Elliptical dark green sticky leaves. Terminal clusters of white daisy flowers in spring and summer. Useful for its attractive foliage as understorey or in a shaded garden. Prefers a protected position in well composted soil. Suitable for heavy shade. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen upright narrow shrub (1.5m x 1m) from NSW; ACT; Vic and Tas. Oblong grey leaves with a musky scent. Daisy flowers in white; mauve; blue or pink during spring. Select forms with good colour. Useful in a protected shady garden amongst small shrubs where its sometimes untidy base is covered. Prune regularly and lightly to encourage bushiness. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen rounded compact shrub (1m x 1m) from NSW (including Sydney). Ovate hairy leaves usually lobed with toothed margins. Blue or white daisy-like flowers in spring and summer. Useful mixed with other small shrubs particularly in a bush garden. Prefers well drained soil in full sun or semi-shade. Tolerant of salt spray. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen clump forming perennial with underground stolons (0.3m x 0.3m) from China and Japan. Grass-like glossy dark green leaves commonly curved. Spikes of lilac flowers in summer followed by small blue berries. Useful as a groundcover between stepping stones; as a border; next to a pond or as a shade tolerant lawn alternative. Prefers partial shade in moist soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen branching shrub (4m x 3m) from China and Japan. Glossy broad dark green leaves with undulating margins. Slender sprays of very fragrant small white flowers in spring. Useful planted near pathways or windows for its sweet perfume or for a screen or background. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen spreading to clumping bush (0.4m x 1m) from South Africa. Grey-green leaves. Mostly white flowers with navy blue centres. Many colour varieties available including pink; yellow and purple. Useful as a groundcover on poor soils and for colour in a perennial garden. Spreads by self-seeding and rooting where nodes touch the ground. Tolerant to salinity. Potential to invade bushland. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen spreading palm-like tree with many thickened prop roots (4m x 3m) from Qld and NSW. Spirally arranged dull green leaves with many spines. Large fruit on female trees resembling a pineapple. Useful as a feature plant for warm coastal gardens. Very tolerant of salt spray. Needs good drainage and full sun. Potentially invasive root system. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.
Non indigenous (Qld; Northern NSW & South East Asia)

Evergreen twining climber (3m) from northern NSW; Qld and South East Asia. Shiny dark green pinnate leaves. Clusters of large waxy soft pink flowers with a maroon centre in summer. White form available. Useful for covering a trellis; pergola or fence. Prefers a warm partially shaded location. Frost sensitive but tolerates light frost.

Evergreen vigorous twining climber (5m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic and Tas. Glossy pinnate leaves. Cream tubular flowers tinged purple at the tips in loose terminal panicles. Useful for covering a trellis; fence or structure with support. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant.

Tuft-forming, cool-season perennial grown as an annual (0.3 m x 0.1 m) from Arctic regions. Oval-toothed, soft, green leaves. Open fragrant silky flowers on hairy long stems in a wide range of mostly pastel shades including orange; red and yellow. Useful in drifts for colour display and as cut flowers. Requires fertile, well-drained soil with morning sun. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous spreading short trunked tree often with multiple trunks and peeling bark (8m x 8m) from Iran and the Caucasus Mountains. Rich green diamond shaped leaves with unevenly shallow scalloped edges turning gold and crimson in autumn. Small red flowers on bare wood in early spring. Useful specimen for its form and autumn colour. Needs a cool mountain climate and well drained position. Frost and drought tolerant.

Deciduous woody stemmed climber with tendrils ending in adhesive pads (9m) from Eastern USA. Five toothed leaflet foliage turning crimson in autumn. Useful for covering a high wall or building. Inconspicuous flowers followed by blue black berries in autumn. Prefers fertile moist loam but will survive on less. Minor invasive weed potential near bushland. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous vigorous woody stemmed climber with tendrils ending in adhesive pads (15m) from China and Japan. Trilobed glossy green leaves turning bright crimson in autumn. Inconspicuous flowers followed by dull blue berries. Useful to cover large areas of masonry or wooden walls or vertical wire fences. Prefers fertile moist loam but will survive on less. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen vigorous woody stemmed tendril climber (4m) from tropical America. Rounded oblong leaves. Bright scarlet flowers followed by large berry fruit with edible pulp. Useful to cover or cascade over a vertical wall. Requires wire or means of attaching itself. Needs good drainage. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen vigorous woody stemmed tendril climber (5m) from South America. Soft downy leaves deeply cut into three narrow toothed lobes. Long tubed pink flowers followed by yellow banana-like edible fruit. Useful climber for its fruit and showy flowers. High invasive potential. Avoid use near bushland. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen woody stemmed tropical climber (5m) from tropical America. Large bright green oval leaves on angled winged stems. Large fragrant white; pink; red or pale violet flowers followed by edible yellowish green oval fruit. Useful over a trellis for its ornamental flowers. Needs well drained moist soil and high humidity. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen tufted perennial grass (0.4m x 0.4m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone) and Vic. Stiff erect grass-like greyish green leaves. Deep violet flowers in succession on a short hairy stalk in spring and summer each lasting less than a day. Useful clumped in a perennial bed particularly in a bush garden. Prefers sandy well drained soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Deciduous spreading tree (12m x 6m) from China. Large heart shaped leaves in pairs. Terminal sprays of fragrant foxglove-like pink to violet flowers in spring before leaf emergence. Useful as specimen or shade tree. Salt spray and urban pollution tolerant. Protect from strong wind. May require pruning to develop strong structure. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen stemless perennial (0.4m x 0.4m) from SA; NSW and Vic. Ovate green leaves with shallow lobes. Umbel inflorescences carry magenta flowers on slender pedicels. Useful for a rock garden; colourful bedding display; spreading groundcover or pot plant. Prefers well drained slightly acid soil. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen much hybridised shrubby perennial (1m x 1m) from South Africa. Rounded to oval deeply serrated leaves sometimes wrinkled and pungent. Trumpet shaped flowers in exotic colours including pink; mauve; red; purple; white and purple with contrasting spots and streaks. Useful for colour in containers; window boxes; on balconies; massed as groundcover; borders or mixed with shrubs. Prefers free draining light soil. Tip prune to maintain short compact growth. Sensitive to over watering. Variation in frost tolerance amongst cultivars. Drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic; Tas; NZ; New Caledonia & Asia.)

Evergreen erect fern with long creeping rhizomes (0.6m x 0.5m) from NSW (including Sydney); Qld; Vic; Tas; New Caledonia & Asia. Tough shiny green pinnate fronds. Useful for a shaded protected garden or understorey. Prefers well drained moist soil in partial to full shade. Frost tolerant. Drought tolerant in favourable conditions. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.
Non indigenous (Qld; NSW; Vic; Tas; WA & Asia)

Evergreen tussock forming grass (up to 0.8m x 0.5m) from NSW; Qld; Vic; Tas; WA & Asia. Narrow arching leaves. Feathery purplish flower heads on erect stems throughout most of the year. Useful mass planted for its textural quality. Strongly self-seeding with invasive potential. Avoid use near bushland areas. Forms available include Purple Lea; Black Lea and Nafray. Frost and drought tolerant.

Warm season vigourous prostrate growing sod forming perennial turf grass with stout rhizomes and stolons from East Africa. Coarse textured elongated pointed leaf blade with hairs. Small flower spike hidden in the leaf sheath. Useful as a fast growing tough lawn in areas where it can be contained and for control of soil erosion. Not suitable for small areas with garden beds. Medium shade tolerance. High wear resistance. Requires regular mowing in growing season. Preferred cutting height 20-25mm. Low herbicide tolerance. Potential bushland invader. Provide containment or avoid use on bushland edges. Frost tolerant.

Semi-evergreen rosette forming perennial (1m x 0.3m) from the USA and Mexico. Narrow lance to oblong shaped green leaves. Slightly nodding two-lipped tubular rose-red flowers on spikes rising from the rosette in summer and autumn. Useful for borders or grouped in the perennial garden. Prefers fertile well drained soil in full sun. Frost and drought tolerant.

Erect and branching perennial (0.6m x 1m) from Mexico. Variable soft narrow leaves. Open trumpet shaped flowers arranged along an upright flower stem. Colour variable; often in white; pink and red colour range. Useful for colour in the perennial garden. Prefers fertile soil. Prune hard in late winter. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen loosely rounded shrub (1m x 1m) from Africa. Hairy bright green leaves. Dense terminal clusters of pink; red or white expanding tubular flowers from summer to winter. Useful for colour in sheltered parts of the garden. Requires a warm position protected from strong sunlight and wind. Prefers fertile well drained soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen perennial (0.3m x 0.3m) from the West Indies. Succulent dark purplish green oval leaves. Erect terminal spikes of white flowers in summer. Useful groundcover or for edging in a warm protected position. Suitable pot plant for a shady verandah. Prefers partial to full shade. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen low prostrate groundcover (0.2m x 1m) from the Blue Mountains region NSW. Narrow linear pine-like bright green leaves crowded on the stem. Bright yellow lightly fragrant flowers in leaf axils near the end of branches in summer followed by green fruit marked by purple brown blotches. Useful understorey with eucalypts; as a massed groundcover; in pots or to spill over a retaining wall. Prefers well drained sandy soil in full sun to partial shade. Sensitive to humid wet conditions. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen erect shrub (3-4m x 2m) from NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone) and Vic. Thick light green broad leaves. Yellow flowers in summer. Useful for a feature or background for its attractive foliage and bark. Prefers well drained soil in full to partial shade. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen open shrub with dark flaky bark (3m x 3m) from NSW (including Sydney) and Vic. Soft light green linear leaves furry when young. Yellow flowers in summer followed by grape-like clusters of fleshy green fruit. Useful as a feature or background for its attractive foliage; fruit and bark. Prefers well drained soil in full to partial shade. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen pendulous shrub (3m x 2m) from NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone). Fine glossy green pine needle-like leaves. Terminal spikes of yellow flowers in summer followed by bunches of succulent fruits. Useful as a specimen; screen or background plant. Foliage excellent for floral display. Tolerant of salt spray. Prefers well drained sandy soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen erect shrub (2m x 1m) from NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone). Terete (rounded in cross section) deeply divided leaves. Small yellow flowers in the leaf axils in summer followed by egg-shaped persistant cones. Useful for its interesting foliage and fruit particularly in a bush garden. Prefers well drained soil in full sun to partail shade. Frost and drought tolerant.

Biennial herb (0.3m x 0.5m) from Europe. Aromatic fern-like leaves on stout; erect and branching stems. Greenish yellow flowers in the second season. Useful in the herb; vegetable or perennial garden. Grown for its culinary flavour and textural leaf form. Prefers fertile moisture retentive soil. Seeds slow to germinate. Remove flower heads to prolong life of the plant. Drought sensitive.

Fast-growing, spreading or cascading, hybrid perennial grown as a warm-season annual (0.2 m x 0.3 m). Oval, mid-green leaves. Flared, trumpet-shaped, single or double flowers in a wide range of colours including blue, violet, red, pink and white. Summer flowering. Many hybrids available with flowers varying in form and size. Useful for massed colour display, border, pot display or hanging basket. Requires full sun. Pinch back plants to encourage branching. Remove spent flowers to prolong blooming. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen perennial grass (0.6m x 0.3m) from Europe and North America. Upright long narrow grass-like leaves striped lengthwise with white and green. Pale green flowers in summer. Useful as a groundcover where its rampant growth can be restricted. Tolerates wet conditions. Frost tolerant. Invasive potential. Avoid use near bushland. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen fast growing perennial twining climber (3m) from India. Light green heart shaped leaves on slender wiry stems. Fragrant pea-like purple and cream flowers coiled like a snail. Useful for colour over a trellis or wire structure. Prefers fertile well drained soil in a protected partly shaded position. May die back in winter. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen erect variable shrub of many sub-species (2m x 1.5m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); ACT & Vic. Greyish oblong leaves. Terminal clusters of yellow to cream flowers with prominent stamens. Useful as a screen or amongst shrubbery especially in coastal gardens. Tolerant of salt spray. Prefers well drained sandy soil. Frost and drought tolerant.
Non indigenous (North America; East Asia & Europe)

Deciduous upright shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) with a rounded crown from North America; East Asia and Europe. Oval leaves on slender stems. Terminal clusters of fragrant white flowers in spring. Useful as a background plant where its floral display can be seen and its woody base hidden or close to paths for its fragrance. Many forms available. Prefers limey moist loam. Best in climates with a cold winter. Frost tolerant. Drought and wind sensitive.

Evergreen low compact shrub (0.8m x 1m) from the USA and South America. Decorative lobed leaves. Useful for massed textural display or understorey in a semi-shade position. Prefers fertile soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen shrub with a robust erect stem (2m x 2m) from Brazil. Large glossy deeply lobed leaves. Insignificant flowers. Useful as an accent plant particularly in a tropical themed garden. Prefers a protected partly shaded position. Dwarf forms available. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

species: Philotheca difformis ssp smithiana Syn Eriostemon difformis ssp Smithiana
