Philotheca difformis ssp smithiana Syn Eriostemon difformis ssp Smithiana
Philotheca difformis ssp smithiana Syn Eriostemon difformis ssp Smithiana
value: Evergreen small rounded shrub (1m x 1m) from NSW and Qld. Leathery leaves. White star-like flowers in autumn. Useful specimen or massed as understorey. Needs well drained soil with some shade. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen spreading shrub with upright shoots (0.8m x 0.8m) from the Mediterranean region. Grey green felt-like leaves. Whorls of small golden yellow flowers at intervals along the upper third of the stems in summer. Prune back after flowering to maintain compact form. Useful specimen or mixed with other shrubbery. Needs well drained soil in full sun. Frost and drought tolerant.

Compact upright annual (0.2m x 0.2m) from Mexico and Texas. Lance shaped pale green leaves. Heads of star shaped flowers in many colours including red, pink, blue and white during summer and autumn. Useful for colour display in beds or pots. Prefers a sunny open position. Tolerant of heat. Requires regular water. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen upright large palm tree with a robust trunk (15m x 10m) from Canary Islands. Feather shaped arching spined fronds 5m long forming a spherical head. Large pendant clusters of yellow brown flowers followed by yellow berries on mature trees. Useful as a specimen away from traffic areas in a large garden. Prune old fronds before they drop. Invasive potential as berries carried by birds. Drought and frost tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen clumping palm with multiple trunks surrounded by shorter younger crowns (9m x 5m) from tropical Africa. Soft deep green pinnate leaves on spiny leaf stalks. White flowers well hidden followed by showy orange date fruit. Useful accent for a large garden or above ground planter. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen palm with a slender trunk (3m x 2m) from East Asia. Shiny dark green arching pinnate fronds. Clusters of tiny yellow flowers in autumn followed by egg shaped black fruit. Useful single or group planted in a shaded position particularly for a tropical theme. Remove dead and brown old fronds. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen arching clumping perennial (1.5m x 1.5m) from New Zealand. Strap-like olive-green leaves arching gracefully. Useful as a specimen or in groups for foliage contrast. Tolerates full shade. Many coloured leaf and dwarf cultivars available. Frost sensitive. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen upright clumping perennial (2m x 1.5m) from New Zealand. Strap-like sword shaped bronze purple leaves. Panicles 1m long of dull red flowers in summer. Useful as an accent plant for its vertical form and colour amongst shrubs. Many variable forms available. Divide if plant outgrows its space. Moderately tolerant to salinity. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen erect tussock forming perennial (0.75m x 0.8m). Dwarf hybrid of P. tenax from New Zealand. Arching bronze purple strap-like sword shaped leaves. Red tubular flowers on erect stems in summer. Useful accent for its foliage contrast and vertical form. Suitable for coastal conditions. Prefers well drained soil in sun to semi-shade. Drought tolerant. Moderately frost tolerant.

Evergreen branching shrub (3m x 2m) from China and Japan. Glossy green elliptical leaves with red new growth from spring to autumn. Whitish flowers in terminal clusters. Useful as a clipped hedge or screen plant. New varieties available. Clipping encourages more red new growth. Wind and Frost tolerant. Drought tolerant.
Non indigenous (Sub tropical to tropical Australia; North America & South America)

Evergreen vigorous groundcover with rooting nodes (0.1 x 2m) from Australia; South America and North America. Dull green obovate leaves. Heads of pink flowers most of the year. Not recommended for purchase, has been listed as a noxious weed by the Department of Primary Industries for several areas of NSW. Keep contained to avoid any invasive weed potential.

Spreading upright perennial sometimes grown as an annual (0.5m x 0.6m) from Europe; China and Japan. Green oval leaves. Minute creamy white flowers in summer followed by rounded bright orange-red fruit surrounded by inflated orange calyces. Useful specimen for its unusual fruit. Prefers moist well drained soil in full to partial shade. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen slow growing dwarf conifer (2.5m x 1m) with a symmetrical pyramidal form from Canada; Alaska and the USA. Deep green closely packed stiff short needle-like leaves. Oval green cones aging to brown. Useful specimen or formal accent for a small sunny garden. Suitable for a pot plant. Needs moist well drained soil. Best in cool mountain climates. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen semi-dwarf slow growing symmetrical pyramidal-shaped coniferous tree (4m x 2m) from North America. Steel blue needle-like leaves on closely spaced ascending branches. Useful specimen for its formal shape and colour. Prefers fertile well drained soil and ample moisture. Best in cool climates. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen rounded dense shrub (1.5m x 2m) from Japan. Glossy dark green leaves turning bronze in winter. Dense drooping sprays of white flowers in spring. Useful companion shrub of rhododendrons; camellias and azaleas as they enjoy similar growing conditions. Shelter from hot afternoon sun. Prefers well drained acid soil with ample summer water. Mulch well to maintain a cool root zone. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen rounded shrub (1m x 1m) from WA. Oval glossy green leaves in two pairs of opposite rows. Terminal heads of pink flowers in spring. Deep pink colour forms available. Useful specimen; understorey; low border; informal hedge or mass planted for its floral display. Needs well drained soil. Prefers partial shade. Drought and frost tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone regions); ACT; Vic & Tas)

Evergreen small erect shrub (0.6m x 0.5m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone regions); ACT; Vic & Tas. Small linear leaves in pairs of two rows. Terminal heads of white flowers in spring and summer. Useful mass planted or as a feature plant. Variable forms available. Prune to maintain shape. Frost and drought tolerant.
Non indigenous (Mountains of central & southern Europe)

Evergreen variable coniferous tree or multi trunked medium to prostrate shrub (1-8m x 2-4m) from mountains of central and southern Europe. Stout needle-like leaves in pairs in papery leaf sheaths. Oval dark brown cones. Useful for a Japanese themed gardens for its windswept look; pot plant or rock garden. Wind tolerant. Prefers fertile well drained soil in full sun. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen coniferous tree with a flat topped crown on a short trunk (10m x 8m) from Southern Europe. Dark green stiff needle-like leaves. Sperical light tan cones holding edible pine nuts. Useful feature tree particularly on sandy soil in coastal areas. Frost and drought tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen coniferous tree with an irregular crown and often leaning trunk and crooked upswept branches (10m x 7m) from China; Japan and Korea. Grey green slightly twisted stiff long needle-like leaves in pairs and densely crowded near the tips of the branchlets. Buds covered with a silky cobweb of white hairs. Purple brown cones. Useful specimen for a coastal garden; Japanese themed garden; topiary; pot plant or bonsai culture. Salt spray and wind tolerant. Prefers well drained sandy soil. Frost and drought tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen vigorous climber with adventitious roots (8m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Thick glossy dark green leaves; fragrant when crushed. Insignificant flowers followed by red fruits. Useful root climber for growing on large tree trunk; rock or wall. Young plants suitable for indoors. Needs a shady protected position. Frost and drought sensitive.

Deciduous small tree (8m x 4m) from China. Green compound leaves turning bright red in autumn. Small blue berries follow inconspicuous flowers. Useful as a small shade tree and for autumn colour. Invasive weed potential in the Blue Mountains area. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen dense columnar small tree or shrub (8m x 4m) from New Zealand. Glossy light green leaves with wavy edged cream margin. Pale yellow honey scented flowers in summer. Useful for a screen; foliage contrast; tall clipped hedge or small feature tree. Low tolerance to competition from grass. Susceptible to borer attack in Sydney. Drought sensitive and frost tolerant.

Evergreen initially erect later spreading tree (10m x 5m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Glossy green ovate leaves. Creamy white flowers in terminal clusters in summer followed by shining orange berries. Useful as a feature or shade tree. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen spreading shrub (0.8m x 1.5m) from China and Japan. Dwarf form of P. tobira. Light green glossy leaves in whorls. Cream fragrant flowers appear irregularly. Useful as low screen; hedge or massed as a groundcover with trees. Hardy. Tolerant of salt spray. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen tree (10m x 5m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic; Tas. & SA. Shiny elliptical leaves with wavy margins. Terminal clusters of fragrant creamy flowers in spring. Useful component of a rainforest garden. Seeds freely. Invasive weed potential out of its natural rainforest occurrence. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney coastal rainforests) & New Guinea)

Evergreen epiphytic fern (individual plant 0.3m x 0.3m) from NSW; (including Sydney coastal rainforests) Qld and New Guinea. Forms large clumps of many plants produced from the base of the original. Fronds of two types: sterile green overlapping litter collecting nest leaves becoming brown with age; and drooping divided fertile fronds to 1m long. Useful accent plant hung on a sheltered wall or courtyard. Mount on board or tree with permanent bark. Prefers filtered sunlight with some humidity. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen large epiphytic fern with erect lobed sterile fronds (1m x 1m) from Qld; NSW and Malaysia. Fronds of two types: large erect lobed litter collecting sterile fronds and long pendulous spore-bearing fronds. Useful accent plant hung on a sheltered wall or courtyard. Requires mounting on a board or tile. Prefers filtered sunlight with some humidity. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen neat clump forming perennial (0.5m x 0.4m) from China and Japan. Narrow silvery green leaves on slender weak stems. Large balloon buds opening to lilac or purple bell shaped flowers in summer. Useful for colour in the perennial garden or fill-in between shrubs. Prefers fertile moist soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen vigorous suckering perennial (0.6m x 1m) from Qld & NSW. Silvery grey-green velvety ovate leaves slightly aromatic. Whorled spikes of blue flowers in summer and autumn. Useful for a border; edging; container or understorey. Prefers partial shade. Tolerates poor drainage. Susceptible to slug and snail attack. Prune to maintain compact form. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen dense soft wooded shrub (1.5m x 2m) from South Africa. Pointed heart shaped leaves on squarish succulent stems. Upright sprays of deep purple blue salvia-like flowers in autumn. Useful for its brilliant blue colour between shrubs and in confined spaces. Prefers a sheltered shady position. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen succulent low growing perennial (0.4m x 0.8m) from South Africa. Fleshy aromatic grey green leaves with a mat forming habit. Short dense spikes of pale lavender flowers. Useful as a groundcover for both a difficult dry or shaded position. Prefers well drained sand or loamy soil. Tolerates light frosts. Responds well to pruning. Cut back frost affected plants for fast recovery. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen fast growing spreading shrub or semi climber (1.5-2m tall) from South Africa. Soft light green leaves on long weak stems. Terminal clusters of white to sky blue flowers in pring and summer. Useful as a screen; for mass planting or clipped hedge. Requires regular pruning. May cause skin allergies in susceptible people. Frost tolerant.

Deciduous tree with stout and fleshy branching trunk (6m x 3m) from Mexico. Green leathery elliptical leaves. Terminal clusters of fragrant; funnel-shaped yellow and white flowers in summer. Useful as a small feature tree in a north facing location. Prefers a hot position. Frost sensitive.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney); ACT; Vic; Tas & SA)

Evergreen tussock forming perennial grass (0.8m x 0.5m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); ACT; Vic; Tas & SA. Narrow grey grass-like leaves. Plum-like heads of flowers on stems. Useful for borders; perennial gardens; mixed grass gardens and erosion control on slopes. Improved cultivars available. Hardy. Cut back older foliage as required. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Cultivar of P. poiformis; widespread throughout Australia)

Tussock forming perennial grass (0.5m x 0.2m). Cultivar of P. poiformis widespread throughout Australia. Fine green arching leaves. Purplish grey inflorescence carrying flower spikelets in summer. Useful mass planted for texture and colour contrast; as a border with other grasses; understorey or erosion control on sloping sites. Tolerant of poor soils. Salt spray tolerant. Frost and drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Cultivar of P. poiformis; widespread throughout Australia)

Tussock forming perennial grass (0.45m x 0.2m). Semi-dwarf cultivar of P. poiformis widespread throughout Australia. Fine blue arching leaves. Purplish grey inflorescence carrying flower spikelets in summer. Useful mass planted for texture and colour contrast; as a border with other grasses; understorey or erosion control on sloping sites. Tolerant of poor soils. Salt spray tolerant. Frost and drought tolerant.

Cool season fine textured perennial turf grass spreading by rhizomes from Europe and Asia. Fine blue green leaf blades with boat shaped leaf tips. Useful for a lawn in cool climate areas. Preferred cutting height of 38mm. Sensitive to poor drainage; compacted soils and high temperatures. High water requirements. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen tree forming an upright cylindrical form (20m x 10m) from rainforests of Qld and NSW. Dark green glossy narrow oblong leaves with a sharp point. Lighter green new growth. Edible bluish black plum-like fruit on female plants. Useful as a specimen or shade tree in a large garden. Can be pruned to a large hedge. Tolerates a wide range of soils and aspects. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen slow growing coniferous tree with a dense rounded crown (12m x 7m) from New Zealand. Dull dark green stiff leathery leaves tapering to a stalk. Useful specimen or regularly pruned for topiary or hedge. Prefers moist fertile well drained soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen fast growing twining climber (4m) from South Africa. Compound leaves of 7 or 9 oval to lance shaped glossy wavy leaflets on slender stems. Loose clusters at the branch tips of fragrant pink striped red funnel-shaped flowers from spring to autumn. Useful for trailing over a pergola; arbour or carport. May be clipped as an informal hedge; espaliered or pruned into a weeping standard. Salt spray tolerant. Requires pruning to keep contained. Potential weed near bushland. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen erect shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) from South Africa. Narrow oval greyish green leaves. White veined rich purple pea-like flowers from late spring to autumn. Useful amongst shrubs for its floral display. Requires good drainage in full sun. Sensitive to heavy pruning. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone); ACT & Vic)

Evergreen erect shrub (3m x 2m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone); ACT and Vic. Pinnate leaves with variable leaflets; linear to ovate depending on location of original material. Large sprays of pale green insignificant flowers followed by blue grey succulent fruit in sumer. Useful as a screen for its dense foliage and interesting fruit. Needs partial shade and well composted soil; mulched to maintain moisture. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.
Non indigenous (Qld; NSW; Vic; Tas & SA)

Evergreen clump forming fern developing a short trunk when mature (1m x 1m) from Qld; NSW; Vic; Tas & SA. Dark green fronds with small plantlets produced near the end of mature fronds. Useful feature or grouped in a shady protected garden. Requires moist soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Warm season trailing succulent annual (0.15m x 0.3m) from South America. Thick and soft cylindrical leaves on reddish stems. Open cup-shaped often double flowers in bright shades of pink; red; yellow and orange. Flowers close at night and on cloudy days. Useful groundcover in a hot dry position; spilling over a small bank or wall; pot plant or hanging basket. Plant out after the last frosts. Drought tolerant but prefers some moisture.
Non indigenous (Wet areas in SA; Vic; ACT; NSW & Tas)

Evergreen creeping groundcover forming a dense mat (0.02m x 0.6m) from wet areas in SA; Vic; ACT; NSW and Tas. Small round leaves. Light blue sometimes white star-like flowers in spring to summer. Useful as a groundcover for small areas; gravel gardens; between stepping sones or in association with a water feature where it may grow into the water. Prefers a damp partly shaded protected position. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Neat, clump-forming annual (0.15 m x 0.2 m) from China. Hairy, soft, pale-green leaves forming a rosette. Dense whorls of small flat single or double flowers in shades of pink,mauve or white during winter and spring. Useful for mass planting in beds or pots or allowed to naturalise in the garden.Prefers partial shade and well-drained fertile soil. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen compact rounded shrub (1m x 1.5m) from NSW; ACT; Vic & Tas. Aromatic dark green shiny wedge shaped leaves. Trumpet shaped white flowers with many purple; red or yellow blotches in the throat. Useful specimen or grouped; next to a pathway where its scent may be enjoyed. Prefers well drained sheltered moist conditions. Prostrate form available. Tip prune to maintain compact form. Frost tolerant.
Indigenous (NSW (including Sydney in sheltered sandstone gullies))

Evergreen spreading shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) from NSW (including Sydney in sheltered sandstone gullies). Slightly aromatic round or ovate wrinkled leaves densely covered in hairs. Short terminal spikes of purple flowers in spring. Useful for a screen or understorey with open crowned trees particularly in a bush garden. Prefers moist well drained soil with some protection from direct sunlight. Prune back one third after flowering for compact form. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.
Indigenous (NSW (including Sydney Blue Mountains & Hawkesbury Sandstone))

Evergreen rounded shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) from NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone). Highly aromatic soft ovate toothed leaves. Deep mauve flowers in spring. Useful for a screen or understorey with open crowned trees particularly in a bush garden. Prefers moist well drained soil with some protection from direct sunlight. Prune back one third after flowering for compact form. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen variable tall to medium shrub (2-8m x 2-3m) from Qld; NSW; Vic and Tas. Lanceolate to ovate leaves on long upright branches. Terminal wide angled sprays of white; pink or mauve funnel shaped flowers with spreading lobes in early summer. Useful screen or tall understorey in a shady moist garden. Tolerates ful sun. Protect from constant wind and mulch root zone. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen erect cone shaped shrub (2.5m x 2m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney on Hawkesbury Sandstone). Aromatic variable lanceolate to elliptical leaves. Tapering sprays of purple flowers in spring. Useful for an understorey with open crowned trees particularly in a bush garden. Needs good drainage and moist position with some shelter. May be short lived - grafting increases the life span. Wilts readily when dry therefore good indicator plant for when to water the garden. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen quick growing rounded compact shrub (2m x 1.5m) from NSW; Vic and Tas. Aromatic rounded leaves often toothed. Purple flowers; sometimes pink in spring. Useful for a screen or understorey with open crowned trees particularly in a bush garden. Prefers moist well drained soil with some protection from direct sunlight. Prune back one third after flowering for compact form. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen erect and branching shrub (2.5m x 1.5m) from South Africa. Blue grey leathery leaves. Large terminal and solitary pink or greenish white flowers. Useful for its showy flowers. Bird attracting. Must have good drainage. Prefers sandy soil. Tolerates light frosts. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen slow growing dense coniferous tree (8m x 3m) from Qld rainforests. Rows of small flat bright green fern-like leaves on horizontal branches. Globular fruits. Useful for its attractive foliage in a rainforest themed garden. Ideal pot plant for a courtyard or patio due to its slow growth. Tolerates full sun to full shade. Prefers moist well drained soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Deciduous low branching vase shaped to round headed tree (7m x 6m) from Japan. Oval oblong leaves with coppery bronze new growth. Long stalked clusters of pink to white flowers along the stems in late winter. Useful as a small feature tree in garden beds or lawn. Avoid grass in contact with the trunk. Prefers a sunny wind protected position. Sensitive to poorly drained soil. Invasive weed potential in Blue Mountains zone. Many forms and cultivars available. Select for location suitability. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.
Indigenous (Eastern Australia (including Sydney moist sandstone gullies); NZ & Fiji)

Evergreen tufted fern (1m x 0.8m) from eastern Australia (including Sydney moist sandstone gullies); NZ & Fiji. Hairless divided lacy pale green fronds on brown shiny stalks. Useful for a moist sheltered position. Prefers partial to full shade. Frost tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen clump-forming perennial (0.3m x 0.6m) from Europe and Asia. Hairy long elliptical shaped leaves variably spotted with creamy white. Funnel shaped flowers in spring opening pink turning to blue. Useful for a perennial garden or border. Prefers moist fertile soil in partial shade. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen pendulous spreading shrub (1.5m x 2m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney Cumberland Plain). Narrow-oblong hairy leaves with reddish new growth. Yellow pea flowers towards the ends of branches in spring. Useful specimen or informal hedge. Tolerates pruning. Prefers moist well drained clay or loamy soil in full sun. Frost and drought tolerant.

Semi evergreen slow growing rounded shrub (1m x 1m) from Asia. Shiny vivid green narrow leaves. Pendulous funnel shaped red flowers followed by small rounded orange-red fruits. Useful grouped in shrubbery or as a clipped or unclipped low hedge or border. Prefers no fertilizer. Potential to invade bushland. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen woody stemmed tendril climber (5m) from Brazil. Compound leaves. Tubular orange flowers in dense clusters in late winter to spring. Useful for a trellis or pergola or over a wall where the flowers can hang down. Prefers a warm position and ample water. Semi-frost tolerant.

Deciduous upright young tree from China. Matures to a conical shape (11m x 7m). Oval glossy dark green leaves turning dark red in autumn. Prolific white flowers in spring followed by small brown fruit. Useful as a feature or shade tree in a large garden. Prefers moist clay soil. Moderately invasive root system. Good cultivars include P. calleryana 'Aristocrat'; P. calleryana 'Capital' ; P. calleryana 'Chanticleer and P. calleryana 'Bradfield'. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous medium sized tree with a conical habit when young maturing to a rounded crown (9m x 7m) from Asia. Rounded leaves turning bronze in autumn. White flowers in spring followed by yellowish green fruit. Useful as a feature or shade tree in a large garden. Prefers fertile moist soil. Performs well in clay and tolerates some compaction. Moderately invasive root system. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous broadly pyramidal tree (20m x 5m) from North America. Deeply lobed glossy green leaves turning red and gold in autumn. Leaves held on tree long after colour has changed. Insignificant catkin flowers and acorn fruit. Useful as specimen or shade tree in large gardens. Tolerates dry sandy soil. Fibrous root system makes it easy to transplant. Susceptible to oak leaf miner. Frost tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen tropical climber (3m) from Malaya. Oblong leaves. Terminal sprays of fragrant (especially at night) flowers starting white turning pink then red throughout summer and autumn. Useful to cover a fence; trellis or wall. Requires support. Prefers a warm sunny position. Tolerant of pruning to any size. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen shrub with slightly pendulous branches (2.5m x 2.5m) from Qld and NSW. Linear juvenile leaves often in whorls. Narrow-elliptical adult leaves. Small fragrant white flowers followed by orange red egg shaped fruit. Tip prune from an early age to encourage multi stemming and denser growth. Useful understorey particularly for a rainforest themed garden or for a protected shady position. Needs moist well drained and composted soil. Frost and drought sensitive.

Fast growing annual root vegetable (0.8m x 0.5m) from China. Rough textured divided leaves. Clusters of white flowers. Useful in the vegetable garden for its crunchy edible root and edible leaf. Summer radishes are small; rounded; cylindrical or pointed and used in salads. Winter radishes are larger and turnip-like. Prefers moisture retentive fertile soil. Sow seed in situ and in succession from spring to autumn for summer radishes and in summer and early autumn for winter radishes. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen bushy shrub (1.5m x 2m) from China. Glossy oval leaves with serrate margins. Fragrant star shaped pink-flushed white flowers in spring followed by black berries. Useful as a hedge; mass planted or component of shrubbery. Prefers well composted soil. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen branching rounded shrub (3m x 2m) from Korea and Japan. Thick ovate leaves with a serrate margin. Slightly fragrant white flowers in summer followed by clusters of blue-black berries. Useful as a screen or part of shrubbery. Moderately tolerant of wind and salt spray. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen rounded shrub (1.5m x 2m). Hybrid between R. indica and R. umbellate from China and Japan. Glossy leathery broad-oblong leaves toothed on the outer edge. Erect clusters of fragrant deep pink flowers in spring and summer followed by dark blue berries. Useful for a specimen; mass planted; clipped or unclipped border or hedge. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen short lived perennial (1m x 0.5m) from China. Soft stem-clasping notched leaves forming a rosette. Semi-pendant bright pink two lipped flowers with a yellow throat in leaf axils from early to mid summer. Useful for a perennial garden or border. Needs a warm protected position shaded from the hottest sun. Sensitive to winter wet. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen upright suckering shrub branching from the base (1m x 1m) from mountains of India and China. Greyish green leaves with finely serrate margins. Small clusters of yellow flowers in winter. Useful mass planted particularly for colour in shaded areas; as a low trimmed border or in hard conditions where other plants will not grow. Prune often to avoid tendency to grow leggy. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.
Non indigenous (WA; SA; Vic; NSW; & Qld)

Evergreen low spreading shrub with angled branches (0.5m x 2m) from WA; SA; Vic; NSW & Qld. Silver grey diamond shaped to three-lobed leaves. Small inconspicuous flowers. Useful as a hardy groundcover and for foliage colour contrast. Prune to maintain shape. Tolerant of salt spray. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen slow growing fan palm eventually forming dense clumps (2m x 1m) from China. Leaves composed of many glossy narrow green lobes. Insignificant flowers. Useful for its lush foliage in a protected shady position particularly in a tropical themed garden. Prefers well composted sandy loam. Drought and frost sensitive.

Clump forming perennial vegetable (0.8m x 1m) from Western China; Siberia and Tibet. Green rough rounded leaves with five shallow lobes. Thick rhizomes with erect flowering stems. Useful as a vegetable for its edible leaf stalks or as an ornamental for its bold texture and leaf size. Leaves are poisonous. Divide crowns every six years. Prefers fertile well drained soil. Frost sensitive but recovers. Drought sensitive.
