Rhodanthe chlorocephala subsp rosea Syn Acroclinium roseum
value: Erect annual (0.6 m x 0.6 m) from Western Australia and South Australia. Green or greyish-green, linear leaves. Single, terminal flowers of white to pale-pink papery bracts surrounding a yellow centre in winter and spring. Useful for massed colour display in flower beds, borders, containers and for cut flowers. Prefers full-sun and infertile, well-drained soil. Tolerates light frosts. Drought tolerant.
Non indigenous (Himalayas; South East Asia and Malaysia.)

Evergreen variable mostly bushy large shrub or small tree (1-12m depending on variety) from the Himalayas; South East Asia and Malaysia. Dense leaf cover often from the ground up. Clusters of bell shaped flowers in spring. Useful as a specimen; massed or group planted or a component of shrubbery. Initially slow growing. Best in a cool mountain climate where it tolerates full sun. Compatible with azaleas and camellias. Requires partial shade in a warmer climate. Prefers well drain acid loam with plenty of organic matter. Mostly frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen low spreading shrub (0.8m x 0.8m) from Qld. Ovate dark green thick textured leaves. Bright red trumpet shaped flowers in spring. Useful specimen for a shady protected position or pot plant. Needs moist well composted acid soil. Tolerates light frosts only. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen clump forming perennial (0.5m x 0.25m) from Central America. Dark glossy green linear leaves arranged in a basal rosette with a purple underside. Tiny white insignificant flowers occurring in the leaf bases. Useful for tropical effect as a dense understorey and groundcover. Prefers partial shade. Tolerates shallow soil. May cause skin allergies in susceptible people. Potential weed in bushland. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone); Vic; Tas & NT)

Evergreen rounded shrub (1m x 1m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone); Vic; Tas and NT. Dark green linear leaves. Perfumed white star-shaped flowers in spring. Useful specimen or grouped particularly in a bush garden. Prefers sandy well drained soil in full or partial sun. Frost and drought tolerant.

Deciduous small tree with a compact rounded shape (3-5m x 2-3m). Grafted onto R. pseudoacacia rootstock from North America. Small pinnate bright green leaves turning yellow in autumn. Flowers rarely produced. Useful feature as a standard for a small formal garden or for creating an avenue effect. Tolerant of poor soil and pollution. Prefers well drained soil. Frost tolerant.

Deciduous spreading tree (6-10m x 7m) from USA. Pinnate leaves with oval leaflets; gold in spring turning green-gold in summer and orange yellow in autumn. Young thorny branchlets. Fragrant pink to white racemes of pea-shaped flowers. Useful as a small and colourful shade tree. Suckers heavily where roots are damaged. Tolerant to salinity. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen rounded shrub (3m x 2.5m) from Mexico and Guatemala. Broadly oval leaves; paler and slightly hairy beneath. Dense clusters of salmon pink tubular flowers in spring. Useful as a screen or flowering specimen particularly for coastal gardens. Bird attracting. Prefers a warm north facing position. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen vigorous climbing rose (8m) form China. Small shiny leaves on nearly thornless stems. Pale yellow double rosette-like flowers in spring. Useful for covering a pergola or trellis or mass planting over a bank. Tolerates poor soil. Prune lightly as flowers are carried on second and third-year wood. Tolerates only light frosts. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen fast growing spreading shrub or semi climber (0.8m x 1m) from the Mediterranean region. Soft thin leaves on long weak stems strongly aromatic when crushed. Flowers white to sky blue in clusters spring and summer. Useful for a low screen; mass planting; herb garden or prune for a hedge. Requires regular pruning. May cause skin allergies in susceptible people. Tolerates poor soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen tree (6m x 2m) from South Africa. Glossy elliptical leathery leaves. Fragrant white bell shaped flowers with darker spots in the throat followed by brown seedpods. Useful as a small shade tree or screen; particularly near the house for its perfume. Prefers well drained fertile loam. Tolerant of light frosts only. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen, upright, branching annual or biennial (0.8 m x 0.5 m) from the USA.Lance-shaped, dull-green leaves on bristly stems. Abundant large daisy-like, deep-yellow flowers with conical purple centres in summer and autumn. Useful for a bright splash of colour in flowerbeds,mixed perennial or semi-wild gardens. Prefers full sun. Remove spent flowers to prolong blooming. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen low spreading shrub or groundcover with distinctive tiered planes of foliage (0.3m x 1.5m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone regions). Dark green wrinkled leaves with hairy under-surface. White to pink star-shaped flowers in spring followed by prominent brown capsules covered with bristles. Useful for understorey; mass planted on slopes or mixed with other shrubs and groundcovers. Prefers well drained soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen branching rush-like shrub with fountain-like habit (1.5m x 3m) from Mexico. Small reduced leaves on long and arching stems. Showy clusters of red tubular flowers dominate the stems throughout summer and autumn. Useful to spill over a wall or bank or group planted amongst shrubbery. Prefers well composted sandy loam. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen rosette forming biennial or short-lived perennial (0.8m x 0.5m) from southern Europe and North Africa. Woolly silver leaves forming a flat basal rosette. Panicles of small white or pink tinged flowers in summer. Useful as foreground in a border or perennial garden. Flower buds may be removed to extend plant life and leaf longevity. Sensitive to high humidity. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen perennial with an open habit (1.2m x 0.8m) from Mexico and Guatemala. Edible pineapple scented ovate to heart shaped leaves covered in fine soft hairs. Terminal spikes of ruby red two-lipped tubular flowers arranged in whorls. Flowering in summer and autumn. Useful addition to the herb garden or amongst shrubbery. Prefers full sun in well drained moist soil. Good indicator of water demand as it wilts during drought and recovers when watering resumes. Frost sensitive.

Short lived mound forming perennial often grown as an annual (0.3-0.8m x 0.3m depending on variety) from Texas and Mexico. Light green toothed leaves with silvery undersides. Multiple spikes of lavender-like deep blue flowers on slender stems from spring through summer. White variety available. Useful for edging or a border. Suitable for a pot plant. Prefers well drained slightly dry soil. Sensitive to over watering. Protect from the hottest afternoon sun in warm areas. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen erect well branched perennial (0.9m x 1m) from Mexico and Central America. Narrow wrinkly dark green leaves above; downy white beneath. Purple velvet textured tubular flowers on erect terminal spikes in winter. Useful for mixed borders; perennial beds; children's play areas and winter colour. Butterfly attracting. Prefers well drained soil. Prune back hard in spring to keep bushy. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen short lived bushy shrub (0.6m x 0.5m) from the Mediterranean region. Highly aromatic grey-green wrinkled oblong leaves on erect stems. Loosely whorled spikes of blue flowers in summer. Useful for the herb or vegetable garden or border plant in garden beds. Prefers well drained sandy soil in full sun. Prune to maintain shape and encourage new growth. Replant every three to four years. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen upright branching perennial (1.5m x 0.9m) from South America. Elliptical leaves well spaced becoming progressively smaller up the stem. Long racemes of sky blue flowers in summer. Useful for a wet bog area or in the perennial garden. Tolerates poorly drained soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen stemless perennial with creeping rhizomes (0.8m x 0.2m) from South Africa. Spiky pointed lance shaped fleshy erect leaves banded horizontally with pale green and yellow. Occasionally carries fragrant green tubular flowers. Useful for the contrast of its colour and vertical leaf form especially in a low light position. Sensitive to combination of cold and wet conditions. Prefers a warm position protected from the hottest sun. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen small compact shrub ( 0.5m x 0.5m) from Europe and North Africa. Aromatic narrow heavily divided silver leaves. Small yellow button-like flowers held on stems above the foliage in summer. Useful as a low hedge or border; for the herb garden or as contrast amongst shrubbery. Prefers full sun in well drained soil. Prune regularly to maintain compact growth. Frost and drought tolerant.

Warm-season, fast-growing, prostrate annual (0.15 m x 0.4 m) from Mexico. Pointed, oval leaves. Daisy-like yellow flowers with blackish centres. Many cultivars available. Useful for bedding colour, edging; groundcover for rock gardens or pot plants. Prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Avoid root disturbance. Plant seed where it is to be grown. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous spreading tree (8m x 4m) from China. Heart-shaped leaves turning bright red in autumn. Inconspicuous flowers followed by black fleshy berries. Useful as a shade or feature tree particularly for its good autumn colour in warm districts.. Moderately invasive root system. Avoid placing close to structures. Frost tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen prostrate perennial with runners (0.2m x 0.4m) from Japan. Glossy rounded olive green leaves with silver veins. Purplish pink on the undersides. Delicate panicles of oddly petalled white flowers in summer on slender upright stems. Cultivar 'Tricolour' has green leaves patterned with red and white. Useful for a rock or gravel garden; raised bed or pot plant. Prefers moist fertile well drained soil in partial shade. Frost and drought sensitive.

Spreading clumping perennial (0.2m x 0.3m) from the Pyrenees. Grey green leaves forming a rosette. Small white flowers on succulent multiple stems. Useful for a rock or gravel garden; raised bed or pot plant. Prefers moist fertile well drained soil in partial shade. Frost and drought sensitive.

Clump forming perennial (0.5m x 0.5m) from the Caucasus. Light green variable lance shaped to pinnate leaves at the base and segmented on stems. Large frilled violet-blue flowers with pincushion-like centres in summer. Useful for a border; edging or addition to the perennial garden. Prefers well drained fertile soil in full sun. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen variable prostrate to ascending in growth groundcover (0.15-0.5m x 0.6m) from NSW and Vic. Obovate or wedge-shaped toothed leaves on stems clothed in yellowish hairs. Mauve fan-shaped flowers in spring and summer. Useful as a fast growing groundcover and suitable for coastal areas. Bird and insect attracting. Cultivars include 'Purple Fan Fare' and 'Mauve Clusters'. Needs a well drained sunny position. Frost sensitive.
Indigenous (Coastal dunes Qld; NSW (Sydney); Vic & SA)

Evergreen vigorous trailing groundcover (0.1m x 1m) from coastal sand dunes In Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic & SA. Shiny succulent spoon-shaped leaves. Blue fan shaped flowers with a yellow base. Useful as a groundcover to spill over banks and for soil binding especially in coastal locations. Needs a sunny well drained position. Frost sensitive. Drought and salt spray tolerant.

Evergreen low spreading perennial (0.15m x 0.4m) from NT; Qld; NSW and SA. Obovate leaves. Fan-shaped pale blue flowers in the leaf axils through most of the year. Useful specimen for a rock or gravel garden or grouped for groundcover in a small area. Needs well drained soil in full sun. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen scrambling prostrate perennial with wiry stems (0.2m x 0.8m) from Vic; NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone) and Qld. Thick toothed leaves covered in stiff hairs. Deep purple to soft lavender flowers with a yellow and white throat from late winter to summer. Useful for a rock or gravel garden or scrambling groundcover. Needs well drained mulched soil in full sun. Salt spray tolerant. Tolerates light frosts. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen single or multi-stemmed upright bushy shrub or tree (6-10m x 3m) from Qld and Northern Territory. Large glossy light green palmate leaflets radiating from a central point. Red flowers appearing like ribs of an umbrella. Useful as a screen or feature plant and well suited to tropical gardens. Prefers a protected position. Frost and drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen fast growing weeping tree with a knotted trunk (8m x 5m) from Peru. Grey-green compound fern-like leaves. Minute greenish-yellow flowers followed by red berries in autumn and winter. Useful as a feature tree for its form; shade tree or windbreak. Tolerates hot dry winds. Foliage can cause skin irritations in some. Semi-frost tolerant. Drought tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen spreading tree (7m x 5m) with a globular crown and short trunk from Brazil. Dark green leaves with uneven finely toothed leaflets. White flowers followed by clusters of glossy green fruit turning bright red. Useful shade or ornamental tree for dry harsh conditions. Invasive weed potential. Avoid use near bushland areas. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen broadly conical coniferous tree (7m x 3m) from Japan. Deep green flattened needle-like leaves yellowish beneath arranged in umbrella-like whorls at the ends of shoots. Other small scale-like leaves occur below each whorl of needles. Ovoid cones. Useful specimen or accent plant in a conifer garden. Sensitive to wind burn. Prefers fertile moist well drained acid soil in full sun. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen slow growing spreading moss-like perennial groundcover (0.05m x 0.4m) from NSW; Vic and Tas. Tiny rigid and crowded leaves on procumbent and congested stems producing a mounded appearance. Minute double-headed green flowers in late spring. Useful border; groundcover around stepping stones or rockery plant contrasting well with broad-leaved plants. Suitable for clinging to rock features and shaping itself into crevices. Needs full sun and ample moisture to maintain tight appearance. Susceptible to fungal disease. Clean out affected parts and apply suitable fungicide. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Upright clumping perennial (0.2m x 0.15m) from Japan. Light grey green oval leaves. Crowded heads of blue-mauve tubular flowers in late spring. Useful for a rock or gravel garden. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Prefers a cool mountain climate. Frost tolerant.
Non indigenous (Diverse regions depending on sp.)

Evergreen fleshy or succulent perennials; many with trailing stems or sprout roots at the joints (mostly 0.3m or less) from a diverse range of regions. Plump and fleshy leaves Small starry flowers in shades of white; yellow or pink flowers. Useful for rock or pebble gardens; groundcover or pots. Some sp. may have potential to invade bushland. Avoid over watering. Both frost tolerant and sensitive depending on sp. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen matt forming perennial (0.12m x 0.1m) from European Alps. Rosettes of oval fleshy succulent leaves with red tips covered in a web of white hairs. Loose clusters of rose red flowers in summer. Useful in a rock or pebble garden or for containers on balconies. Needs well drained soil. Sensitive to over-watering. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen mound forming sub-shrub or perennial (0.6m x 0.8m) from the Mediterranean region. Deeply divided woolly silver grey leaves. Bright yellow daisy flowers in summer. Useful specimen; as part of a border or for formal bedding. Tolerant of salt spray and air pollution. Sensitive to high summer rainfall and humidity. Tolerates light frosts. Drought tolerant once established.

Evergreen twining climber (3m) from South Africa. Dark triangular fleshy leaves. Solitary long stalked yellow daisy-like flowers during winter. Useful quick cover for a fence or trellis. Suitable for hanging baskets. Tolerant of poor soils. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen branching and stem rooting succulent perennial (0.3m x 1m) from South Africa. Chalky blue grey cylindrical fleshy leaves. Small white flowers in summer. Useful mixed with other succulents for edging or groundcover. Needs full sun and well drained soil. Tolerates light frosts. Drought tolerant.

Upright, mound-shaped, cool-season annual (0.2-0.6 m x 0.2-0.6 m) depending on cultivar from the Canary Islands. Oval, serrated, deep-green leaves. Daisy-like single or double flowers in shades of blue, red, pink or white during winter and spring. Useful for massed colour display. Use tall varieties as background and compact varieties as borders. Prefers partial shade and well drained fertile soil. Protect from strong wind. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen rounded shrub (2.5m x 2.5m) from arid areas throughout Australia. Pinnate smooth greyish green leaves. Yellow buttercup-like flowers in spring. Useful feature shrub for its contrasting foliage and bright flowers. Requires minimal water once established. Needs well drained soil in a warm sunny position Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen loose clump forming grass (0.3m x 0.3m) from Europe. Soft two toned leaves glaucous blue on top dark green beneath. Small spikey panicles of purplish black flowers maturing silver green. Useful massed as a groundcover; as filler between larger grasses or for edging a pathway. Tolerates light foot traffic. Prefers partial shade position with well drained moist soil. Frost tolerant.
Non indigenous (Europe; Arctic; Asia & North America)

Evergreen mat forming perennial groundcover (0.05m x 0.2m) from Europe; Arctic; Asia and North America. Minute crowded overlapping bright green leaves. Tiny stemless pink flowers in summer. Useful for a gravel or rock garden. Prefers moist well drained soil in a cool mountain climate. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Fast-growing, bushy biennial mostly grown as an annual (0.2 m x 0.2 m) from the Mediterranean region. Oval, hairy, mid-green leaves. Clusters of pale-pink flowers in summer. Useful for bedding, with a mixed border; edging or pot plant. Needs well-drained soil in full sun. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen upright perennial (0.5m x 0.3m) from Chile and Argentina. Tufts of grey green iris-like leaves. Slender spikes of small yellow flowers striped purple. Variegated form available. Useful for a mixed border or perennial garden. Good companion for grey and silver leaved plants. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen vigorous wiry tendril climber (5m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney) and Vic. Tough stiff prominently veined leaves with prickles on strong stems. Insignificant white flowers. Useful foliage plant to cover a fence in a shaded position or for a rainforest themed garden. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen large heavy vigorous woody stemmed scrambling climber (10m) from Mexico. Glossy leaves with long stems on long arching sappy branches. Night-fragrant golden yellow open cup shaped flowers with a brown stripe in the centre of each petal. Summer flowering and intermittently throughout the year. Useful for a large pergola or trellis or trained to grow up the side of a house. Requires strong support. Suitable for coastal areas. Salt spray tolerant. Any well drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Keep dry in early summer and water well in autumn when growth commences. Tolerates hard pruning. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen vigorous woody stemmed scrambling climber (6m) from Brazil. Oval to lanceolate upper leaves. Trifoliate lower leaves. Clusters of tubular white tinged blue flowers in summer and autumn. Useful for quick and easy covering of vertical structures particularly in hard conditions. Invasive weed potential near bushland areas. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen slender stemmed scrambling climber (3m) from Brazil. Leaves divided into pairs of oval to lanceolate leaflets. Nodding clusters of violet coloured flowers with yellow stamens in spring to autumn followed by globular red berries. Useful for a trellis or screen. Invasive weed potential. Avoid use near bushland areas. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen gentle twining climber or shrub (2m) from WA. Oblong or lanceolate pale green leaves. Blue rarely pink bell-shaped flowers in summer followed by purple berries in autumn. Useful to scramble over a fence or stump; hang down over walls or can be allowed to mat as a groundcover. Variation in forms from climbing to shrubby therefore select for property required. Tolerates moderate frosts. Drought tolerant.

Deciduous spreading tree (15m x 10m) from China and Korea. Dark green fern-like leaves with numerous narrow leaflets. Long clusters of pea-like creamy white pea flowers in late summer. Useful shade or specimen tree. Numerous cultivars available. Prefers moist fertile well drained soil. Tolerant of poorer soils. Urban pollution tolerant. Tolerates light to medium frosts once established.

Deciduous spreading tree (10m x 7m) with a rounded open crown from Europe and western Asia. Fern-like leaves turning reddish in cool climates. Large clusters of white flowers in spring followed by orange to red berries in autumn. Useful feature or shade tree. May be close planted as a screen or large informal hedge. Prefers moist fertile well drained soil. Potentially invasive root system. Avoid planting close to structures. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen tufted perennial (0.5m x 0.4m) from South America and Malaysia. Lance shaped semi-erect glossy dark green leaves. Flowers enclosed in white waxy spathes in summer and autumn. Useful for containers indoors and outdoors in a warm partial to fully shaded position. Dwarf forms available. Prefers moist fertile soil in humid atmosphere. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen showy tree (12m x 7m) from West Africa. Large fern-like leaves with deep green leaflets. Upturned curved unopened olive green buds expanding to trumpet-shaped scarlet or orange-red flowers with yellow throats in spring and throughout the year. Useful for shade; specimen for its flower colour and tropical effect. Suitable for warm coastal gardens. Needs protection from strong winds as branches prone to shattering. Prefers moist fertile soil but tolerates drought periods. Frost sensitive but often recovers.

Deciduous shrub with arching stems (2m x 2m) from China and Japan. Narrow diamond shaped leaves with serrate margins. Clusters of white flowers in spring. Useful for flowers amongst shrubbery; and as a deciduous hedge or border. Flowering doubles and variable colour forms available. Protect from wind. Frost tolerant.

Semi-evergreen broad rounded low growing shrub (0.8m x 1m). Hybrid of S. albiflora and S. japonica from Japan. Dark green finely cut serrated leaves on slender branches with deep burgundy new growth throughout spring and summer. Bright pink to red flowers with long stamens in flat-topped clusters. Useful for a specimen; border; low hedge or mass planted. Prefers moist well drained soil in full sun but tolerates extended dry periods. Avoid poorly drained soil. Remove old flower heads to extend flowering. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen dense prostrate shrub (0.1m x 2m). Naturally occurring form of S. parvifolium from SE NSW. Small round green leaves strongly veined with silvery underside and grey new growth. Clusters of small insignificant flowers at the ends of branches in spring and summer. Useful groundcover or rockery plant. Prefers well drained soil in full to partial sun. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen dense prostrate shrub (0.15m x 0.7m) from Vic and NSW. Obovate leaves with three teeth at the top and silvery underside. Small white flowers surrounded by white leafy bracts. Useful groundcover or rockery plant. Prefers well drained soil in full to partial sun. Frost tolerance not tested. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen mat forming perennial (0.3m x 0.6m) from Turkey and south-west Asia. Woolly grey leaves. Mauve pink flowers in summer. Useful for colour contrast in a perennial garden; as a border or grouped as groundcover. Remove spent flower stalks to maintain form. Sensitive to high humidity and over watering. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen clump forming perennial (0.5m x 0.5m) from the Caucasus. Soft wrinkled scallop edged hairy dark green leaves. Upright stems above the foliage bearing whorls of pinkish purple two lipped tubular flowers from summer to autumn. Useful for a border; edging or informal perennial garden. Clumps spread over time to form a dense groundcover. Prefers well drained soil in full to partial sun. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous upright open shrub (2m x 2m) from Japan. Glossy deep green pointed leaves turning gold to claret red in autumn on glossy deep red branches. Drooping spikes like strands on a necklace of pale greenish yellow flowers on bare branches in late winter. Useful in a shrub border or as a background plant behind perennials. Prefers moist well drained soil. Frost sensitive but often recovers.

Evergreen slow growing erect tree (10m x 4m) from Qld and NSW. Glossy deep green leaves with wavy and deeply incised margins. Wheel-like bright red flowers in summer and autumn. Useful as a specimen or screen tree. Prefers fertile loamy soils. Frost and drought sensitive.

Warm season coarse textured sod forming turf grass spreading by long stout stolons from the West Indies. Strong thick flat stems with pale lime green rigid leaves blunt to boat shape at the apex. Short terminal spike-like flower heads. Useful utilitarian lawn for coastal gardens. Avoid use in children's play areas as may cause skin irritation. Tolerant of salt spray. Sensitive to poor drainage and low fertility. Poor wear tolerance but rejuvenates well. Prone to thatching requiring annual maintenance. Frost sensitive with some browning off. Requires irrigation in dry areas to maintain turf in green condition.

Warm season broad leaf type soft buffalo turf grass similar in appearance to Sir Walter Buffalo. Thick flat stems with soft emerald green leaves. Short terminal spike-like flower heads. Useful lawn for coastal and dry areas. Tolerant of salt spray. Good shade tolerance requiring 3 to 4 hours direct sunlight per day. Deep root system with moderate drought tolerance once established. Preferred cutting height 35mm. Prone to thatching requiring annual maintenance. Best frost tolerance of all Buffalo varieties. Deep root system with moderate drought tolerance once established.

Warm season broad leaf type soft buffalo turf grass similar in appearance to Palmetto Buffalo. Thick flat stems with soft emerald green leaves. Short terminal spike-like flower heads. Useful lawn for partial shade and lush green appearance. Good shade tolerance requiring 2 to 3 hours direct sunlight per day. Quickest growing of all Buffalo varieties; requiring regular mowing. Preferred cutting height 35mm. Prone to thatching requiring annual maintenance. Moderately frost tolerant. Deep root system with moderate drought tolerance once established.

Evergreen semi vigorous woody stemmed twining climber (3m) from Madagascar. Thick glossy dark green leaves. Small clusters of very fragrant waxy white star-like flowers from spring to autumn. Useful for a trellis or container near the house and highly valued for its cut flower. Needs composted well drained soil. Frost and drought sensitive.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney rainforests & gullies); Vic; NZ & New Caledonia)

Evergreen erect fern (0.8m x 1.5m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney in gullies and rainforests); Vic; NZ & New Caledonia. Glossy bright green fronds divided into 1-2 pairs of axes. Long creeping rhizome. Useful for a sheltered position in partial to full shade. Prefers moist soil. Frost sensitive. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen basal rosetted perennial (0.4m x 0.4m) from North America. Green narrow divided leaves. Erect stems of lavender or purple daisy-like flowers from spring to autumn. Useful for a mixed border; grouped for colour in the perennial garden or for cut flowers. Suitable for coastal areas. Prefers moist well drained soil. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen palm-like clumping perennial resembling a banana plant (5m x 2m) from South Africa. Large greyish leaves with long petioles. Erect stems of terminal flowers with white sepals; blue petals and a red spathe resembling the head of a bird. Useful as a feature or screen particularly in coastal and tropical themed gardens. Tolerant of salt spray. Moderately invasive root system. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen clump forming perennial (1m x 1.5m) from South Africa. Bluish green blade-like leaves. Purple blue and orange flowers resembling the head of a crested bird; on erect stems. Useful for tropical gardens; accent amongst shrubs and as a cut flower. Remove spent flowers. Sensitive to salinity. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen hybrid perennial forming an asymmetrical clump (0.25m x 0.4m) from South Africa. Strap shaped wrinkled green leaves. Trumpet shaped flowers in shades or mauve; magenta; rose and salmon. Useful for containers indoors or outdoors in a warm protected position. Needs high humidity and fertile well drained soil. Benefits from monthly application of soluble fertiliser. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen loosely scrambling shrub (2m x 2m) from Columbia and Ecuador. Oval finely corrugated leaves. Terminal clusters of orange flowers in spring and summer. Useful spilling over walls or with shrubbery for its bright floral display. Tolerates light frosts only.

Evergreen erect and branching shrub (1m x 1m) from India. Narrow deep green leaves stained purple black on both sides. Spikes of funnel to bell shaped white flowers turning lavender with age. Useful as a specimen or in groups mixed with shrubbery for the contrast of its foliage. Protect from wind. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen variable tufted perennial (0.3-0.9m x 0.4m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney); Vic; Tas & SA. Stiff grass-like leaves. Long terminal spikes of gradually opening flowers from pale pink to magenta in spring and summer. Useful for an informal bush or perennial garden. Bird attracting. Salt spray tolerant. Needs a well drained sunny position. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen erect bushy shrub (1.5m x 1m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone sheltered understorey). Blue green stiff pointed leaves. Clusters of pink tubular flowers with hairy cream tips in winter and spring. Green flowering form available. Useful sheltering beneath trees or tall shrubs particularly in a bush garden. Prefers composted well drained moist soil in partial shade. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen meandering shrub (0.6m x 0.8m) from NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone and Blue Mtns). Narrow sharply pointed leaves. Drooping red tubular flowers in rows on the stems in spring. Useful between shrubs in a rock or gravel garden or understorey particularly in a bush garden. Needs well drained composted and mulched soil. Prefers partial shade. Frost and drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Evergreen palm with single smooth trunk and head of arching fronds (6-12m x 4m) from Brazil. Glossy bright green soft pinnate leaves. Yellow flowers and bright orange fruit on mature palms. Useful as an accent or in groups. Often used around swimming pools. Invasive potential as seeds carried by birds. Requires ample water. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen tall straight tree with fibrous bark (30m x 8m) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney). Thick and stiff lanceolate leaves with greyish underside. Fluffy white flowers in summer followed by woody fruit. Useful as a specimen or windbreak in large gardens. Prefers deep fertile soil. Fruit may be a nuisance in traffic areas. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate natural occurrence.

Deciduous erect shrub or small tree (4m x 2.5m) from Asia and Iran. Smooth heart shaped leaves on arching branches. Large heads in pairs of fragrant flowers in spring in shades of white; pink; mauve; lilac-blue and purple-reds. Useful as a small specimen tree or in the background of shrubbery for its spring flowers. Prefers a cool climate and moist fertile alkaline soil. Sensitive to soil acidity. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.
Non indigenous (Hybrid between S. leuhmanni and S wilsonii from Qld)

Evergreen round bushy shrub with pendulous habit (2.5m x 1.5m). Hybrid between S. leuhmanni and S wilsonii both from Qld. Drooping red new growth changing from shades of pink to green as the new growth ages. Clusters of cream to pink flowers in spring followed by edible fruit in summer. Useful as a weeping specimen; screen or pruned to a dense colourful hedge. Shows good resistance to attack by leaf psyllid insect. Frost and drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen compact bushy shrub (0.8m x 0.8m). Dwarf form of S australe from NSW and Qld. Small elliptical leaves with bronze red new growth. White flowers infrequently. Useful as a feature; small clipped or unclipped hedge or mass planted as low understorey. Good resistance to Lillypilly psyllid. Frost sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.
Indigenous (Qld & NSW (including Sydney in coastal rainforests))

Evergreen small to medium tree (8m x 4m often less) from Qld and NSW (including Sydney rainforests of Hawkesbury Sandstone and Illawarra regions). Elliptical to obovate leaves glossy above. White fluffy flowers followed by edible red or mauve ovoid fruit. Useful for a feature; screen or hedge particularly for beachside sites as low branches offer good protection from winds. Dwarf cultivars available some of which are susceptible to attack by leaf psyllid insect. Salt spray tolerant. Frost sensitive. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen spreading tree (12m x 5m) from southeast Asia. Dark green glossy lanceolate leaves. Terminal clusters of white fluffy flowers followed by fragrant edible fleshy fruit. Useful for a tropical or rainforest themed garden. Fruit valued for jams and jellies. Prefers moist fertile well drained soil. Frost and drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen dense low branching tree or large shrub (4-8m x 2-4m) from Qld and NSW. Glossy green lanceolate leaves; pink to coppery red when young. White fluffy flowers in spring followed by edible red pear-shaped berries. Useful as a specimen tree; screen; windbreak or clipped hedge. Resistant to lillypilly psyllid. Prefers a protected position. Frost sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.
Indigenous (Qld & NSW (including rainforests of Sydney & Illawarra regions))

Evergreen dense compact shrub (3m x 1.5m) from NSW (including coastal rainforests of Sydney). Glossy green lanceolate leaves. Terminal cream fluffy flowers followed by magenta coloured edible ovoid fruit. Useful for a specimen; screen; hedge; topiary or container planting. Suitable for coastal conditions. Reasonably resistant to leaf psyllid insect. Frost sensitive. Moderately drought tolerant. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen rounded shrub with weeping branches (2m x 2m) from Qld rainforests. Stiff lanceolate leaves with pinkish red new growth. Large fluffy red flowers from spring to summer followed by ovoid shaped edible fleshy fruit. Useful specimen or understorey particularly for a tropical or rainforest themed garden. Bird attracting. Needs a shaded sheltered position. Protect from drying winds. Prefers composted well drained and mulched soil. Prune to increase flower quantity. Frost and drought sensitive.

Deciduous wide spreading shrub (4m x 4m) from south-eastern Europe. Small scale-like greyish green leaves. Dense clusters of tiny pink flowers on branches along last years growth in spring. Useful hedge or windbreak particularly on exposed coastal sites. Highly tolerant of salt spray. Heat tolerant. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Invasive weed potential. Avoid use near bushland areas. Frost and drought tolerant.

Deciduous broadly conical tree (20m x 10m) from North America. Soft fresh green linear leaves turning rich brown in autumn. Useful specimen for very large gardens planted in a low spot or near water. Tolerant of any moist soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.
Non indigenous (Cultivar of T. speciossima from NSW & T. oreads from NSW & Vic)

Evergreen upright shrub (3m x 1.5m). Hardy cultivar from T. speciossima (NSW) x T oreads (NSW & Vic). Toothed or lobed leathery obovate leaves. Red flowers in spring in large terminal inflorescences. Useful as a hedge ; border or in groups for its spectacular flowers. Bird attracting. Needs well drained sandy soil. Frost tolerant.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney Sandstone north of the harbour) & Vic)

Evergreen rounded shrub (0.3-0.6m x 0.6m-1m) from Qld; NSW (including Syney Sandstone north of the harbour) and Vic. Tiny elliptical leaves in whorls. Perfumed deep pink bell-like flowers in winter and spring. Useful for blending with other small shrubs in a cottage or bush garden setting; rock garden or pot plant. Suitable for coastal gardens. Needs well drained mulched soil in full sun to filtered light. Frost tolerant. Moderately drought tolerant.

Evergreen arching shrub with interlacing branches (1m x 1.5m) from Spain. Aromatic silver grey woolly oval leaves. Lipped lavender blue flowers in summer. Useful as a clipped hedge; against a sunny wall; in a herb garden or rockery or for topiary. Needs a well drained and warm position. Prune to maintain shape. Frost Sensitive.

Clump forming perennial (1m x 0.5m) from Europe and Asia. Finely divided grey green leaves. Bunched heads of fluffy lilac; pink or greenish white flowers on strong stems in summer. Useful for a border or perennial garden. Needs fertile well drained moist soil in a protected partial sun position. Sensitive to summer humidity. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Clump forming perennial (1.2m x 0.6m) from western China. Mid green finely divided leaves. Loose panicles of nodding lilac flowers with prominent yellow stamens in summer. Useful for a border or perennial garden. Needs fertile well drained moist soil in a protected partial sun position Sensitive to summer humidity. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen tuft-forming perennial (1.2m x 0.5m) from northern NSW & Qld. Grass like leaves with bluish coloured new shoots. Large deep blue flowers with distinctive yellow anthers on erect branched stems in spring. Useful for mass planting; as a border or mixed with other grass-like species. Prefers fertile sandy soil in full sun. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen tussock forming grass with mat-like habit (0.8m x 0.3m) from all states of Australia (including Sydney). Slender soft linear leaves turning maroon in winter. Bunched nodding wiry flower heads on slender stems. Useful as a groundcover; grouped as understorey particularly in a bush garden or closely planted as a rugged appearance turf substitute. Benefits from a brush-cut twice a year. Improved forms available. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen spreading slightly pendulous shrub (1m x 1.5m) from Western Australia. Slender small oval leaves crowded on the stem. Small slightly cupped pink flowers massed along outer branches for long periods in winter and spring. Useful mass planted on a bank or amongst shrubs for winter colour. Hardy. Prefers a well-drained position. Frost sensitive and drought tolerant.

Evergreen slow growing coniferous tree with a narrow crown (15m x 3m) from North America. Flattened sprays of scale-like yellowish green leaves; paler below. Pale green oblong cones turning reddish brown. Useful as a windbreak; screen or feature. Pollution tolerant. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen pyramidal semi-dwarf coniferous shrub (2.5m x 1m) from North America. Flat sprays of glossy bright green scale-like leaves. Urn shaped cones maturing to reddish brown. Useful specimen; accent; or formal hedge. Prefers full sun and fertile moist well drained soil. Protect from harsh winds. Salt spray tolerant. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.
Non indigenous (Australian selected cultivar of T.orientalis from Korea & Japan)

Evergreen slow growing dwarf coniferous shrub with a broadly conical form (0.3m x 0.3m). Australian selected cultivar of T.orientalis from Korea and Japan. Flat sprays of dense juvenile greenish gold leaves turning orange in winter. Useful for a rock garden or mixed with other dwarf conifers. Prefers moist well drained soil. Tolerates light frosts. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen coniferous tree or shrub with a broad conical form (5m x 2.5m) from North America. Aromatic scale-like flattened sprays of bright creamy yellow leaves in spring turning green then bronze with bands of gold in autumn. Useful specimen or hedging plant. Prefers a cool mountain climate and fertile well drained soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen woody stemmed twining climber (6m) from Northern India. Leathery irregularly toothed pointed heart shaped leaves. Pendant clusters of trumpet shaped pale blue to violet blue flowers in summer. White variety available. Useful easy care and fast growing plant to cover a fence or pergola. Prune to control direction and size. Requires structural support. Prefers rich organic soil. Drought and frost sensitive.

Evergreen mat forming or small dome shaped shrubs (0.1-0.3m x 0.3m) from Europe. Aromatic variable small leaves. Two lipped white; lilac or pink flowers in summer. Useful for rock gardens; edging; between stepping stones; herb gardens; or banks. Attracts bees. Needs well drained soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen vigorous spreading perennial (0.3m x 0.3m) from North America. Lobed pale green leaves with veins turning bronze red in winter. Many spikes of tiny cream flowers in late spring. Useful addition for the shady perennial garden or as understorey groundcover. Prefers partial to deep shade in moist well drained soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen slow growing clump forming perennial (0.2m x 0.2m) from North America. Hairy green triangular leaves turning crimson in autumn. Terminal spikes of soft pink or white star shaped flowers in spring. Useful specimen or grouped in the perennial garden. Prefers a shady position in moist well drained soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen compact shrub (1m x 1.5m). Dwarf form of T. granulosa from South America. Dark green velvety leaves. Purple flowers from autumn to winter. Useful as a feature; border or amongst shrubbery particularly in a warm protected courtyard. Protect from wind. Responds well to pruning. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen small branching tree (5m x 3m) from South America. Dark green velvety leaves with prominent longitudinal veins. Reddish bronze new growth. Purple flowers in long sprays in winter. Useful for a small garden as a feature tree with brilliant flower colour or shade tree. Sensitive to wind. Prune to encourage new less leggy growth. Prefers a protected site with fertile soil. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen basal rosetted epiphytic perennial (0.4m x 0.4m) from South America. Linear pointed arching green leaves. Blade-like spikes of deep blue flowers with a white throat surrounded by pink tinted bracts in summer. Useful in clumps fixed or tied to tree trunks or rough surfaces or potted in a well drained open mix. Prefers a warm protected position. Sensitive to over-watering. Frost sensitive. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen large tufted fern with a short trunk (1.5m x 2m) from Australia (including Sydney); New Zealand and South Africa. Large light green fronds radiating from the trunk. Useful feature for a water feature or shaded protected position. Needs constant moisture in well composted soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.
Indigenous (Qld; NSW (including IIllawarra region of Sydney); PNG; India and Indomalaysia.)

Deciduous large tree often with a buttressed trunk (up to 40m x 15m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney IIllawarra region); PNG; India and Indomalaysia. Compound pinnate leaves with pink new growth. Perfumed white flowers in spring followed by brown capsules. Useful as a feature or shade tree for very large gardens. Fast growing. Susceptible to attack by tip moth larvae . Frost sensitive. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Evergreen perennial (0.8m x 0.6m) from the Mediterranean region. Deep green toothed leaves. Domed clusters of tubular lilac blue or white flowers in late spring and summer. Useful for a mixed border; perennial garden; rock or gravel garden or cut flower. Prefers well drained moist soil in a sunny protected position. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen slender stemmed vine or groundcover (0.2m x 1m) from Korea and Japan forming dense mats of foliage. Glossy deep green small leathery leaves. Fragrant cream pinwheel-shaped flowers turning light yellow in summer. Useful mass planted as a weed suppressing groundcover. Variegated leaf form available. Suitable for coastal locations. Frost sensitive. Tolerates short periods of drought.

Evergreen woody stemmed twining climber (6m) from China. Thick; shiny oval leaves. Terminal clusters of fragrant white star-shaped flowers in early summer. Useful for a trellis; pergola or to cover a wire clad fence. Also suitable clipped as a mass planted groundcover. Prefers fertile soil. Prune after flowering to contain growth. Very sensitive to salinity. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen fan palm with an unbranched stem (10m x 3m) from China. Unevenly and deeply divided fan-like dark green leaves. Sprays of fragrant cream flowers in summer. Useful accent in a tropical themed garden. Prefers a shaded or partial shaded position. Sun tolerant with regular moisture. Tolerant of salt spray and wind. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen trailing succulent stemmed groundcover (0.15m x 2m) from Mexico. Bluish green stem clasping leaves striped with two broad silver bands and purple tinged underside. Pink or violet blue flowers intermittently during the year. Useful as a colourful and fast growing groundcover. Prefers moist fertile soil for good leaf cover. Frost and drought sensitive.

Evergreen spreading tree with bare shiny bark (10m x 8m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney) and Vic. Glossy narrow lanceolate leaves. Yellow flowers form dense bundles at the end of branches. Useful as a small shade tree. Tolerant of poorly drained soils. Frost tolerant. Drought tolerant once established. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Clump forming perennial (0.7m x 0.5m) from China. Deeply dissected glossy basal leaves. Light to deep yellow buttercup-like flowers. Useful for the boggy edge of a pond or similar damp position. Prefers partial shade. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Trailing fast growing annual (0.2m x 1m) from Peru. Circular flat green leaves. Trumpet shaped flowers with many colour varieties -mostly yellow,orange and red. Useful for covering banks or small structures. Edible leaves and flowers. Sow seed direct. Prefers no fertiliser. Invasive weed potential near bushland areas. Frost sensitive.

Semi-evergreen dainty clump forming perennial (0.5m x 0.3m) from South Africa. Narrow glaucous blue grey leaves. Umbels of lilac or pink flowers above the foliage in summer. Useful for edging; mass planting on banks to multiply rapidly or amongst a perennial garden. Prefers fertile damp conditions. Semi frost tolerant.

Perennial with long running rhizomes sending up widely spaced stems (0.3m x 0.2m) from the UK and Europe. Heart shaped leaves glossy green above and white felted beneath. Solitary daisy-like yellow flowers on white woolly scaly flowering stalks in spring before the leaves. Useful addition to the herb garden or unusual plant for the perennial garden. Prefers heavy moist soil. Tolerates poor drainage and shade. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen short-lived straggling perennial (1m x 1m) from Brazil and Uraguay. Heart shaped grey green downy leaves. Loose clusters of pale blue to sky blue star-shaped flowers in summer followed by boat shaped green seed pods. Useful fill-in for the perennial garden or mixed with shrubbery. Tip prune when young to encourage branching. Prefers well drained soil in full sun. Tolerates light frosts. Drought tolerant.

Deciduous spreading tree (10m x 6m) from Europe and the UK. Egg-shaped serrated leaves pale yellow in spring deepening to greenish yellow in summer and turning gold in autumn. Useful specimen or shade tree. Tolerant of urban pollution. Prefers moist fertile well drained soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Deciduous or semi-deciduous tree with gracefully arching branches and mottled trunk (10m x 8m) from China and Japan. Small oval glossy dark green leaves. Insignificant flowers followed by winged seeds. Useful as a shade or feature tree. Frost tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen erect biennial (1.8m x 1m) from the Middle East. Silvery grey furry large leaves. Upright spikes bearing golden yellow cup shaped flowers in summer. Useful in the perennial garden for its stately upright habit; contrasting foliage and long flowering period. Prefers full sun in well drained soil. Sensitive to winter wet conditions. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen erect perennial (1m x 0.6m) from Europe. Rough textured large toothed oval leaves. Slender spires of white flowers with purple stamens in summer. Useful specimen or grouped in the perennial garden. Prefers full sun in well drained soil. Sensitive to winter wet conditions. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen rosette forming short-lived perennial (1.5m x 1m) from Greece. Silvery grey felt-like leaves. Branching erect stems of golden yellow flowers from summer to autumn. Useful in the perennial garden or as background border for its stately upright habit; contrasting foliage and long flowering period. Self seeds freely. Prefers full sun in well drained soil. Drought and frost tolerant.
Non indigenous (Southern Europe to northern Asia)

Evergreen clump forming perennial (0.3-0.5m x 0.3m-0.5m) from southern Europe to northern Asia. Variable leaves from narrow to broadly oval and entire to deeply cut. Slender stems with dense racemes of bright blue saucer shaped flowers in late spring. Useful for a border; rock garden or addition to the perennial garden. Susceptible to root rot. Needs well drained soil in full to partial shade. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen perennial shrub (0.7m x 0.7m) from Tasmania. Thick small glabrous dark green leaves with each pair fused across the stem. Sprays of pale lilac to violet blue flowers from the upper leaf axils in spring and early summer. Useful for the rock or gravel garden. Will grow in most soils. Tolerant of partial shade. Reponds well to pruning. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen clump-forming perennial (0.6m x 1m) from Europe. Spikes of small star-shaped blue flowers with purple stamens in summer. Useful for a rock or gravel garden; border or addition to the perennial garden. Susceptible to root rot. Needs well drained soil. Prefers moist sandy soil in full to partial sun. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen compact mound forming shrub (0.8m x 1m) from China. Leathery oval dark green leaves with prominent veins. Clusters of small white flowers in summer. Useful specimen; in small groups or massed for a low maintenance shrubby groundcover. Prune to encourage mounded habit. Prefers well drained soil in full to partial sun. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen large bushy shrub or multi-branched small rounded tree (5m x 3.5m) from Asia. Large leathery dark green glossy leaves. Clusters of fragrant small white flowers in spring. Useful as a clipped hedge or screen. Left unclipped it is an attractive tree for a small garden. Cultivar 'Emerald Lustre' has larger leaves. Sensitive to soil salinity. Protect from wind. Frost sensitive.
Non indigenous (Europe; North Africa & Western Asia)

Deciduous rounded shrub (3m x 2.5m) from Europe; North Africa and western Asia. Lobed maple-like leaves. Globular clusters of flowers green at first then pure white in spring. Useful for a border; hedge; specimen or group plantings. Dwarf varieties available. Prefers moist well drained soil. Tolerant of poor soil. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen vigorous open shrub (2.5m x 3m) from China. Shiny dark green leaves with prominent deeply incised veins and felty grey beneath. Dense terminal clusters of yellowish white flowers in spring followed by red berry fruit ripening to shiny black. Useful in small groups; mixed with an informal shrub border; screen or tall understorey. Shade tolerant. Protect from strong winds particularly in high summer temperatures. Prefers moist well drained soil in a cool mountain climate. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen dense bushy shrub (3m x 2m) from the Mediterranean region. Glossy dark green oval leaves. Pink budded white flowers in terminal clusters in winter. Useful as a clipped hedge; dense screen or background plant. Sensitive to salinity. Susceptible to 2 spotted mite attack. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen spreading groundcover (0.1m x 3m) from Europe. Small glossy dark green leaves on thin prostrate trailing stems; rooting at the nodes. Sparse solitary trumpet shaped purple; blue or white flowers in spring to summer. Useful as a groundcover for shady locations. Sensitive to full sun. Invasive weed potential near bushland areas. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen tufted stemless groundcover (0.1m x 0.3m) spreading by stolons from eastern Australia (including Sydney) and Malaysia. Kidney-shaped leaves with irregularly serrate margins. White flowers with a mauve centre on fine erect stems. Useful group planted as a groundcover between stepping stones or other non trafficked areas. Prefers a protected position in semi-shade. Tolerates light mowing. Very sensitive to salinity. Frost tolerant. Drought tolerant in a favourable growing environment. Additional irrigation above natural rainfall may be required if growing conditions do not replicate the plant's natural occurrence.

Semi-evergreen spreading perennial with rhizomes (0.15m x 0.2m) from Europe. Dark green rounded to kidney shaped basal leaves. Long stems with solitary fragrant violet; rose or white flowers in spring. Useful groundcover for a cool moist position. Suitable for containers. Protect from hot afternoon sun. Self seeds prolifically. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous woody stemmed tendril climber (7m) from West Asia. Three or five lobed leaves turning red in autumn. Does not fruit. Useful for covering trellises and fences and brilliant autumn colour. Drought and frost tolerant.
Indigenous (All states of Australia (Sydney Cumberland Plain))

Evergreen small slender perennial (0.3m x 0.2m) from all states of Australia (including Sydney Cumberland Plain). Few linear to narrow elliptical leaves mostly towards the base of wiry branching stems. Sky blue to violet bell flowers in spring and summer. Useful for a rock or gravel garden or grouped for groundcover or understorey. Prefers well drained mulched soil in full to dappled sun. Frost and drought tolerant.

Semi-evergreen clump-forming groundcover perennial spreading by stolons and rhizomes (0.1m x 0.3m) from Russia; China and Japan. Toothed tri-foliate leaves arranged in rosettes. Saucer shaped yellow flowers in spring followed by edible fruit. Useful weed smothering groundcover for a bank or understorey. Invasive weed potential. Use in areas where it can be contained. Tolerates light foot traffic. Prefers well drained soil in full sun or partial shade. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen fast growing tall palm (25m x 3m) from Mexico. Large fan shaped bright green fronds with prominent red brown basal sheaths. Small cream flowers extend beyond fronds in summer followed by tiny brown berries. Useful in large gardens as a specimen or in groves for a tropical effect. Tolerant of most soil types. Prefers a sunny position. Needs high maintenance to remove persistent dead fronds.Tolerant of salt spray. Tolerant of moderate frosts.

Evergreen fast growing medium sized tree with pendulous habit (15m x 8m) from Qld and NSW. Narrow elliptical dark green leaves shiny on top and paler below. Small white flowers and green fruit. Useful as a specimen or shade tree; fast growing clipped hedge or screen. Prefers well composted soil. Frost sensitive.

Deciduous arching shrub (2.5m x 2m) from China and Korea. Oval pointed leaves. Deep pink trumpet flowers in late spring to early summer. Useful mixed with evergreen shrubs for its floral display. Prefers fertile moist loam. Thin out old stems to encourage new growth from the base. Many varieties and hybrids available. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen rounded neat shrub (1m x 1.5m) from Tas. Small elliptical silver grey leaves arranged in whorls of four. Pale bluish mauve flowers in winter and spring. Useful for a hedge; low screen or feature for the contrast of its foliage colour. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen rounded dense shrub (2m x 2m) from NSW (including Sydney). Narrow grey leaves in whorls. Flowers white to pale lavender in leaf axils throughout the year. Useful for coastal areas as a windbreak; screen; understorey or clipped hedge. High salt tolerance. Frost and drought tolerant

Evergreen small bushy shrub (1m x 1m). Cultivar of W. fruticosa from NSW. Soft grey leaves with a silvery variegation. Lilac flowers in the leaf axils throughout most of the year. Useful as a hedge; low screen or general topiary work and particularly suitable for a bush or Mediterranean garden. Tolerant of salt spray. Frost and drought tolerant.

Erect open shrub (1m x 1m) from NSW and Vic. Elliptical leaves in whorls of four. Bluish mauve flowers in spring. Useful feature or grouped for its attractive foliage and delicate flowers. Needs well drained soil in a shady position. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen open shrub with outer branches often cascading (2m x 1.5m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney) and Vic. Slender bright green linear leaves. Long lipped white; sometimes light blue flowers several times a year. Useful as a light screen or understorey for open crowned eucalypts. Prefers moist sandy soil. Frost tolerant.

Deciduous vigorous twining climber (7m) from China. Compound leaves turning yellow in autumn. Long pendulous racemes of fragrant pea-like lilac flowers in early summer. Useful for climbing over a pergola or strong support or trained into a standard. Prune to control wayward growth. Drought and frost tolerant. *Known to damage underground services, do not plant within 6 metres of any wastewater pipe.

Evergreen fast growing single stem palm (15m x 5m) from Qld. Arching pinnate fronds radiating out at all angles from the stem. Branching white flower spike occurring at the base of the crown followed by clusters of red to orange fruit. Useful for an accent; as a specimen or in groups for a tropical theme. Prefers well drained soil and deep watering. Tolerant of full sun and strong winds. Frost sensitive.

Evergreen fast growing dense columnar coniferous tree (20m x 4m). Inter generic hybrid between C. macrocarpa and Chamaecyparis nootkatensis. Flattened slightly drooping sprays of dark green leaves with yellowish undersides. Useful as a tall clipped hedge; screen or windbreak in a large garden. Hedging specimens require regular maintenance. Tolererant of hard pruning. Prefers deep well drained soil in full sun but tolerant of poorer soils. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen slow growing stout perennial with a grassy clump and dark; sometimes branched trunk (1-3m) from NSW (including Sydney); Vic; SA and Tas. Greyish grass-like radiating leaves. Tall spear-like flower spike to 4m high. Useful as a feature and in groups for its interesting form and foliage texture. Sensitive to root disturbance. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen medium sized tree (12m x 10m) from rainforests of Qld. Glossy green lanceolate leaves with reddish new growth. Clusters of bright yellow flowers with extended stamens in summer and autumn. Useful as a feature or screen. Bird attracting. Prefers a moist well drained position. Flowering may be unreliable in temperate climates. Reponds well to pruning and may be maintained in shrub proportions. Frost sensitive.

value: Evergreen spreading perennial (0.6m x 1.2m). Natural hybrid from Qld. Large woolly grey leaves. Deep yellow everlasting flowers in spring and summer. Useful specimen or clumped for foliage and flower display. Suitable pot plant. Needs full sun and well drained soil. May be short-lived requiring replacing every few years. Moderately frost tolerant. Drought tolerant.

value: Evergreen prostrate compact perennial (0.2m x 0.6m). Natural hybrid from mid north coast NSW. Rough textured green leaves with a covering of short stout hairs. Bright yellow papery flowers with orange centres in summer and remaining on the plant for months. Useful specimen or clumped for colour display. Suitable pot plant. Needs full sun and well drained soil. May be short-lived requiring replacing every few years. Moderately frost tolerant. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen tall spreading shrub or small tree (3m x 3m) from Japan. Shiny yellowish green leaves with bronze coloured new growth. Insignificant white flowers. Useful and most commonly seen as a hedge or screen May be trained into a single or multi-stemmed tree with an attractive gnarled trunk. Hardy. Frost and drought tolerant.

Evergreen basal rosetted shrub (1.5m x 1m) from South-east USA. Narrow sword-shaped leaves with a sharp spine and edged with white threads. Erect terminal spikes of bell-shaped white flowers in summer. Useful as an accent for its distinctive form. Non spiky variegated forms available. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen palm like perennial from the cycad family with a slow growing trunk (1.5m x 2m) from Mexico. Large rigid thick felty pinnate olive green leaves emerge from a central point forming a rosette. Male and female cones on separate plants. Useful as an accent specimen or grouped for a lush and textural effect. Suitable for a container. Tolerant of salt spray. Moderately frost tolerant. Drought tolerant.

Evergreen erect flowering perennial with rhizomes (1m x 0.5m) from South Africa. Arrow shaped glossy green basal leaves. White flowers surrounded by long spathes. Useful for borders; grouped in a perennial garden; bog garden or in association with a water feature. Prefers a wet or poorly drained position. Invasive potential. Avoid use near bushland areas. Frost tolerant. Drought sensitive.

Evergreen clump forming perennial (0.4m x 0.4m) from south western USA and Mexico. Felt-like grey leaves. Terminal clusters of tubular deep orange scarlet flowers in summer and autumn. Useful for a rock or gravel garden; informal border; or to spill over a low wall. Needs well drained soil in full sun. Prune after flowering. Tolerates poor soil. Frost and drought tolerant.

Annual fruiting vegetable (2m x 1m) from South America. Large lanceolate stem sheathing leaves on an erect and stout stem. Unisexual flowers. Male tassels wind pollinate female flowers enclosed in the husk. The sweet tasting cob develops in the husk of leafy bracts. Useful group planted in the vegetable garden. Sow seed in spring to summer; transplant in early to mid summer and harvest in late summer to autumn. Test cobs for ripeness when tassels begin to dry up. Remove cob by braking off. Best planted on the southern side of garden to avoid shading neighbouring vegetables. Prefers light warm fertile soil with ample water. Sensitive to wind. May require staking. Drought sensitive.

Deciduous spreading tree (20m x 12m) from Japan. Finely pointed dark green leaves with serrate margins turning yellow in autumn. Inconspicuous flowers. Useful as a shade or feature tree in a large garden. Tolerant of wind and urban pollution. Frost and moderately drought tolerant.

Deciduous basal leaf bulbs forming tufts (0.15m x 0.2m) from Uruguay and Argentina. Glossy green linear strap-shaped leaves. Leafless stems carry star shaped white flowers in autumn. Useful for mass planting in drifts; as a border or in clumps. May be left in situ for many years before dividing. Frost tolerant.

Evergreen fast growing tall spreading shrub (4m x 3m) from Qld; NSW; Vic and Tas. Dark grey green aromatic trifoliate leaves. Small white flowers in spring. Useful as a screen; tall understorey or background plant. Prefers partial shade and well drained moist soil. Frost tolerant.
Non indigenous (Qld; NSW (Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone) & Vic)

Evergreen rounded compact shrub (1.5m x 1.5m) from Qld; NSW (including Sydney Hawkesbury Sandstone) and Vic. Trifoliate grey hairy leaves with elliptical leaflets. Small clusters of pink or occasionally white flowers along the branches in spring. Useful as a specimen for its contrasting foliage colour or grouped as understorey especially in a bush garden. Prefers full sun or partial shade in well drained soil. Drought and frost tolerant.

Evergreen multi-stemmed prostrate shrub (0.5m x 1m) from mid-north coast NSW. Aromatic glossy dark green leaves divided into narrow elliptic leaflets. Clusters of small pale pink or white flowers in early spring. Useful groundcover particularly for an exposed coastal location. Salt spray tolerant. Prefers sandy well drained soil in full sun. Frost and drought tolerant.

Upright-branching, heat-loving annual of variable height depending on variety (0.3-0.7 m x 0.3-0.5 m) from Mexico. Green lanceolate leaves. Dahlia-like flower heads in a wide range of colours including white, red, yellow, orange, purple and red during summer and autumn. Useful for bright colour display; tall variety as background and lower variety for borders. Popular cut flower. Prefers full sun in well-drained soil. Protect from wind. Avoid over watering. Frost sensitive. Moderately drought tolerant.
